title: Adds a Parameter Based on First or Last Record from Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_param_extreme_record
text: derive_param_extreme_record() function deprecated favor derive_extreme_event(). Generates parameter based first last observation multiple source datasets, based user-defined filter, order group criteria. variables selected observation kept.

title: Adds a Parameter Based on First or Last Record from Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_param_extreme_record
code: derive_param_extreme_record(   dataset = NULL,   sources,   source_datasets,   by_vars = NULL,   order,   mode,   set_values_to )

title: Adds a Parameter Based on First or Last Record from Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_param_extreme_record
text: dataset Input dataset Default value NULL sources Sources list records_source() objects expected. Default value none source_datasets Source datasets named list datasets expected. dataset_name field records_source() refers dataset provided list. variables specified order by_vars arguments expected applying new_vars. Default value none by_vars Grouping variables argument specified, group observations selected separately. Default value NULL order Sort order argument set non-null value, group first last observation source datasets selected respect specified order. Variables created via new_vars e.g., imputed date variables, can specified well (see examples ). Please note NA considered last value. .e., order variable NA mode = "last", observation chosen mode = "first" observation chosen observations variable NA. Permitted values list expressions created exprs(), e.g., exprs(ADT, desc(AVAL)) Default value none mode Selection mode (first last) "first" specified, group first observation respect order included output dataset. "last" specified, last observation included output dataset. Permitted values "first", "last" Default value none set_values_to Variables set specified variables set specified values new observations. list variable name-value pairs expected. LHS refers variable. RHS refers values set variable. can string, symbol, numeric value NA, e.g., exprs(PARAMCD = "PD", PARAM =   "First Progressive Disease"). Default value none

title: Adds a Parameter Based on First or Last Record from Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_param_extreme_record
text: input dataset first last observation group added new observations.

title: Adds a Parameter Based on First or Last Record from Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_param_extreme_record

title: Adds a Parameter Based on First or Last Record from Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_param_extreme_record
code: aevent_samp <- tibble::tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD,                       ~PARAM,     ~RSSTDTC,   "1",          "PD",  "First Progressive Disease", "2022-04-01",   "2",          "PD",  "First Progressive Disease", "2021-04-01",   "3",          "PD",  "First Progressive Disease", "2023-04-01" )  cm <- tibble::tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~CMDECOD,     ~CMSTDTC,   "1001",        "1",    "ACT", "2021-12-25" )  pr <- tibble::tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~PRDECOD,     ~PRSTDTC,   "1001",        "1",    "ACS", "2021-12-27",   "1001",        "2",    "ACS", "2020-12-25",   "1001",        "3",    "ACS", "2022-12-25", ) derive_param_extreme_record(   dataset = aevent_samp,   sources = list(     records_source(       dataset_name = "cm",       filter = CMDECOD == "ACT",       new_vars = exprs(         ADT = convert_dtc_to_dt(CMSTDTC),         AVALC = CMDECOD       )     ),     records_source(       dataset_name = "pr",       filter = PRDECOD == "ACS",       new_vars = exprs(         ADT = convert_dtc_to_dt(PRSTDTC),         AVALC = PRDECOD       )     )   ),   source_datasets = list(cm = cm, pr = pr),   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   order = exprs(ADT),   mode = "first",   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "FIRSTACT",     PARAM = "First Anti-Cancer Therapy"   ) ) #> Warning: `derive_param_extreme_record()` was deprecated in admiral 1.2.0. #> ‚Ñπ Please use `derive_extreme_event()` instead. #> ‚úñ This message will turn into an error at the beginning of 2027. #> ‚Ñπ See admiral's deprecation guidance: #>   https://pharmaverse.github.io/admiraldev/dev/articles/programming_strategy.html#deprecation #> # what: Adds a Parameter for Framingham Heart Study Cardiovascular Disease 10-Year Risk Score ‚Äî derive_param_framingham
title: Adds a Parameter for Framingham Heart Study Cardiovascular Disease 10-Year Risk Score ‚Äî derive_param_framingham
text: Adds record framingham score (FCVD101) group (e.g., subject visit) source parameters available.

title: Adds a Parameter for Framingham Heart Study Cardiovascular Disease 10-Year Risk Score ‚Äî derive_param_framingham
code: derive_param_framingham(   dataset,   by_vars,   set_values_to = exprs(PARAMCD = "FCVD101"),   sysbp_code = "SYSBP",   chol_code = "CHOL",   cholhdl_code = "CHOLHDL",   age = AGE,   sex = SEX,   smokefl = SMOKEFL,   diabetfl = DIABETFL,   trthypfl = TRTHYPFL,   get_unit_expr,   filter = NULL )

title: Adds a Parameter for Framingham Heart Study Cardiovascular Disease 10-Year Risk Score ‚Äî derive_param_framingham
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars argument expected dataset. PARAMCD, AVAL expected well. variable specified by_vars PARAMCD must unique key input dataset restricting filter condition (filter parameter) parameters specified sysbp_code, chol_code hdl_code. Default value none by_vars Grouping variables variables specified by_vars populated newly created records. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value none set_values_to Variables set specified variables set specified values new observations. example exprs(PARAMCD = "MAP") defines parameter code new parameter. Permitted values List variable-value pairs Default value exprs(PARAMCD = "MAP") sysbp_code Systolic blood pressure parameter code observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered systolic blood pressure assessments. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value "SYSBP" chol_code Total serum cholesterol code observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered total cholesterol assessments. must measured mg/dL. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value "CHOL" cholhdl_code HDL serum cholesterol code observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered HDL cholesterol assessments. must measured mg/dL. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value "CHOLHDL" age Subject age variable containing subject's age. Permitted values numeric variable name refers subject age column input dataset Default value AGE sex Subject sex variable containing subject's sex. Permitted values character variable name refers subject sex column input dataset Default value SEX smokefl Smoking status flag flag indicating smoking status. Permitted values character variable name refers smoking status column input dataset. Default value SMOKEFL diabetfl Diabetic flag flag indicating diabetic status. Permitted values character variable name refers diabetic status column input dataset Default value DIABETFL trthypfl Treated hypertension medication flag flag indicating subject treated hypertension medication. Permitted values character variable name refers column indicates whether subject treated high blood pressure Default value TRTHYPFL get_unit_expr expression providing unit parameter result used check units input parameters. Permitted values expression evaluable input dataset results character value Default value none filter Filter condition specified condition applied input dataset deriving new parameter, .e., observations fulfilling condition taken account. Permitted values unquoted condition, e.g., AVISIT == "BASELINE" Default value NULL

title: Adds a Parameter for Framingham Heart Study Cardiovascular Disease 10-Year Risk Score ‚Äî derive_param_framingham
text: input dataset new parameter added

title: Adds a Parameter for Framingham Heart Study Cardiovascular Disease 10-Year Risk Score ‚Äî derive_param_framingham
text: values age, sex, smokefl, diabetfl trthypfl added by_vars list. predicted probability cardiovascular disease (CVD) within 10-years according Framingham formula. See AHA Journal article General Cardiovascular Risk Profile Use Primary Care reference. Women: Men: equation calculating risk: $$RiskFactors = (log(Age) * AgeFactor) + (log(TotalChol) * TotalCholFactor) + (log(CholHDL) * CholHDLFactor) \\ + (log(SysBP) * SysBPFactor) + Smoker + Diabetes Present - AvgRisk$$ $$Risk = 100 * (1 - RiskPeriodFactor^{RiskFactors})$$

title: Adds a Parameter for Mean Arterial Pressure ‚Äî derive_param_map
text: analysis value new parameter derived $$\frac{2DIABP + SYSBP}{3}$$ based diastolic systolic blood pressure $$DIABP + 0.01 e^{4.14 - \frac{40.74}{HR}} (SYSBP - DIABP)$$ based diastolic, systolic blood pressure, heart rate.

title: Adds a Parameter for Corrected QT (an ECG measurement) ‚Äî derive_param_qtc
text: Adds record corrected QT using either Bazett's, Fridericia's Sagie's formula group (e.g., subject visit) source parameters available. Note: wrapper function generic derive_param_computed().

title: Adds a Parameter for Corrected QT (an ECG measurement) ‚Äî derive_param_qtc
code: derive_param_qtc(   dataset,   by_vars,   method,   set_values_to = default_qtc_paramcd(method),   qt_code = "QT",   rr_code = "RR",   get_unit_expr,   filter = NULL )

title: Adds a Parameter for Corrected QT (an ECG measurement) ‚Äî derive_param_qtc
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars get_unit_expr arguments expected dataset. PARAMCD, AVAL expected well. variable specified by_vars PARAMCD must unique key input dataset restricting filter condition (filter argument) parameters specified qt_code rr_code. Default value none by_vars Grouping variables variables specified by_vars populated newly created records. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value none method Method used QT correction See compute_qtc() details. Permitted values "Bazett", "Fridericia", "Sagie" Default value none set_values_to Variables set specified variables set specified values new observations. example exprs(PARAMCD = "MAP") defines parameter code new parameter. Permitted values List variable-value pairs Default value exprs(PARAMCD = "MAP") qt_code QT parameter code observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered QT interval assessments. expected QT measured ms msec. Permitted values character value Default value "QT" rr_code RR parameter code observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered RR interval assessments. expected RR measured ms msec. Permitted values character value Default value "RR" get_unit_expr expression providing unit parameter result used check units input parameters. Permitted values expression evaluable input dataset results character value Default value none filter Filter condition specified condition applied input dataset deriving new parameter, .e., observations fulfilling condition taken account. Permitted values unquoted condition, e.g., AVISIT == "BASELINE" Default value NULL

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: Add time--event parameter input dataset.

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
code: derive_param_tte(   dataset = NULL,   dataset_adsl,   source_datasets,   by_vars = NULL,   start_date = TRTSDT,   event_conditions,   censor_conditions,   create_datetime = FALSE,   set_values_to,   subject_keys = get_admiral_option("subject_keys"),   check_type = "warning" )

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: dataset Input dataset PARAMCD expected. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value NULL dataset_adsl ADSL input dataset variables specified start_date, subject_keys expected. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none source_datasets Source datasets named list datasets expected. dataset_name field tte_source() refers dataset provided list. Permitted values named list datasets, e.g., list(adsl = adsl, ae = ae) Default value none by_vars variables parameter specified, separate time event parameters derived group. variables must least one source datasets. source dataset must contain either variables none variables. variables included output dataset. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value NULL start_date Time event origin date variable STARTDT set specified date. value taken ADSL dataset. event censoring date origin date, ADT set origin date. Permitted values date datetime variable Default value TRTSDT event_conditions Sources conditions defining events list event_source() objects expected. Permitted values list source objects, e.g., list(pd, death) Default value none censor_conditions Sources conditions defining censorings list censor_source() objects expected. Permitted values list source objects, e.g., list(pd, death) Default value none create_datetime Create datetime variables? set TRUE, variables ADTM STARTDTM created. Otherwise, variables ADT STARTDT created. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE set_values_to Variables set named list returned exprs() defining variables set new parameter, e.g. exprs(PARAMCD = "OS", PARAM = "Overall Survival") expected. values must symbols, character strings, numeric values, expressions, NA. Permitted values list named expressions created formula using exprs(), e.g., exprs(AVALC = VSSTRESC, AVAL = yn_to_numeric(AVALC)) Default value none subject_keys Variables uniquely identify subject list symbols created using exprs() expected. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value get_admiral_option("subject_keys") check_type Check uniqueness "warning", "message", "error" specified, specified message issued observations source datasets unique respect variables date order specified event_source() censor_source() objects. Permitted values "none", "message", "warning", "error" Default value "warning"

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: input dataset new parameter added

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: following steps performed create observations new parameter: Deriving events: event source dataset observations specified filter element selected. subject first observation (respect date order) selected. ADT variable set variable specified date element. date variable datetime variable, datepart copied. CNSR variable added set censor element. variables specified set_values_to element added. selected observations event source datasets combined single dataset. subject first observation (respect ADT/ADTM variable) single dataset selected. one event date, first event respect order events event_conditions selected. Deriving censoring observations: censoring source dataset observations specified filter element selected. subject last observation (respect date order) selected. ADT variable set variable specified date element. date variable datetime variable, datepart copied. CNSR variable added set censor element. variables specified set_values_to element added. selected observations censoring source datasets combined single dataset. subject last observation (respect ADT/ADTM variable) single dataset selected.  one censoring date, last censoring respect order censorings censor_conditions selected. subject (defined subject_keys parameter) observation selected. event available, event observation selected. Otherwise censoring observation selected. Finally: variable specified start_date joined ADSL dataset. subjects datasets kept, .e., subjects event censoring observation dataset_adsl. variables defined set_values_to parameter added. ADT/ADTM variable set maximum ADT/ADTM STARTDT/STARTDTM (depending create_datetime parameter). new observations added output dataset.

what: Add a basic time to event parameter
title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: subject time first adverse event created parameter. event source object created using event_source() date set adverse event start date. censor source object created using censor_source() date set end study date. event censor source objects passed derive_param_tte() derive time event parameter provided parameter descriptions (PARAMCD PARAM). Note values censor variable (CNSR) derived , first subject event second .
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  adsl <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~TRTSDT,           ~EOSDT,            ~NEWDRGDT,   "01",     ymd("2020-12-06"), ymd("2021-03-06"), NA,   "02",     ymd("2021-01-16"), ymd("2021-02-03"), ymd("2021-01-03") ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,            ~AESEQ, ~AEDECOD,   "01",     ymd("2021-01-03"),      1, "Flu",   "01",     ymd("2021-03-04"),      2, "Cough",   "01",     ymd("2021-03-05"),      3, "Cough" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  ttae <- event_source(   dataset_name = "adae",   date = ASTDT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "AE",     SRCDOM = "ADAE",     SRCVAR = "ASTDT",     SRCSEQ = AESEQ   ) )  eos <- censor_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   date = EOSDT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "END OF STUDY",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "EOSDT"   ) )  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   event_conditions = list(ttae),   censor_conditions = list(eos),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "TTAE",     PARAM = "Time to First Adverse Event"   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTAE    Time to First Adverse Event 2021-01-03     0      1 #> 2 02      2021-01-16 TTAE    Time to First Adverse Event 2021-02-03     1     NA

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: variables can added using by_vars argument, e.g., now subject time first occurrence adverse event preferred term (AEDECOD) created parameters.
code: derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   by_vars = exprs(AEDECOD),   event_conditions = list(ttae),   censor_conditions = list(eos),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = paste0("TTAE", as.numeric(as.factor(AEDECOD))),     PARAM = paste("Time to First", AEDECOD, "Adverse Event")   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-03-04     0      2 #> 2 01      2020-12-06 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-01-03     0      1 #> 3 02      2021-01-16 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA #> 4 02      2021-01-16 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: source records checked regarding duplicates respect variables date order specified source objects. default, warning issued duplicates found. Note creating new adverse event dataset containing duplicate date "Cough", passed function using source_datasets argument - see adae = adae_dup.   investigating issue, dataset duplicate source records can obtained calling get_duplicates_dataset():   Common options solve issue: Restricting source records specifying/updating filter argument event_source()/censor_source() calls. Specifying additional variables order event_source()/censor_source() calls. Setting check_type = "none" derive_param_tte() call ignore duplicates. example significant impact record chosen dates time event derivation , impact SRCSEQ output dataset, second option used. Note can also define source objects within derive_param_tte() function call .
code: adae_dup <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,            ~AESEQ, ~AEDECOD, ~AESER,   "01",     ymd("2021-01-03"),      1, "Flu",    "Y",   "01",     ymd("2021-03-04"),      2, "Cough",  "N",   "01",     ymd("2021-03-04"),      3, "Cough",  "Y" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   by_vars = exprs(AEDECOD),   start_date = TRTSDT,   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae_dup),   event_conditions = list(ttae),   censor_conditions = list(eos),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = paste0("TTAE", as.numeric(as.factor(AEDECOD))),     PARAM = paste("Time to First", AEDECOD, "Adverse Event")   ) ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 11 #>   USUBJID STUDYID EVNTDESC     SRCDOM SRCVAR SRCSEQ  CNSR ADT        STARTDT #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>        <chr>  <chr>   <dbl> <int> <date>     <date> #> 1 01      AB42    AE           ADAE   ASTDT       2     0 2021-03-04 2020-12-06 #> 2 01      AB42    AE           ADAE   ASTDT       1     0 2021-01-03 2020-12-06 #> 3 02      AB42    END OF STUDY ADSL   EOSDT      NA     1 2021-02-03 2021-01-16 #> 4 02      AB42    END OF STUDY ADSL   EOSDT      NA     1 2021-02-03 2021-01-16 #> # i 2 more variables: PARAMCD <chr>, PARAM <chr> #> Warning: Dataset "adae" contains duplicate records with respect to `STUDYID`, `USUBJID`, #> `AEDECOD`, and `ASTDT` #> i Run `admiral::get_duplicates_dataset()` to access the duplicate records get_duplicates_dataset() #> Duplicate records with respect to `STUDYID`, `USUBJID`, `AEDECOD`, and `ASTDT`. #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 6 #>   STUDYID USUBJID AEDECOD ASTDT      AESEQ AESER #> * <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <date>     <dbl> <chr> #> 1 AB42    01      Cough   2021-03-04     2 N #> 2 AB42    01      Cough   2021-03-04     3 Y derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   by_vars = exprs(AEDECOD),   start_date = TRTSDT,   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae_dup),   event_conditions = list(event_source(     dataset_name = "adae",     date = ASTDT,     set_values_to = exprs(       EVNTDESC = "AE",       SRCDOM = "ADAE",       SRCVAR = "ASTDT",       SRCSEQ = AESEQ     ),     order = exprs(AESEQ)   )),   censor_conditions = list(eos),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = paste0("TTAE", as.numeric(as.factor(AEDECOD))),     PARAM = paste("Time to First", AEDECOD, "Adverse Event")   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-03-04     0      2 #> 2 01      2020-12-06 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-01-03     0      1 #> 3 02      2021-01-16 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA #> 4 02      2021-01-16 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: first option achieved using filter, example using serious adverse events.
code: derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   by_vars = exprs(AEDECOD),   start_date = TRTSDT,   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae_dup),   event_conditions = list(event_source(     dataset_name = "adae",     filter = AESER == "Y",     date = ASTDT,     set_values_to = exprs(       EVNTDESC = "Serious AE",       SRCDOM = "ADAE",       SRCVAR = "ASTDT",       SRCSEQ = AESEQ     )   )),   censor_conditions = list(eos),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = paste0("TTSAE", as.numeric(as.factor(AEDECOD))),     PARAM = paste("Time to First Serious", AEDECOD, "Adverse Event")   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTSAE1  Time to First Serious Coug‚Ä¶ 2021-03-04     0      3 #> 2 01      2020-12-06 TTSAE2  Time to First Serious Flu ‚Ä¶ 2021-01-03     0      1 #> 3 02      2021-01-16 TTSAE1  Time to First Serious Coug‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA #> 4 02      2021-01-16 TTSAE2  Time to First Serious Flu ‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA

title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: examples, single event single censor condition. , now consider multiple conditions passed using event_conditions censor_conditions. event going use first AE additionally check lab condition, censor add treatment start date case end study date ever missing.   Note earliest event date always taken latest censor date.
code: adlb <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADT,              ~PARAMCD, ~ANRIND,   "01",     ymd("2020-12-22"), "HGB",    "LOW" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  low_hgb <- event_source(   dataset_name = "adlb",   filter = PARAMCD == "HGB" & ANRIND == "LOW",   date = ADT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "POSSIBLE ANEMIA",     SRCDOM = "ADLB",     SRCVAR = "ADT"   ) )  trt_start <- censor_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   date = TRTSDT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "TREATMENT START",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "TRTSDT"   ) )  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   event_conditions = list(ttae, low_hgb),   censor_conditions = list(eos, trt_start),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae, adlb = adlb),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "TTAELB",     PARAM = "Time to First Adverse Event or Possible Anemia (Labs)"   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTAELB  Time to First Adverse Even‚Ä¶ 2020-12-22     0     NA #> 2 02      2021-01-16 TTAELB  Time to First Adverse Even‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA

what: Using different censor values (censor) and censoring at earliest occurring censor condition
title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: Within censor_source() value used denote censor can changed default 1. example extra censor used new drug date value 2.   case results still , explained example latest censor condition always taken without event. second subject still end study date. , wanted instead censor new drug date subject one, need use filter argument, time new end study censor source object.
code: newdrug <- censor_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   date = NEWDRGDT,   censor = 2,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "NEW DRUG RECEIVED",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "NEWDRGDT"   ) )  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   by_vars = exprs(AEDECOD),   event_conditions = list(ttae),   censor_conditions = list(eos, newdrug),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = paste0("TTAE", as.numeric(as.factor(AEDECOD))),     PARAM = paste("Time to First", AEDECOD, "Adverse Event")   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-03-04     0      2 #> 2 01      2020-12-06 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-01-03     0      1 #> 3 02      2021-01-16 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA #> 4 02      2021-01-16 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-02-03     1     NA eos_nonewdrug <- censor_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   filter = is.na(NEWDRGDT),   date = EOSDT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "END OF STUDY",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "EOSDT"   ) )  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   by_vars = exprs(AEDECOD),   event_conditions = list(ttae),   censor_conditions = list(eos_nonewdrug, newdrug),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, adae = adae),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = paste0("TTAE", as.numeric(as.factor(AEDECOD))),     PARAM = paste("Time to First", AEDECOD, "Adverse Event")   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                       ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                       <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2020-12-06 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-03-04     0      2 #> 2 01      2020-12-06 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-01-03     0      1 #> 3 02      2021-01-16 TTAE1   Time to First Cough Advers‚Ä¶ 2021-01-16     2     NA #> 4 02      2021-01-16 TTAE2   Time to First Flu Adverse ‚Ä¶ 2021-01-16     2     NA

what: Overall survival time to event parameter
title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: oncology trials, commonly derived time randomization date death. without event, censored last date known alive. start date set using start_date argument, now need use different default. example, datetime needed, can achieved setting create_datetime argument TRUE.
code: adsl <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~RANDDTM,                       ~LSALVDTM,                      ~DTHDTM,                        ~DTHFL,   "01",     ymd_hms("2020-10-03 00:00:00"), ymd_hms("2022-12-15 23:59:59"), NA,                             NA,   "02",     ymd_hms("2021-01-23 00:00:00"), ymd_hms("2021-02-03 19:45:59"), ymd_hms("2021-02-03 19:45:59"), "Y" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  # derive overall survival parameter death <- event_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   filter = DTHFL == "Y",   date = DTHDTM,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "DEATH",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "DTHDTM"   ) )  last_alive <- censor_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   date = LSALVDTM,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVNTDESC = "LAST DATE KNOWN ALIVE",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "LSALVDTM"   ) )  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = adsl,   start_date = RANDDTM,   event_conditions = list(death),   censor_conditions = list(last_alive),   create_datetime = TRUE,   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "OS",     PARAM = "Overall Survival"   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDTM, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADTM, CNSR) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 6 #>   USUBJID STARTDTM            PARAMCD PARAM            ADTM                 CNSR #>   <chr>   <dttm>              <chr>   <chr>            <dttm>              <int> #> 1 01      2020-10-03 00:00:00 OS      Overall Survival 2022-12-15 23:59:59     1 #> 2 02      2021-01-23 00:00:00 OS      Overall Survival 2021-02-03 19:45:59     0

what: Duration of response time to event parameter
title: Derive a Time-to-Event Parameter ‚Äî derive_param_tte
text: oncology trials, commonly derived time response progression death, neither occurred censor last tumor assessment visit date. relevant subjects response. Note observations subjects dataset_adsl new parameter created, see filtered responders.
code: adsl_resp <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~DTHFL, ~DTHDT,            ~RSPDT,   "01",     "Y",    ymd("2021-06-12"), ymd("2021-03-04"),   "02",     "N",    NA,                NA,   "03",     "Y",    ymd("2021-08-21"), NA,   "04",     "N",    NA,                ymd("2021-04-14") ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  adrs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AVALC, ~ADT,              ~ASEQ,   "01",     "SD",   ymd("2021-01-03"), 1,   "01",     "PR",   ymd("2021-03-04"), 2,   "01",     "PD",   ymd("2021-05-05"), 3,   "02",     "PD",   ymd("2021-02-03"), 1,   "04",     "SD",   ymd("2021-02-13"), 1,   "04",     "PR",   ymd("2021-04-14"), 2,   "04",     "CR",   ymd("2021-05-15"), 3 ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42", PARAMCD = "OVR")  pd <- event_source(   dataset_name = "adrs",   filter = AVALC == "PD",   date = ADT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVENTDESC = "PD",     SRCDOM = "ADRS",     SRCVAR = "ADTM",     SRCSEQ = ASEQ   ) )  death <- event_source(   dataset_name = "adsl",   filter = DTHFL == "Y",   date = DTHDT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVENTDESC = "DEATH",     SRCDOM = "ADSL",     SRCVAR = "DTHDT"   ) )  last_visit <- censor_source(   dataset_name = "adrs",   date = ADT,   set_values_to = exprs(     EVENTDESC = "LAST TUMOR ASSESSMENT",     SRCDOM = "ADRS",     SRCVAR = "ADTM",     SRCSEQ = ASEQ   ) )  derive_param_tte(   dataset_adsl = filter(adsl_resp, !is.na(RSPDT)),   start_date = RSPDT,   event_conditions = list(pd, death),   censor_conditions = list(last_visit),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl_resp, adrs = adrs),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "DURRSP",     PARAM = "Duration of Response"   ) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, STARTDT, PARAMCD, PARAM, ADT, CNSR, SRCSEQ) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID STARTDT    PARAMCD PARAM                ADT         CNSR SRCSEQ #>   <chr>   <date>     <chr>   <chr>                <date>     <int>  <dbl> #> 1 01      2021-03-04 DURRSP  Duration of Response 2021-05-05     0      3 #> 2 04      2021-04-14 DURRSP  Duration of Response 2021-05-15     1      3

code: derive_param_wbc_abs(   dataset,   by_vars,   set_values_to,   get_unit_expr,   wbc_unit = "10^9/L",   wbc_code = "WBC",   diff_code,   diff_type = "fraction" )

title: Add a parameter for lab differentials converted to absolute values ‚Äî derive_param_wbc_abs
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars argument expected dataset. PARAMCD, AVAL expected well. variable specified by_vars PARAMCD must unique key input dataset, parameters specified wbc_code diff_code. Default value none by_vars Grouping variables Default value none set_values_to Variables set named list returned exprs() defining variables set new parameter, e.g. exprs(PARAMCD = "LYMPH", PARAM = "Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)") expected. Default value none get_unit_expr expression providing unit parameter result used check units input parameters. Permitted values variable containing unit input dataset, function call, example, get_unit_expr = extract_unit(PARAM). Default value none wbc_unit string containing required unit WBC parameter Default value "10^9/L" wbc_code White Blood Cell (WBC) parameter observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered WBC absolute results use converting differentials. Permitted values character value Default value "WBC" diff_code white blood differential parameter observations PARAMCD equals specified value considered white blood differential lab results fraction percentage value converted absolute value. Default value none diff_type string specifying type differential Permitted values "percent", "fraction" Default value "fraction"

title: Add a parameter for lab differentials converted to absolute values ‚Äî derive_param_wbc_abs
text: input dataset new parameter added

title: Add a parameter for lab differentials converted to absolute values ‚Äî derive_param_wbc_abs
text: diff_type "percent", analysis value new parameter derived $$\frac{White Blood Cell Count  * Percentage Value}{100}$$ diff_type "fraction", analysis value new parameter derived $$White Blood Cell Count  * Fraction Value$$ New records created group records (grouped by_vars) 1) white blood cell component absolute value already available input dataset, 2) white blood cell absolute value (identified wbc_code) white blood cell differential (identified diff_code) present.

title: Add a parameter for lab differentials converted to absolute values ‚Äî derive_param_wbc_abs
code: library(tibble)  test_lb <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~AVAL, ~PARAM, ~VISIT,   "P01", "WBC", 33, "Leukocyte Count (10^9/L)", "CYCLE 1 DAY 1",   "P01", "WBC", 38, "Leukocyte Count (10^9/L)", "CYCLE 2 DAY 1",   "P01", "LYMLE", 0.90, "Lymphocytes (fraction of 1)", "CYCLE 1 DAY 1",   "P01", "LYMLE", 0.70, "Lymphocytes (fraction of 1)", "CYCLE 2 DAY 1",   "P01", "ALB", 36, "Albumin (g/dL)", "CYCLE 2 DAY 1",   "P02", "WBC", 33, "Leukocyte Count (10^9/L)", "CYCLE 1 DAY 1",   "P02", "LYMPH", 29, "Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)", "CYCLE 1 DAY 1",   "P02", "LYMLE", 0.87, "Lymphocytes (fraction of 1)", "CYCLE 1 DAY 1",   "P03", "LYMLE", 0.89, "Lymphocytes (fraction of 1)", "CYCLE 1 DAY 1" )  derive_param_wbc_abs(   dataset = test_lb,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, VISIT),   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "LYMPH",     PARAM = "Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)",     DTYPE = "CALCULATION"   ),   get_unit_expr = extract_unit(PARAM),   wbc_code = "WBC",   diff_code = "LYMLE",   diff_type = "fraction" ) #> # A tibble: 11 √ó 6 #>    USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL PARAM                       VISIT         DTYPE       #>    <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>                       <chr>         <chr>       #>  1 P01     WBC     33    Leukocyte Count (10^9/L)    CYCLE 1 DAY 1 NA          #>  2 P01     WBC     38    Leukocyte Count (10^9/L)    CYCLE 2 DAY 1 NA          #>  3 P01     LYMLE    0.9  Lymphocytes (fraction of 1) CYCLE 1 DAY 1 NA          #>  4 P01     LYMLE    0.7  Lymphocytes (fraction of 1) CYCLE 2 DAY 1 NA          #>  5 P01     ALB     36    Albumin (g/dL)              CYCLE 2 DAY 1 NA          #>  6 P02     WBC     33    Leukocyte Count (10^9/L)    CYCLE 1 DAY 1 NA          #>  7 P02     LYMPH   29    Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)    CYCLE 1 DAY 1 NA          #>  8 P02     LYMLE    0.87 Lymphocytes (fraction of 1) CYCLE 1 DAY 1 NA          #>  9 P03     LYMLE    0.89 Lymphocytes (fraction of 1) CYCLE 1 DAY 1 NA          #> 10 P01     LYMPH   29.7  Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)    CYCLE 1 DAY 1 CALCULATION #> 11 P01     LYMPH   26.6  Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)    CYCLE 2 DAY 1 CALCULATION

text: uncommon analysis need whereby one needs derive analysis value (AVAL) multiple records. ADaM basic dataset structure variable DTYPE available indicate new derived records added dataset, derivation deviates standard derivation parameter.

title: Add New Records Within By Groups Using Aggregation Functions ‚Äî derive_summary_records
code: derive_summary_records(   dataset = NULL,   dataset_add,   dataset_ref = NULL,   by_vars,   filter_add = NULL,   set_values_to,   missing_values = NULL )

title: Add New Records Within By Groups Using Aggregation Functions ‚Äî derive_summary_records
text: dataset Input dataset argument specified (set NULL), new dataset created. Otherwise, new records appended specified dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value NULL dataset_add Additional dataset variables specified by_vars expected. Observations specified dataset going used calculate added new records input dataset (dataset). Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none dataset_ref Reference dataset variables specified by_vars expected. observation specified dataset new observation added input dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value NULL by_vars Grouping variables Variables consider generation groupwise summary records. Providing names variables exprs() create groupwise summary generate summary records specified groups. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value none filter_add Filter condition logical expression apply summary calculation. default, filtering expressions computed within by_vars help aggregating, lagging, ranking function involved. example, filter_add = (AVAL > mean(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE)) filter AVAL values greater mean AVAL by_vars. filter_add = (dplyr::n() > 2) filter n count by_vars greater 2. Permitted values unquoted condition, e.g., AVISIT == "BASELINE" Default value NULL set_values_to Variables set specified variables set specified values new observations. Set list variables specified value new records LHS refer variable. RHS refers values set variable. can string, symbol, numeric value, expression NA. summary functions used, values summarized variables specified by_vars. example:   Permitted values list named expressions created exprs(), e.g., exprs(CUMDOSA = sum(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE), AVALU = "ml") Default value none missing_values Values missing summary values observations reference dataset (dataset_ref) complete mapping defined summarization defined set_values_to.  variables specified set_values_to can specified missing_values. Permitted values list named expressions created exprs(), e.g., exprs(CUMDOSA = sum(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE), AVALU = "ml") Default value NULL
code: set_values_to = exprs(     AVAL = sum(AVAL),     DTYPE = "AVERAGE",   )

title: Add New Records Within By Groups Using Aggregation Functions ‚Äî derive_summary_records
text: following examples use ECG dataset basis.
code: library(tibble, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  adeg <- tribble(   ~USUBJID,   ~PARAM,             ~AVISIT,    ~EGDTC,             ~AVAL,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline", "2016-02-24T07:50", 385,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline", "2016-02-24T07:52", 399,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline", "2016-02-24T07:56", 396,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 2",  "2016-03-08T09:48", 393,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 2",  "2016-03-08T09:51", 388,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 3",  "2016-03-22T10:48", 394,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 3",  "2016-03-22T10:51", 402,   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline", "2016-02-22T07:58", 399,   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline", "2016-02-22T07:58", 200,   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline", "2016-02-22T08:01", 392,   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 3",  "2016-03-24T10:53", 414,   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 3",  "2016-03-24T10:56", 402 ) %>%   mutate(ADTM = convert_dtc_to_dtm(EGDTC))

what: Summarize one or more variables using summary functions
title: Add New Records Within By Groups Using Aggregation Functions ‚Äî derive_summary_records
text: derived record generated subject, containing mean triplicate ECG interval values (AVAL) latest measurement's time (ADTM) using summary functions within set_values_to argument.   Functions () () also often useful creating summary records. instance, example can extended flag derived records affected outliers. Note outlier flag created AVAL set summary record. Otherwise, referencing AVAL later pick AVAL summary record rather source records.

what: Adding records for groups not in source (dataset_ref and missing_values)
title: Add New Records Within By Groups Using Aggregation Functions ‚Äî derive_summary_records
text: Adding records groups source data can achieved specifying reference dataset dataset_ref argument. example, specifying input dataset adeg_allparamvis (containing extra "Visit 2" patient 1002) ensures summary record derived visit well. records, values analysis variables populated specified within missing_values argument. , DTYPE = "PHANTOM" chosen AVAL set missing.
code: adeg_allparamvis <- tribble(   ~USUBJID,   ~PARAM,             ~AVISIT,   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline",   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 2",   "XYZ-1001", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 3",   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Baseline",   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 2",   "XYZ-1002", "QTcF Int. (msec)", "Visit 3" )  derive_summary_records(   adeg,   dataset_add = adeg,   dataset_ref = adeg_allparamvis,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAM, AVISIT),   set_values_to = exprs(     AVAL = mean(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE),     ADTM = max(ADTM),     DTYPE = "AVERAGE"   ),   missing_values = exprs(     AVAL = NA,     ADTM = NA,     DTYPE = "PHANTOM"   ) ) %>%   arrange(USUBJID, AVISIT) #> # A tibble: 18 √ó 7 #>    USUBJID  PARAM            AVISIT   EGDTC       AVAL ADTM                DTYPE #>    <chr>    <chr>            <chr>    <chr>      <dbl> <dttm>              <chr> #>  1 XYZ-1001 QTcF Int. title: Derive Age in Years ‚Äî derive_var_age_years
text: Converts given age variable (age_var) unit 'years' current units given age_var+U variable age_unit argument stores new variable (new_var).

title: Derive Age in Years ‚Äî derive_var_age_years
code: derive_var_age_years(dataset, age_var, age_unit = NULL, new_var)

title: Derive Age in Years ‚Äî derive_var_age_years
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified age_var argument expected dataset. Default value none age_var Age variable. numeric object expected. Default value none age_unit Age unit. age_unit argument expected variable age_var+U dataset. gives unit age_var variable used convert AGE 'years' grouping can occur. Permitted values 'years', 'months', 'weeks', 'days', 'hours', 'minutes', 'seconds' Default value NULL new_var New age variable created years. returned values doubles integers. ' Default value none

title: Derive Age in Years ‚Äî derive_var_age_years
text: input dataset (dataset) new_var variable added years.

title: Derive Age in Years ‚Äî derive_var_age_years
text: function used convert age variable unit 'years' can used create age groups. resulting column contains equivalent years double. Note, underlying computations assume equal number days year (365.25).

title: Derive Age in Years ‚Äî derive_var_age_years
code: library(tibble)  # Derive age with age units specified data <- tribble(   ~AGE, ~AGEU,   27, "days",   24, "months",   3, "years",   4, "weeks",   1, "years" )  derive_var_age_years(data, AGE, new_var = AAGE) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 3 #>     AGE AGEU     AAGE #>   <dbl> <chr>   <dbl> #> 1    27 days   0.0739 #> 2    24 months 2      #> 3     3 years  3      #> 4     4 weeks  0.0767 #> 5     1 years  1       # Derive age without age units variable specified data <- tribble(   ~AGE,   12,   24,   36,   48 ) derive_var_age_years(data, AGE, age_unit = "months", new_var = AAGE) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 2 #>     AGE  AAGE #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1    12     1 #> 2    24     2 #> 3    36     3 #> 4    48     4

title: Derive Ratio Variable ‚Äî derive_var_analysis_ratio
text: Derives ratio variable BDS dataset based user specified variables.

title: Derive Ratio Variable ‚Äî derive_var_analysis_ratio
code: derive_var_analysis_ratio(dataset, numer_var, denom_var, new_var = NULL)

title: Derive Ratio Variable ‚Äî derive_var_analysis_ratio
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified numer_var denom_var arguments expected dataset. Default value none numer_var Variable containing numeric values used numerator ratio calculation. Default value none denom_var Variable containing numeric values used denominator ratio calculation. Default value none new_var user-defined variable appended dataset. default behavior take denominator variable prefix R2 append dataset. Using argument override default behavior. Default NULL. Default value NULL

title: Derive Ratio Variable ‚Äî derive_var_analysis_ratio
text: input dataset ratio variable appended

title: Derive Ratio Variable ‚Äî derive_var_analysis_ratio
text: user wishing calculate Ratio Baseline, AVAL / BASE returned new variable R2BASE appended input dataset. Ratio Analysis Range Lower Limit AVAL / ANRLO return new variable R2ANRLO, Ratio Analysis Range  Upper Limit AVAL / ANRHI return new variable R2ANRLO. Please note denominator variable prefix R2----. user can override default returned variables using new_var argument. Also, values 0 denominator return NA derivation. Note R2AyHI R2AyLO can also derived using function. Reference CDISC ADaM Implementation Guide Version 1.1 Section 3.3.4 Analysis Parameter Variables BDS Datasets

title: Derive Ratio Variable ‚Äî derive_var_analysis_ratio
code: library(tibble)  data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~SEQ, ~AVAL, ~BASE, ~ANRLO, ~ANRHI,   "P01", "ALT", 1, 27, 27, 6, 34,   "P01", "ALT", 2, 41, 27, 6, 34,   "P01", "ALT", 3, 17, 27, 6, 34,   "P02", "ALB", 1, 38, 38, 33, 49,   "P02", "ALB", 2, 39, 38, 33, 49,   "P02", "ALB", 3, 37, 38, 33, 49 )  # Returns "R2" prefixed variables data %>%   derive_var_analysis_ratio(numer_var = AVAL, denom_var = BASE) %>%   derive_var_analysis_ratio(numer_var = AVAL, denom_var = ANRLO) %>%   derive_var_analysis_ratio(numer_var = AVAL, denom_var = ANRHI) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 10 #>   USUBJID PARAMCD   SEQ  AVAL  BASE ANRLO ANRHI R2BASE R2ANRLO R2ANRHI #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 P01     ALT         1    27    27     6    34  1        4.5    0.794 #> 2 P01     ALT         2    41    27     6    34  1.52     6.83   1.21  #> 3 P01     ALT         3    17    27     6    34  0.630    2.83   0.5   #> 4 P02     ALB         1    38    38    33    49  1        1.15   0.776 #> 5 P02     ALB         2    39    38    33    49  1.03     1.18   0.796 #> 6 P02     ALB         3    37    38    33    49  0.974    1.12   0.755  # Returns user-defined variables data %>%   derive_var_analysis_ratio(numer_var = AVAL, denom_var = BASE, new_var = R01BASE) %>%   derive_var_analysis_ratio(numer_var = AVAL, denom_var = ANRLO, new_var = R01ANRLO) %>%   derive_var_analysis_ratio(numer_var = AVAL, denom_var = ANRHI, new_var = R01ANRHI) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 10 #>   USUBJID PARAMCD   SEQ  AVAL  BASE ANRLO ANRHI R01BASE R01ANRLO R01ANRHI #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 P01     ALT         1    27    27     6    34   1         4.5     0.794 #> 2 P01     ALT         2    41    27     6    34   1.52      6.83    1.21  #> 3 P01     ALT         3    17    27     6    34   0.630     2.83    0.5   #> 4 P02     ALB         1    38    38    33    49   1         1.15    0.776 #> 5 P02     ALB         2    39    38    33    49   1.03      1.18    0.796 #> 6 P02     ALB         3    37    38    33    49   0.974     1.12    0.755

title: Derive Reference Range Indicator ‚Äî derive_var_anrind
text: Derive Reference Range Indicator

title: Derive Reference Range Indicator ‚Äî derive_var_anrind
code: derive_var_anrind(   dataset,   signif_dig = get_admiral_option("signif_digits"),   use_a1hia1lo = FALSE )

title: Derive Reference Range Indicator ‚Äî derive_var_anrind
text: dataset Input dataset ANRLO, ANRHI, AVAL expected use_a1hia1lo set TRUE, A1LO A1H1 expected well. Default value none signif_dig Number significant digits use comparing values. Significant digits used avoid floating point discrepancies comparing numeric values. See blog: admiral handles floating points Default value get_admiral_option("signif_digits") use_a1hia1lo logical value indicating whether use A1H1 A1LO derivation ANRIND. Default value FALSE

title: Derive Reference Range Indicator ‚Äî derive_var_anrind
text: input dataset additional column ANRIND

title: Derive Reference Range Indicator ‚Äî derive_var_anrind
text: case A1H1 A1LO used, ANRIND set : "NORMAL" AVAL greater equal ANRLO less equal ANRHI; AVAL greater equal ANRLO ANRHI missing; AVAL less equal ANRHI ANRLO missing "LOW" AVAL less ANRLO either A1LO missing AVAL greater equal A1LO "HIGH" AVAL greater ANRHI either A1HI missing AVAL less equal A1HI "LOW LOW" AVAL less A1LO "HIGH HIGH" AVAL greater A1HI case A1H1 A1LO used, ANRIND set : "NORMAL" AVAL greater equal ANRLO less equal ANRHI; AVAL greater equal ANRLO ANRHI missing; AVAL less equal ANRHI ANRLO missing "LOW" AVAL less ANRLO "HIGH" AVAL greater ANRHI

title: Derive Reference Range Indicator ‚Äî derive_var_anrind
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  vs <- tibble::tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~AVAL, ~ANRLO, ~ANRHI, ~A1LO, ~A1HI,   "P01",       "PUL",    70,     60,    100,    40,   110,   "P01",       "PUL",    57,     60,    100,    40,   110,   "P01",       "PUL",    60,     60,    100,    40,   110,   "P01",     "DIABP",   102,     60,     80,    40,    90,   "P02",       "PUL",   109,     60,    100,    40,   110,   "P02",       "PUL",   100,     60,    100,    40,   110,   "P02",     "DIABP",    80,     60,     80,    40,    90,   "P03",       "PUL",    39,     60,    100,    40,   110,   "P03",       "PUL",    40,     60,    100,    40,   110 )  vs %>% derive_var_anrind(use_a1hia1lo = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 9 √ó 8 #>   USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL ANRLO ANRHI  A1LO  A1HI ANRIND    #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     #> 1 P01     PUL        70    60   100    40   110 NORMAL    #> 2 P01     PUL        57    60   100    40   110 LOW       #> 3 P01     PUL        60    60   100    40   110 NORMAL    #> 4 P01     DIABP     102    60    80    40    90 HIGH HIGH #> 5 P02     PUL       109    60   100    40   110 HIGH      #> 6 P02     PUL       100    60   100    40   110 NORMAL    #> 7 P02     DIABP      80    60    80    40    90 NORMAL    #> 8 P03     PUL        39    60   100    40   110 LOW LOW   #> 9 P03     PUL        40    60   100    40   110 LOW       vs %>% derive_var_anrind(use_a1hia1lo = FALSE) #> # what: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
title: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
text: Derives character lab grade based high low severity/toxicity grade(s).

title: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
code: derive_var_atoxgr(   dataset,   lotox_description_var = ATOXDSCL,   hitox_description_var = ATOXDSCH )

title: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified lotox_description_var hitox_description_var arguments expected dataset. ATOXGRL, ATOXGRH expected well. Default value none lotox_description_var Variable containing toxicity grade description low values, eg. "Anemia" Default value ATOXDSCL hitox_description_var Variable containing toxicity grade description high values, eg. "Hemoglobin Increased". Default value ATOXDSCH

title: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
text: input data set character variable added

title: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
text: Created variable ATOXGR contain values "-4", "-3", "-2", "-1" low values "1", "2", "3", "4" high values, contain "0" value gradable satisfy criteria high low values. ATOXGR set missing information available give grade. Function applies following rules: High low missing - overall missing Low grade missing > 0 - overall holds low grade High grade missing > 0 - overall holds high grade (high direction low direction NORMAL) high grade normal - overall NORMAL (low direction high direction NORMAL) low grade normal - overall NORMAL otherwise set missing

title: Derive Lab High toxicity Grade 0 - 4 and Low Toxicity Grades 0 - (-4) ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr
code: library(tibble)  adlb <- tribble(   ~ATOXDSCL,          ~ATOXDSCH,        ~ATOXGRL,      ~ATOXGRH,   "Hypoglycemia",     "Hyperglycemia",  NA_character_, "0",   "Hypoglycemia",     "Hyperglycemia",  "0",           "1",   "Hypoglycemia",     "Hyperglycemia",  "0",           "0",   NA_character_,      "INR Increased",  NA_character_, "0",   "Hypophosphatemia", NA_character_,    "1",           NA_character_ )  derive_var_atoxgr(adlb) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 5 #>   ATOXDSCL         ATOXDSCH      ATOXGRL ATOXGRH ATOXGR #>   <chr>            <chr>         <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  #> 1 Hypoglycemia     Hyperglycemia NA      0       NA     #> 2 Hypoglycemia     Hyperglycemia 0       1       1      #> 3 Hypoglycemia     Hyperglycemia 0       0       0      #> 4 NA               INR Increased NA      0       0      #> 5 Hypophosphatemia NA            1       NA      -1

title: Derive Lab Toxicity Grade 0 - 4 ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr_dir
text: Derives character lab grade based severity/toxicity criteria.

title: Derive Lab Toxicity Grade 0 - 4 ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr_dir
code: derive_var_atoxgr_dir(   dataset,   new_var,   tox_description_var,   meta_criteria,   criteria_direction,   abnormal_indicator = NULL,   get_unit_expr,   signif_dig = get_admiral_option("signif_digits") )

title: Derive Lab Toxicity Grade 0 - 4 ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr_dir
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified tox_description_var argument expected dataset. Default value none new_var Name character grade variable create, example, ATOXGRH ATOXGRL. Default value none tox_description_var Variable containing description grading criteria. example: "Anemia" "INR Increased". Default value none meta_criteria Metadata data set holding criteria (normally case statement) Permitted values atoxgr_criteria_ctcv4, atoxgr_criteria_ctcv5, atoxgr_criteria_daids atoxgr_criteria_ctcv4 implements Common Terminology Criteria Adverse Events (CTCAE) v4.0 atoxgr_criteria_ctcv5 implements Common Terminology Criteria Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0 atoxgr_criteria_daids implements Division AIDS (DAIDS) Table Grading Severity Adult Pediatric Adverse Events metadata following variables: TERM: variable hold term describing criteria applied particular lab test, eg. "Anemia" "INR Increased". Note: variable case insensitive. DIRECTION: variable hold direction abnormality particular lab test value. "L" LOW values, "H" HIGH values. Note: variable case insensitive. UNIT_CHECK: variable hold unit particular lab test. Used check input data criteria based absolute values. VAR_CHECK: variable hold comma separated list variables used criteria. Used check input data variables exist. GRADE_CRITERIA_CODE: variable hold code creates grade based defined criteria. FILTER: Required DAIDS grading, specifies admiral code filter lab data based subset subjects (e.g. AGE > 18 YEARS) Default value none criteria_direction Direction (L= Low, H = High) toxicity grade. Permitted values "L", "H" Default value none abnormal_indicator Value BNRIND derivation indicate abnormal value. Usually "HIGH" criteria_direction = "H" "LOW" criteria_direction = "L". required meta_criteria = atoxgr_criteria_ctcv5 BNRIND required variable. Currently terms "Alanine aminotransferase increased", "Alkaline phosphatase increased", "Aspartate aminotransferase increased", "Blood bilirubin increased" "GGT increased" Default value NULL get_unit_expr expression providing unit parameter result used check units input parameters. Compared UNIT_CHECK metadata (see meta_criteria parameter). Permitted values variable containing unit input dataset, function call, example, get_unit_expr = extract_unit(PARAM). Default value none signif_dig Number significant digits use comparing lab value another value. Significant digits used avoid floating point discrepancies comparing numeric values. See blog: admiral handles floating points Default value get_admiral_option("signif_digits")

title: Derive Lab Toxicity Grade 0 - 4 ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr_dir
text: input dataset character variable added

title: Derive Lab Toxicity Grade 0 - 4 ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr_dir
text: new_var derived values NA, "0", "1", "2", "3", "4", "4" severe grade "4" lab value satisfies criteria grade 4. "3" lab value satisfies criteria grade 3. "2" lab value satisfies criteria grade 2. "1" lab value satisfies criteria grade 1. "0" grade can derived grade "1", "2", "3" "4". NA grade derived.

title: Derive Lab Toxicity Grade 0 - 4 ‚Äî derive_var_atoxgr_dir
code: library(tibble)  data <- tribble(   ~ATOXDSCL,                    ~AVAL, ~ANRLO, ~ANRHI, ~PARAM,   "Hypoglycemia",               119,   4,      7,      "Glucose (mmol/L)",   "Lymphocyte count decreased", 0.7,   1,      4,      "Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)",   "Anemia",                     129,   120,    180,    "Hemoglobin (g/L)",   "White blood cell decreased", 10,    5,      20,     "White blood cell (10^9/L)",   "White blood cell decreased", 15,    5,      20,     "White blood cell (10^9/L)",   "Anemia",                     140,   120,    180,    "Hemoglobin (g/L)" )  derive_var_atoxgr_dir(data,   new_var = ATOXGRL,   tox_description_var = ATOXDSCL,   meta_criteria = atoxgr_criteria_ctcv5,   criteria_direction = "L",   get_unit_expr = extract_unit(PARAM) ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 6 #>   ATOXDSCL                    AVAL ANRLO ANRHI PARAM                     ATOXGRL #>   <chr>                      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>                     <chr>   #> 1 Anemia                     129     120   180 Hemoglobin (g/L)          0       #> 2 Anemia                     140     120   180 Hemoglobin (g/L)          0       #> 3 Hypoglycemia               119       4     7 Glucose (mmol/L)          0       #> 4 Lymphocyte count decreased   0.7     1     4 Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)  2       #> 5 White blood cell decreased  10       5    20 White blood cell (10^9/L) 0       #> 6 White blood cell decreased  15       5    20 White blood cell (10^9/L) 0        data <- tribble(   ~ATOXDSCH,                     ~AVAL,  ~ANRLO,   ~ANRHI, ~PARAM,   "CPK increased",               129,    0,        30,     "Creatine Kinase (U/L)",   "Lymphocyte count increased",  4,      1,        4,      "Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)",   "Lymphocyte count increased",  2,      1,        4,      "Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L)",   "CPK increased",               140,    120,      180,    "Creatine Kinase (U/L)" )  derive_var_atoxgr_dir(data,   new_var = ATOXGRH,   tox_description_var = ATOXDSCH,   meta_criteria = atoxgr_criteria_ctcv5,   criteria_direction = "H",   get_unit_expr = extract_unit(PARAM) ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 6 #>   ATOXDSCH                    AVAL ANRLO ANRHI PARAM                    ATOXGRH #>   <chr>                      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>                    <chr>   #> 1 CPK increased                129     0    30 Creatine Kinase (U/L)    2       #> 2 CPK increased                140   120   180 Creatine Kinase (U/L)    0       #> 3 Lymphocyte count increased     4     1     4 Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L) 0       #> 4 Lymphocyte count increased     2     1     4 Lymphocytes Abs (10^9/L) 0

title: Derive Baseline Variables ‚Äî derive_var_base
text: Derive baseline variables, e.g. BASE BNRIND, BDS dataset. Note: wrapper function generic derive_vars_merged().

title: Derive Baseline Variables ‚Äî derive_var_base
code: derive_var_base(   dataset,   by_vars,   source_var = AVAL,   new_var = BASE,   filter = ABLFL == "Y" )

title: Derive Baseline Variables ‚Äî derive_var_base
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars source_var arguments expected dataset. Default value none by_vars Grouping variables Grouping variables uniquely identifying set records calculate new_var. Default value none source_var column extract baseline value, e.g. AVAL Default value AVAL new_var name newly created baseline column, e.g. BASE Default value BASE filter condition used filter dataset baseline records. default ABLFL == "Y" Default value ABLFL == "Y"

title: Derive Baseline Variables ‚Äî derive_var_base
text: new data.frame containing records variables input dataset plus new_var variable

title: Derive Baseline Variables ‚Äî derive_var_base
text: by_vars group, baseline record identified condition specified filter defaults ABLFL == "Y". Subsequently, every value new_var variable by_vars group set value source_var variable baseline record. case multiple baseline records within by_vars error issued.

title: Derive Baseline Variables ‚Äî derive_var_base
code: library(tibble)  dataset <- tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~AVAL, ~AVALC,   ~AVISIT,    ~ABLFL, ~ANRIND,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM01", 10.12, NA,       "Baseline", "Y",    "NORMAL",   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM01", 9.700, NA,       "Day 7",    NA,     "LOW",   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM01", 15.01, NA,       "Day 14",   NA,     "HIGH",   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM02", 8.350, NA,       "Baseline", "Y",    "LOW",   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM02",    NA, NA,       "Day 7",    NA,     NA,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM02", 8.350, NA,       "Day 14",   NA,     "LOW",   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM03",    NA, "LOW",    "Baseline", "Y",    NA,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM03",    NA, "LOW",    "Day 7",    NA,     NA,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM03",    NA, "MEDIUM", "Day 14",   NA,     NA,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM04",    NA, "HIGH",   "Baseline", "Y",    NA,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM04",    NA, "HIGH",   "Day 7",    NA,     NA,   "TEST01", "PAT01", "PARAM04",    NA, "MEDIUM", "Day 14",   NA,     NA )  ## Derive `BASE` variable from `AVAL` derive_var_base(   dataset,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),   source_var = AVAL,   new_var = BASE ) #> # A tibble: 12 √ó 9 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL AVALC  AVISIT   ABLFL ANRIND  BASE #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>    <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #>  1 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01 10.1  NA     Baseline Y     NORMAL 10.1  #>  2 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01  9.7  NA     Day 7    NA    LOW    10.1  #>  3 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01 15.0  NA     Day 14   NA    HIGH   10.1  #>  4 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02  8.35 NA     Baseline Y     LOW     8.35 #>  5 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02 NA    NA     Day 7    NA    NA      8.35 #>  6 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02  8.35 NA     Day 14   NA    LOW     8.35 #>  7 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    LOW    Baseline Y     NA     NA    #>  8 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    LOW    Day 7    NA    NA     NA    #>  9 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    MEDIUM Day 14   NA    NA     NA    #> 10 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    HIGH   Baseline Y     NA     NA    #> 11 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    HIGH   Day 7    NA    NA     NA    #> 12 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    MEDIUM Day 14   NA    NA     NA     ## Derive `BASEC` variable from `AVALC` derive_var_base(   dataset,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),   source_var = AVALC,   new_var = BASEC ) #> # A tibble: 12 √ó 9 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL AVALC  AVISIT   ABLFL ANRIND BASEC #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>    <chr> <chr>  <chr> #>  1 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01 10.1  NA     Baseline Y     NORMAL NA    #>  2 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01  9.7  NA     Day 7    NA    LOW    NA    #>  3 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01 15.0  NA     Day 14   NA    HIGH   NA    #>  4 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02  8.35 NA     Baseline Y     LOW    NA    #>  5 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02 NA    NA     Day 7    NA    NA     NA    #>  6 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02  8.35 NA     Day 14   NA    LOW    NA    #>  7 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    LOW    Baseline Y     NA     LOW   #>  8 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    LOW    Day 7    NA    NA     LOW   #>  9 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    MEDIUM Day 14   NA    NA     LOW   #> 10 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    HIGH   Baseline Y     NA     HIGH  #> 11 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    HIGH   Day 7    NA    NA     HIGH  #> 12 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    MEDIUM Day 14   NA    NA     HIGH   ## Derive `BNRIND` variable from `ANRIND` derive_var_base(   dataset,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),   source_var = ANRIND,   new_var = BNRIND ) #> # A tibble: 12 √ó 9 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL AVALC  AVISIT   ABLFL ANRIND BNRIND #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>    <chr> <chr>  <chr>  #>  1 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01 10.1  NA     Baseline Y     NORMAL NORMAL #>  2 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01  9.7  NA     Day 7    NA    LOW    NORMAL #>  3 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM01 15.0  NA     Day 14   NA    HIGH   NORMAL #>  4 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02  8.35 NA     Baseline Y     LOW    LOW    #>  5 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02 NA    NA     Day 7    NA    NA     LOW    #>  6 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM02  8.35 NA     Day 14   NA    LOW    LOW    #>  7 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    LOW    Baseline Y     NA     NA     #>  8 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    LOW    Day 7    NA    NA     NA     #>  9 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM03 NA    MEDIUM Day 14   NA    NA     NA     #> 10 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    HIGH   Baseline Y     NA     NA     #> 11 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    HIGH   Day 7    NA    NA     NA     #> 12 TEST01  PAT01   PARAM04 NA    MEDIUM Day 14   NA    NA     NA

title: Derive Death Cause ‚Äî derive_var_dthcaus
text: derive_var_dthcaus() function deprecated favor derive_vars_extreme_event(). Derive death cause (DTHCAUS) add traceability variables required.

title: Derive Death Cause ‚Äî derive_var_dthcaus
code: derive_var_dthcaus(   dataset,   ...,   source_datasets,   subject_keys = get_admiral_option("subject_keys") )

title: Derive Death Cause ‚Äî derive_var_dthcaus
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified subject_keys argument expected dataset. Default value none ... Objects class "dthcaus_source" created dthcaus_source(). Default value none source_datasets named list containing datasets search death cause Default value none subject_keys Variables uniquely identify subject list expressions expressions symbols returned exprs() expected. Default value get_admiral_option("subject_keys")

title: Derive Death Cause ‚Äî derive_var_dthcaus
text: input dataset DTHCAUS variable added.

title: Derive Death Cause ‚Äî derive_var_dthcaus
text: function derives DTHCAUS along user-defined traceability variables, required. subject death info multiple sources, one source earliest death date used. dates equivalent, first source kept, user provide inputs preferred order.

title: Derive Death Cause ‚Äî derive_var_dthcaus
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  adsl <- tribble(   ~STUDYID,  ~USUBJID,   "STUDY01", "PAT01",   "STUDY01", "PAT02",   "STUDY01", "PAT03" ) ae <- tribble(   ~STUDYID,  ~USUBJID, ~AESEQ, ~AEDECOD,       ~AEOUT,  ~AEDTHDTC,   "STUDY01", "PAT01",  12,     "SUDDEN DEATH", "FATAL", "2021-04-04" )  ds <- tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~DSSEQ, ~DSDECOD, ~DSTERM, ~DSSTDTC,   "STUDY01", "PAT02", 1, "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED", "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED", "2021-04-03",   "STUDY01", "PAT02", 2, "RANDOMIZATION", "RANDOMIZATION", "2021-04-11",   "STUDY01", "PAT02", 3, "DEATH", "DEATH DUE TO PROGRESSION OF DISEASE", "2022-02-01",   "STUDY01", "PAT03", 1, "DEATH", "POST STUDY REPORTING OF DEATH", "2022-03-03" )  # Derive `DTHCAUS` only - for on-study deaths only src_ae <- dthcaus_source(   dataset_name = "ae",   filter = AEOUT == "FATAL",   date = convert_dtc_to_dt(AEDTHDTC),   mode = "first",   dthcaus = AEDECOD ) #> Warning: `dthcaus_source()` was deprecated in admiral 1.2.0. #> ‚Ñπ Please use `event()` instead. #> ‚úñ This message will turn into an error at the beginning of 2027. #> ‚Ñπ See admiral's deprecation guidance: #>   https://pharmaverse.github.io/admiraldev/dev/articles/programming_strategy.html#deprecation  src_ds <- dthcaus_source(   dataset_name = "ds",   filter = DSDECOD == "DEATH" & grepl("DEATH DUE TO", DSTERM),   date = convert_dtc_to_dt(DSSTDTC),   mode = "first",   dthcaus = DSTERM )  derive_var_dthcaus(adsl, src_ae, src_ds, source_datasets = list(ae = ae, ds = ds)) #> Warning: `derive_var_dthcaus()` was deprecated in admiral 1.2.0. #> ‚Ñπ Please use `derive_vars_extreme_event()` instead. #> ‚úñ This message will turn into an error at the beginning of 2027. #> ‚Ñπ See admiral's deprecation guidance: #>   https://pharmaverse.github.io/admiraldev/dev/articles/programming_strategy.html#deprecation #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 3 #>   STUDYID USUBJID DTHCAUS                             #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>                               #> 1 STUDY01 PAT01   SUDDEN DEATH                        #> 2 STUDY01 PAT02   DEATH DUE TO PROGRESSION OF DISEASE #> 3 STUDY01 PAT03   NA                                   # Derive `DTHCAUS` and add traceability variables - for on-study deaths only src_ae <- dthcaus_source(   dataset_name = "ae",   filter = AEOUT == "FATAL",   date = convert_dtc_to_dt(AEDTHDTC),   mode = "first",   dthcaus = AEDECOD,   set_values_to = exprs(DTHDOM = "AE", DTHSEQ = AESEQ) )  src_ds <- dthcaus_source(   dataset_name = "ds",   filter = DSDECOD == "DEATH" & grepl("DEATH DUE TO", DSTERM),   date = convert_dtc_to_dt(DSSTDTC),   mode = "first",   dthcaus = DSTERM,   set_values_to = exprs(DTHDOM = "DS", DTHSEQ = DSSEQ) )  derive_var_dthcaus(adsl, src_ae, src_ds, source_datasets = list(ae = ae, ds = ds)) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 5 #>   STUDYID USUBJID DTHCAUS                             DTHDOM DTHSEQ #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>                               <chr>   <dbl> #> 1 STUDY01 PAT01   SUDDEN DEATH                        AE         12 #> 2 STUDY01 PAT02   DEATH DUE TO PROGRESSION OF DISEASE DS          3 #> 3 STUDY01 PAT03   NA                                  NA         NA  # Derive `DTHCAUS` as above -
