text: input dataset new flag variable added

title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: group (respect variables specified by_vars parameter), new_var set "Y" first last observation (respect order specified order parameter flag mode specified mode parameter). case user wants flag multiple records grouping, example records happen visit time, argument flag_all can set TRUE. Otherwise, new_var set NA. Thus, direction "worst" considered fixed parameters dataset depending order mode, .e. every parameter first last record flagged across whole dataset.

title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: following examples use ADVS ADAE datasets basis.
code: library(tibble, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD,    ~AVISIT,          ~ADT, ~AVAL,   "1015",   "TEMP",   "BASELINE",  "2021-04-27",  38.0,   "1015",   "TEMP",   "BASELINE",  "2021-04-25",  39.0,   "1015",   "TEMP",   "WEEK 2",    "2021-05-10",  37.5,   "1015",   "WEIGHT", "SCREENING", "2021-04-19",  81.2,   "1015",   "WEIGHT", "BASELINE",  "2021-04-25",  82.7,   "1015",   "WEIGHT", "BASELINE",  "2021-04-27",  84.0,   "1015",   "WEIGHT", "WEEK 2",    "2021-05-09",  82.5,   "1023",   "TEMP",   "SCREENING", "2021-04-27",  38.0,   "1023",   "TEMP",   "BASELINE",  "2021-04-28",  37.5,   "1023",   "TEMP",   "BASELINE",  "2021-04-29",  37.5,   "1023",   "TEMP",   "WEEK 1",    "2021-05-03",  37.0,   "1023",   "WEIGHT", "SCREENING", "2021-04-27",  69.6,   "1023",   "WEIGHT", "BASELINE",  "2021-04-29",  67.2,   "1023",   "WEIGHT", "WEEK 1",    "2021-05-02",  65.9 ) %>% mutate(   STUDYID = "AB123",   ADT = ymd(ADT) )  adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID,         ~AEBODSYS,    ~AEDECOD,   ~AESEV, ~AESTDY, ~AESEQ,   "1015", "GENERAL DISORDERS",  "ERYTHEMA",   "MILD",       2,      1,   "1015", "GENERAL DISORDERS",  "PRURITUS",   "MILD",       2,      2,   "1015",      "GI DISORDERS", "DIARRHOEA",   "MILD",       8,      3,   "1023", "CARDIAC DISORDERS",  "AV BLOCK",   "MILD",      22,      4,   "1023",    "SKIN DISORDERS",  "ERYTHEMA",   "MILD",       3,      1,   "1023",    "SKIN DISORDERS",  "ERYTHEMA", "SEVERE",       5,      2,   "1023",    "SKIN DISORDERS",  "ERYTHEMA",   "MILD",       8,      3 ) %>% mutate(STUDYID = "AB123")

what: Flagging the first/last observation within a by group (order, mode)
title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: new variable added subject flag last observation within group. Within group (specified by_vars), order = exprs(ADT) argument specifies wish sort records analysis date select last one (mode = "last"). name new variable passed new_var = LASTFL call.   Note similar FIRSTFL variable instead derived simply switching mode = "first". Alternatively, make use desc() within sorting specified order:
code: advs %>%   derive_var_extreme_flag(     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD),     order = exprs(ADT),     new_var = LASTFL,     mode = "last",   ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD, ADT) %>%   select(STUDYID, everything()) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 7 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD AVISIT    ADT         AVAL LASTFL #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-25  39   <NA> #>  2 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-27  38   <NA> #>  3 AB123   1015    TEMP    WEEK 2    2021-05-10  37.5 Y #>  4 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-19  81.2 <NA> #>  5 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-25  82.7 <NA> #>  6 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-27  84   <NA> #>  7 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  WEEK 2    2021-05-09  82.5 Y #>  8 AB123   1023    TEMP    SCREENING 2021-04-27  38   <NA> #>  9 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-28  37.5 <NA> #> 10 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-29  37.5 <NA> #> 11 AB123   1023    TEMP    WEEK 1    2021-05-03  37   Y #> 12 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-27  69.6 <NA> #> 13 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-29  67.2 <NA> #> 14 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  WEEK 1    2021-05-02  65.9 Y advs %>%   derive_var_extreme_flag(     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD),     order = exprs(desc(ADT)),     new_var = FIRSTFL,     mode = "last",   ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD, ADT) %>%   select(STUDYID, everything()) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 7 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD AVISIT    ADT         AVAL FIRSTFL #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-25  39   Y #>  2 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-27  38   <NA> #>  3 AB123   1015    TEMP    WEEK 2    2021-05-10  37.5 <NA> #>  4 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-19  81.2 Y #>  5 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-25  82.7 <NA> #>  6 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-27  84   <NA> #>  7 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  WEEK 2    2021-05-09  82.5 <NA> #>  8 AB123   1023    TEMP    SCREENING 2021-04-27  38   Y #>  9 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-28  37.5 <NA> #> 10 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-29  37.5 <NA> #> 11 AB123   1023    TEMP    WEEK 1    2021-05-03  37   <NA> #> 12 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-27  69.6 Y #> 13 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-29  67.2 <NA> #> 14 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  WEEK 1    2021-05-02  65.9 <NA>

title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: previous example now enhanced custom values flag entries. Records flagged filled contents true_value filled contents false_value. Note normally preset "Y" NA, specified example .
code: advs %>%   derive_var_extreme_flag(     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD),     order = exprs(ADT),     new_var = LASTFL,     mode = "last",     true_value = "Yes",     false_value = "No",   ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD, ADT) %>%   select(STUDYID, everything()) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 7 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD AVISIT    ADT         AVAL LASTFL #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-25  39   No #>  2 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-27  38   No #>  3 AB123   1015    TEMP    WEEK 2    2021-05-10  37.5 Yes #>  4 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-19  81.2 No #>  5 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-25  82.7 No #>  6 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-27  84   No #>  7 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  WEEK 2    2021-05-09  82.5 Yes #>  8 AB123   1023    TEMP    SCREENING 2021-04-27  38   No #>  9 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-28  37.5 No #> 10 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-29  37.5 No #> 11 AB123   1023    TEMP    WEEK 1    2021-05-03  37   Yes #> 12 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-27  69.6 No #> 13 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-29  67.2 No #> 14 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  WEEK 1    2021-05-02  65.9 Yes

title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: example wish flag first occurrence severe AE within subject. ensure correct sorting severity values, AESEV must pre-processed numeric variable TEMP_AESEVN can passed inside order. , ensure flag first occurrence, specify AESTDY AESEQ inside order well.   Note presence AESEQ sorting variable inside order argument ensures combination by_vars order indexes unique records dataset. omitted, choice check_type = "warning" ensured derive_var_extreme_flag() throw warning due perceived duplicate records (case, first two AEs subject "1015"). sorting variables exist, duplicates acceptable, user can silence warning check_type = "none". Alternatively, warning can upgraded error check_type = "error".
code: adae %>%   mutate(     TEMP_AESEVN =       as.integer(factor(AESEV, levels = c("SEVERE", "MODERATE", "MILD")))   ) %>%   derive_var_extreme_flag(     new_var = AOCCIFL,     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),     order = exprs(TEMP_AESEVN, AESTDY, AESEQ),     mode = "first",     check_type = "warning"   ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, AESTDY, AESEQ) %>%   select(STUDYID, USUBJID, AEDECOD, AESEV, AESTDY, AESEQ, AOCCIFL) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 7 #>   STUDYID USUBJID AEDECOD   AESEV  AESTDY AESEQ AOCCIFL #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr> #> 1 AB123   1015    ERYTHEMA  MILD        2     1 Y #> 2 AB123   1015    PRURITUS  MILD        2     2 <NA> #> 3 AB123   1015    DIARRHOEA MILD        8     3 <NA> #> 4 AB123   1023    ERYTHEMA  MILD        3     1 <NA> #> 5 AB123   1023    ERYTHEMA  SEVERE      5     2 Y #> 6 AB123   1023    ERYTHEMA  MILD        8     3 <NA> #> 7 AB123   1023    AV BLOCK  MILD       22     4 <NA>

what: Flagging all records if multiple are identified (flag_all)
title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: Revisiting example, instead wish flag AEs highest severity occurring earliest date, can use flag_all = TRUE. Note now also omit AESEQ order argument need differentiate two AEs occurring day (e.g. subject "1015") flagged.
code: adae %>%   mutate(     TEMP_AESEVN =       as.integer(factor(AESEV, levels = c("SEVERE", "MODERATE", "MILD")))   ) %>%   derive_var_extreme_flag(     new_var = AOCCIFL,     by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),     order = exprs(TEMP_AESEVN, AESTDY),     mode = "first",     flag_all = TRUE   ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, AESTDY, AESEQ) %>%   select(STUDYID, USUBJID, AEDECOD, AESEV, AESTDY, AESEQ, AOCCIFL) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 7 #>   STUDYID USUBJID AEDECOD   AESEV  AESTDY AESEQ AOCCIFL #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr> #> 1 AB123   1015    ERYTHEMA  MILD        2     1 Y #> 2 AB123   1015    PRURITUS  MILD        2     2 Y #> 3 AB123   1015    DIARRHOEA MILD        8     3 <NA> #> 4 AB123   1023    ERYTHEMA  MILD        3     1 <NA> #> 5 AB123   1023    ERYTHEMA  SEVERE      5     2 Y #> 6 AB123   1023    ERYTHEMA  MILD        8     3 <NA> #> 7 AB123   1023    AV BLOCK  MILD       22     4 <NA>

title: Add a Variable Flagging the First or Last Observation Within Each By Group ‚Äî derive_var_extreme_flag
text: derive_var_extreme_flag() often used derive baseline flag ABLFL, following section contains various examples action ADVS dataset. Note derivations often convenient leverage higher order functions restrict_derivation() slice_derivation(). Please read Higher Order Functions vignette, well specific reference pages, learn . set baseline flag last observation among AVISIT = "BASELINE", can use similar call examples wrapping inside restrict_derivation() making use filter argument.   Alternatively, set baseline lowest observation among AVISIT = "BASELINE" (selecting latest multiple) can modify order argument, ensuring sort descending AVAL  ADT. Note synergy desc() mode, mode = "last" applies ordering variables AVAL ADT need reverse ordering former ensure lowest value selected also latest one among multiple preferred. relevant subject "1023"'s temperature records.   practice, baseline-setting may vary parameter parameter basis, case slice_derivation() used place restrict_derivation(). example , set baseline flag follows: temperature records, lowest value recorded baseline visit; weight records, highest value recorded baseline visit. cases, select latest observation multiple.
code: restrict_derivation(   advs,   derivation = derive_var_extreme_flag,   args = params(     by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),     order = exprs(ADT),     new_var = ABLFL,     mode = "last"   ),   filter = AVISIT == "BASELINE" ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD, ADT) %>%   select(STUDYID, everything()) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 7 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD AVISIT    ADT         AVAL ABLFL #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-25  39   <NA> #>  2 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-27  38   Y #>  3 AB123   1015    TEMP    WEEK 2    2021-05-10  37.5 <NA> #>  4 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-19  81.2 <NA> #>  5 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-25  82.7 <NA> #>  6 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-27  84   Y #>  7 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  WEEK 2    2021-05-09  82.5 <NA> #>  8 AB123   1023    TEMP    SCREENING 2021-04-27  38   <NA> #>  9 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-28  37.5 <NA> #> 10 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-29  37.5 Y #> 11 AB123   1023    TEMP    WEEK 1    2021-05-03  37   <NA> #> 12 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-27  69.6 <NA> #> 13 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-29  67.2 Y #> 14 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  WEEK 1    2021-05-02  65.9 <NA> restrict_derivation(   advs,   derivation = derive_var_extreme_flag,   args = params(     by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),     order = exprs(desc(AVAL), ADT),     new_var = ABLFL,     mode = "last"   ),   filter = AVISIT == "BASELINE" ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD, ADT) %>%   select(STUDYID, everything()) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 7 #>    STUDYID USUBJID PARAMCD AVISIT    ADT         AVAL ABLFL #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #>  1 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-25  39   <NA> #>  2 AB123   1015    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-27  38   Y #>  3 AB123   1015    TEMP    WEEK 2    2021-05-10  37.5 <NA> #>  4 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-19  81.2 <NA> #>  5 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-25  82.7 Y #>  6 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-27  84   <NA> #>  7 AB123   1015    WEIGHT  WEEK 2    2021-05-09  82.5 <NA> #>  8 AB123   1023    TEMP    SCREENING 2021-04-27  38   <NA> #>  9 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-28  37.5 <NA> #> 10 AB123   1023    TEMP    BASELINE  2021-04-29  37.5 Y #> 11 AB123   1023    TEMP    WEEK 1    2021-05-03  37   <NA> #> 12 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  SCREENING 2021-04-27  69.6 <NA> #> 13 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  BASELINE  2021-04-29  67.2 Y #> 14 AB123   1023    WEIGHT  WEEK 1    2021-05-02  65.9 <NA> slice_derivation(   advs,   derivation = derive_var_extreme_flag,   args = params(     by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),     mode = "last",     new_var = ABLFL,   ),   derivation_slice(     filter = AVISIT == "BASELINE" & PARAMCD == "TEMP",     args = params(order = exprs(desc(AVAL), ADT))   ),   derivation_slice(     filter = AVISIT == "BASELINE" & PARAMCD == "WEIGHT",     args = params(order = exprs(AVAL, ADT))   ) ) %>%   arrange(STUDYID, USUBJID, PARAMCD, ADT) %>%   select(STUDYID, everything()) #> # code: # A tibble: 2 x 4 USUBJID AVISITN AVALC  AVAL <chr>     <dbl> <chr> <dbl> 1             1 Y         1 1             2 N         0 A tibble: 4 x 6 USUBJID AVISITN AVALC  AVAL AVISITN.join AVALC.join <chr>     <dbl> <chr> <dbl>        <dbl> <chr> 1             1 Y         1            1 Y 1             1 Y         1            2 N 1             2 N         0            1 Y 1             2 N         0            2 N

title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: first_cond_lower specified, observation input dataset joined dataset restricted observations first observation first_cond_lower fulfilled (observation fulfilling condition included) observation input dataset. observation input dataset condition fulfilled, observation removed. first_cond_upper specified, observation input dataset joined dataset restricted observations first observation first_cond_upper fulfilled (observation fulfilling condition included). observation input dataset condition fulfilled, observation removed. examples see "Examples" section.

title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: variable specified new_var added input dataset. set true_value observations selected previous step. observations set false_value. Note: function creates temporary datasets may much bigger input datasets. causes memory issues, please try setting admiral option save_memory TRUE (see set_admiral_options()). reduces memory consumption increases run-time.

what: Flag records considering other records (filter_join, join_vars)
title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: example, records duration longer 30 COVID AE (ACOVFL == "Y") occurred seven days record flagged. condition flagging records specified filter_join argument. Variables records referenced variable names suffix .join. variables specified join_vars argument. records current record considered, join_type = "" specified.
code: library(tibble)  adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADY, ~ACOVFL, ~ADURN,   "1",        10, "N",          1,   "1",        21, "N",         50,   "1",        23, "Y",         14,   "1",        32, "N",         31,   "1",        42, "N",         20,   "2",        11, "Y",         13,   "2",        23, "N",          2,   "3",        13, "Y",         12,   "4",        14, "N",         32,   "4",        21, "N",         41 )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   adae,   dataset_add = adae,   new_var = ALCOVFL,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   join_vars = exprs(ACOVFL, ADY),   join_type = "all",   filter_join = ADURN > 30 & ACOVFL.join == "Y" & ADY.join <= ADY + 7 ) #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 5 #>    USUBJID   ADY ACOVFL ADURN ALCOVFL #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> <chr> #>  1 1          10 N          1 <NA> #>  2 1          21 N         50 Y #>  3 1          23 Y         14 <NA> #>  4 1          32 N         31 Y #>  5 1          42 N         20 <NA> #>  6 2          11 Y         13 <NA> #>  7 2          23 N          2 <NA> #>  8 3          13 Y         12 <NA> #>  9 4          14 N         32 <NA> #> 10 4          21 N         41 <NA>

what: Considering only records after the current one (join_type = "after", true_value, false_value)
title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: example, records AVALC == "Y" AVALC == "Y" subsequent visit flagged. join_type = "" specified consider records current one. Please note order argument must specified, otherwise possible determine records current record. Please note numeric flag created specifying true_value false_value argument.
code: data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AVISITN, ~AVALC,   "1",      1,        "Y",   "1",      2,        "N",   "1",      3,        "Y",   "1",      4,        "N",   "2",      1,        "Y",   "2",      2,        "N",   "3",      1,        "Y",   "4",      1,        "N",   "4",      2,        "N", )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   data,   dataset_add = data,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   new_var = CONFFLN,   join_vars = exprs(AVALC, AVISITN),   join_type = "after",   order = exprs(AVISITN),   filter_join = AVALC == "Y" & AVALC.join == "Y",   true_value = 1,   false_value = 0 ) #> # A tibble: 9 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID AVISITN AVALC CONFFLN #>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <dbl> #> 1 1             1 Y           1 #> 2 1             2 N           0 #> 3 1             3 Y           0 #> 4 1             4 N           0 #> 5 2             1 Y           0 #> 6 2             2 N           0 #> 7 3             1 Y           0 #> 8 4             1 N           0 #> 9 4             2 N           0

what: Considering a range of records only (first_cond_lower, first_cond_upper)
title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: Consider following data.   flag "0" results first "++" "0" "0" (excluding "0") "+" "++" first_cond_lower argument join_type = "" specified.   flag "0" results "0" (excluding "0") first "++" "0" "+" "++" first_cond_upper argument join_type = "" specified.
code: myd <- tribble(   ~subj, ~day, ~val,   "1",      1, "++",   "1",      2, "-",   "1",      3, "0",   "1",      4, "+",   "1",      5, "++",   "1",      6, "-",   "2",      1, "-",   "2",      2, "++",   "2",      3, "+",   "2",      4, "0",   "2",      5, "-",   "2",      6, "++" ) derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(subj),   order = exprs(day),   new_var = flag,   join_vars = exprs(val),   join_type = "before",   first_cond_lower = val.join == "++",   filter_join = val == "0" & all(val.join %in% c("+", "++")) ) #> # A tibble: 12 √ó 4 #>    subj    day val   flag #>    <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 1         1 ++    <NA> #>  2 1         2 -     <NA> #>  3 1         3 0     <NA> #>  4 1         4 +     <NA> #>  5 1         5 ++    <NA> #>  6 1         6 -     <NA> #>  7 2         1 -     <NA> #>  8 2         2 ++    <NA> #>  9 2         3 +     <NA> #> 10 2         4 0     Y #> 11 2         5 -     <NA> #> 12 2         6 ++    <NA> derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(subj),   order = exprs(day),   new_var = flag,   join_vars = exprs(val),   join_type = "after",   first_cond_upper = val.join == "++",   filter_join = val == "0" & all(val.join %in% c("+", "++")) ) #> # A tibble: 12 √ó 4 #>    subj    day val   flag #>    <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 1         1 ++    <NA> #>  2 1         2 -     <NA> #>  3 1         3 0     Y #>  4 1         4 +     <NA> #>  5 1         5 ++    <NA> #>  6 1         6 -     <NA> #>  7 2         1 -     <NA> #>  8 2         2 ++    <NA> #>  9 2         3 +     <NA> #> 10 2         4 0     <NA> #> 11 2         5 -     <NA> #> 12 2         6 ++    <NA>

what: Considering only records up to a condition (first_cond_upper)
title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: example deriving confirmed response oncology, records AVALC == "CR", AVALC == "CR" subsequent visit, "CR" "NE" , one "NE" flagged. records considered restricted first occurrence "CR" specifying first_cond_upper argument. count_vals() function used count "NE"s last condition.
code: data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AVISITN, ~AVALC,   "1",      1,        "PR",   "1",      2,        "CR",   "1",      3,        "NE",   "1",      4,        "CR",   "1",      5,        "NE",   "2",      1,        "CR",   "2",      2,        "PR",   "2",      3,        "CR",   "3",      1,        "CR",   "4",      1,        "CR",   "4",      2,        "NE",   "4",      3,        "NE",   "4",      4,        "CR",   "4",      5,        "PR" )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   data,   dataset_add = data,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   join_vars = exprs(AVALC),   join_type = "after",   order = exprs(AVISITN),   new_var = CONFFL,   first_cond_upper = AVALC.join == "CR",   filter_join = AVALC == "CR" & all(AVALC.join %in% c("CR", "NE")) &     count_vals(var = AVALC.join, val = "NE") <= 1 ) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID AVISITN AVALC CONFFL #>    <chr>     <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 1             1 PR    <NA> #>  2 1             2 CR    Y #>  3 1             3 NE    <NA> #>  4 1             4 CR    <NA> #>  5 1             5 NE    <NA> #>  6 2             1 CR    <NA> #>  7 2             2 PR    <NA> #>  8 2             3 CR    <NA> #>  9 3             1 CR    <NA> #> 10 4             1 CR    <NA> #> 11 4             2 NE    <NA> #> 12 4             3 NE    <NA> #> 13 4             4 CR    <NA> #> 14 4             5 PR    <NA>

title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: example deriving confirmed response oncology, records AVALC == "PR", AVALC == "CR" AVALC == "PR" subsequent visit least 20 days later, "CR", "PR", "NE" , one "NE" , "CR" followed "PR" flagged. last condition realized using min_cond() max_cond(), ensuring first occurrence "CR" last occurrence "PR". second call count_vals() condition required cover case "CR"s (min_cond() call returns NA ).
code: data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADY, ~AVALC,   "1",         6, "PR",   "1",        12, "CR",   "1",        24, "NE",   "1",        32, "CR",   "1",        48, "PR",   "2",         3, "PR",   "2",        21, "CR",   "2",        33, "PR",   "3",        11, "PR",   "4",         7, "PR",   "4",        12, "NE",   "4",        24, "NE",   "4",        32, "PR",   "4",        55, "PR" )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   data,   dataset_add = data,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   join_vars = exprs(AVALC, ADY),   join_type = "after",   order = exprs(ADY),   new_var = CONFFL,   first_cond_upper = AVALC.join %in% c("CR", "PR") & ADY.join - ADY >= 20,   filter_join = AVALC == "PR" &     all(AVALC.join %in% c("CR", "PR", "NE")) &     count_vals(var = AVALC.join, val = "NE") <= 1 &     (       min_cond(var = ADY.join, cond = AVALC.join == "CR") >         max_cond(var = ADY.join, cond = AVALC.join == "PR") |         count_vals(var = AVALC.join, val = "CR") == 0     ) ) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID   ADY AVALC CONFFL #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 1           6 PR    <NA> #>  2 1          12 CR    <NA> #>  3 1          24 NE    <NA> #>  4 1          32 CR    <NA> #>  5 1          48 PR    <NA> #>  6 2           3 PR    <NA> #>  7 2          21 CR    <NA> #>  8 2          33 PR    <NA> #>  9 3          11 PR    <NA> #> 10 4           7 PR    <NA> #> 11 4          12 NE    <NA> #> 12 4          24 NE    <NA> #> 13 4          32 PR    Y #> 14 4          55 PR    <NA>

title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: example, records CRIT1FL == "Y" two consecutive visits last visit flagged. temporary order variable created specifying tmp_obs_nr_var argument. used filter_join. temporary variable need specified join_vars.
code: data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AVISITN, ~CRIT1FL,   "1",      1,        "Y",   "1",      2,        "N",   "1",      3,        "Y",   "1",      5,        "N",   "2",      1,        "Y",   "2",      3,        "Y",   "2",      5,        "N",   "3",      1,        "Y",   "4",      1,        "Y",   "4",      2,        "N", )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   data,   dataset_add = data,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   new_var = CONFFL,   tmp_obs_nr_var = tmp_obs_nr,   join_vars = exprs(CRIT1FL),   join_type = "all",   order = exprs(AVISITN),   filter_join = CRIT1FL == "Y" & CRIT1FL.join == "Y" &     (tmp_obs_nr + 1 == tmp_obs_nr.join | tmp_obs_nr == max(tmp_obs_nr.join)) ) #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID AVISITN CRIT1FL CONFFL #>    <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <chr> #>  1 1             1 Y       <NA> #>  2 1             2 N       <NA> #>  3 1             3 Y       <NA> #>  4 1             5 N       <NA> #>  5 2             1 Y       Y #>  6 2             3 Y       <NA> #>  7 2             5 N       <NA> #>  8 3             1 Y       Y #>  9 4             1 Y       <NA> #> 10 4             2 N       <NA>

what: Flag each dose which is lower than the previous dose (tmp_obs_nr_var)
title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
code: ex <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~EXSTDTM,           ~EXDOSE,   "1",      "2024-01-01T08:00",       2,   "1",      "2024-01-02T08:00",       4,   "2",      "2024-01-01T08:30",       1,   "2",      "2024-01-02T08:30",       4,   "2",      "2024-01-03T08:30",       3,   "2",      "2024-01-04T08:30",       2,   "2",      "2024-01-05T08:30",       2 )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   ex,   dataset_add = ex,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   order = exprs(EXSTDTM),   new_var = DOSREDFL,   tmp_obs_nr_var = tmp_dose_nr,   join_vars = exprs(EXDOSE),   join_type = "before",   filter_join = (     tmp_dose_nr == tmp_dose_nr.join + 1 # Look only at adjacent doses     & EXDOSE > 0 & EXDOSE.join > 0 # Both doses are valid     & EXDOSE < EXDOSE.join # Dose is lower than previous   ) ) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID EXSTDTM          EXDOSE DOSREDFL #>   <chr>   <chr>             <dbl> <chr> #> 1 1       2024-01-01T08:00      2 <NA> #> 2 1       2024-01-02T08:00      4 <NA> #> 3 2       2024-01-01T08:30      1 <NA> #> 4 2       2024-01-02T08:30      4 <NA> #> 5 2       2024-01-03T08:30      3 Y #> 6 2       2024-01-04T08:30      2 Y #> 7 2       2024-01-05T08:30      2 <NA>

title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: example definitive deterioration flag derived deterioration (CHGCAT1 = "Worsened") parameter followed non-deterioration. Please note join_type = "" used , otherwise last record flagged.
code: adqs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~ADY, ~CHGCAT1,   "1",      "QS1",      10, "Improved",   "1",      "QS1",      21, "Improved",   "1",      "QS1",      23, "Improved",   "1",      "QS2",      32, "Worsened",   "1",      "QS2",      42, "Improved",   "2",      "QS1",      11, "Worsened",   "2",      "QS1",      24, "Worsened" )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   adqs,   dataset_add = adqs,   new_var = DDETERFL,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, PARAMCD),   join_vars = exprs(CHGCAT1, ADY),   join_type = "all",   filter_join = all(CHGCAT1.join == "Worsened" | ADY > ADY.join) ) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID PARAMCD   ADY CHGCAT1  DDETERFL #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 1       QS1        10 Improved <NA> #> 2 1       QS1        21 Improved <NA> #> 3 1       QS1        23 Improved <NA> #> 4 1       QS2        32 Worsened <NA> #> 5 1       QS2        42 Improved <NA> #> 6 2       QS1        11 Worsened Y #> 7 2       QS1        24 Worsened Y

title: Derives a Flag Based on an Existing Flag ‚Äî derive_var_joined_exist_flag
text: order argument used, checked records unique respect by_vars order. Consider example derivation CONFFL flags records AVALC == "Y" confirmed subsequent visit.   records USUBJID == "2" unique respect USUBJID AVISITN. Thus warning issued. duplicates can accessed calling get_duplicates_dataset():   example, confirmation required subsequent visit. Please note first record subject "2" visit 2 flagged. Thus warning can suppressed specifying check_type = "none".
code: data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AVISITN, ~ADY, ~AVALC,   "1",      1,           1, "Y",   "1",      2,           8, "N",   "1",      3,          15, "Y",   "1",      4,          22, "N",   "2",      1,           1, "Y",   "2",      2,           8, "Y",   "2",      2,          10, "Y" )  derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   data,   dataset_add = data,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   new_var = CONFFL,   join_vars = exprs(AVALC, AVISITN),   join_type = "after",   order = exprs(AVISITN),   filter_join = AVALC == "Y" & AVALC.join == "Y" ) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID AVISITN   ADY AVALC CONFFL #>   <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <chr> #> 1 1             1     1 Y     Y #> 2 1             2     8 N     <NA> #> 3 1             3    15 Y     <NA> #> 4 1             4    22 N     <NA> #> 5 2             1     1 Y     Y #> 6 2             2     8 Y     <NA> #> 7 2             2    10 Y     <NA> #> Warning: Dataset `dataset` contains duplicate records with respect to `USUBJID` and #> `AVISITN` #> i Run `admiral::get_duplicates_dataset()` to access the duplicate records #> Warning: Dataset `dataset_add` contains duplicate records with respect to `USUBJID` and #> `AVISITN` #> i Run `admiral::get_duplicates_dataset()` to access the duplicate records get_duplicates_dataset() #> Duplicate records with respect to `USUBJID` and `AVISITN`. #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID AVISITN   ADY AVALC #> * <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <chr> #> 1 2             2     8 Y #> 2 2             2    10 Y derive_var_joined_exist_flag(   data,   dataset_add = data,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   new_var = CONFFL,   join_vars = exprs(AVALC, AVISITN),   join_type = "after",   order = exprs(AVISITN),   filter_join = AVALC == "Y" & AVALC.join == "Y",   check_type = "none" ) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID AVISITN   ADY AVALC CONFFL #>   <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <chr> #> 1 1             1     1 Y     Y #> 2 1             2     8 N     <NA> #> 3 1             3    15 Y     <NA> #> 4 1             4    22 N     <NA> #> 5 2             1     1 Y     Y #> 6 2             2     8 Y     <NA> #> 7 2             2    10 Y     <NA>

what: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
title: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
text: Adds flag variable input dataset indicates exists least one observation one source datasets fulfilling certain condition. example, dose adjustment flag added ADEX dose adjustment information collected different datasets, e.g., EX, EC, FA.

title: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
code: derive_var_merged_ef_msrc(   dataset,   by_vars,   flag_events,   source_datasets,   new_var,   true_value = "Y",   false_value = NA_character_,   missing_value = NA_character_ )

title: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars argument expected dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none by_vars Grouping variables Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value none flag_events Flag events list flag_event() objects expected. event condition (condition field) evaluated source dataset referenced dataset_name field. evaluates TRUE least , new variable set true_value. Permitted values list flag_event() objects Default value none source_datasets Source datasets named list datasets expected. dataset_name field flag_event() refers dataset provided list. Permitted values named list datasets, e.g., list(adsl = adsl, ae = ae) Default value none new_var New variable specified variable added input dataset. Permitted values unquoted symbol, e.g., AVAL Default value none true_value True value new variable (new_var) set specified value groups least one source object (sources) condition evaluate TRUE. values true_value, false_value, missing_value must type. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value "Y" false_value False value new variable (new_var) set specified value groups occur least one source (sources) condition never evaluates TRUE. values true_value, false_value, missing_value must type. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value NA_character_ missing_value Values used missing information new variable set specified value groups without observations sources (sources). values true_value, false_value, missing_value must type. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value NA_character_

title: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
text: output dataset contains observations variables input dataset additionally variable specified new_var.

title: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
text: flag_event() object specified flag_events: condition (condition) evaluated dataset referenced dataset_name. by_vars field specified dataset grouped specified variables evaluating condition. named elements used by_vars like by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, EXLNKID = ECLNKID), variables renamed evaluation. by_vars element specified, observations grouped variables specified by_vars argument. new variable (new_var) added input dataset set true value (true_value) group least one condition evaluates TRUE one sources. set false value (false_value) group least one observation exists observations condition evaluates FALSE NA. Otherwise, set missing value (missing_value).

title: Merge an Existence Flag From Multiple Sources ‚Äî derive_var_merged_ef_msrc
code: library(dplyr)  # Derive a flag indicating anti-cancer treatment based on CM and PR adsl <- tribble(   ~USUBJID,   "1",   "2",   "3",   "4" )  cm <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~CMCAT,        ~CMSEQ,   "1",      "ANTI-CANCER",      1,   "1",      "GENERAL",          2,   "2",      "GENERAL",          1,   "3",      "ANTI-CANCER",      1 )  # Assuming all records in PR indicate cancer treatment pr <- tibble::tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PRSEQ,   "2",      1,   "3",      1 )  derive_var_merged_ef_msrc(   adsl,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   flag_events = list(     flag_event(       dataset_name = "cm",       condition = CMCAT == "ANTI-CANCER"     ),     flag_event(       dataset_name = "pr"     )   ),   source_datasets = list(cm = cm, pr = pr),   new_var = CANCTRFL ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 2 #>   USUBJID CANCTRFL #>   <chr>   <chr>    #> 1 1       Y        #> 2 2       Y        #> 3 3       Y        #> 4 4       NA        # Using different by variables depending on the source # Add a dose adjustment flag to ADEX based on ADEX, EC, and FA adex <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~EXLNKID, ~EXADJ,   "1",      "1",      "AE",   "1",      "2",      NA_character_,   "1",      "3",      NA_character_,   "2",      "1",      NA_character_,   "3",      "1",      NA_character_ )  ec <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ECLNKID, ~ECADJ,   "1",      "3",      "AE",   "3",      "1",      NA_character_ )  fa <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~FALNKID, ~FATESTCD, ~FAOBJ,            ~FASTRESC,   "3",      "1",      "OCCUR",   "DOSE ADJUSTMENT", "Y" )  derive_var_merged_ef_msrc(   adex,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, EXLNKID),   flag_events = list(     flag_event(       dataset_name = "ex",       condition = !is.na(EXADJ)     ),     flag_event(       dataset_name = "ec",       condition = !is.na(ECADJ),       by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, EXLNKID = ECLNKID)     ),     flag_event(       dataset_name = "fa",       condition = FATESTCD == "OCCUR" & FAOBJ == "DOSE ADJUSTMENT" & FASTRESC == "Y",       by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, EXLNKID = FALNKID)     )   ),   source_datasets = list(ex = adex, ec = ec, fa = fa),   new_var = DOSADJFL ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID EXLNKID EXADJ DOSADJFL #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>    #> 1 1       1       AE    Y        #> 2 1       2       NA    NA       #> 3 1       3       NA    Y        #> 4 2       1       NA    NA       #> 5 3       1       NA    Y

Refer derive_vars_dt() impute derive date date character vector date object. Default value none end_date end date assessment/event (e.g. AENDT) date date-time object column expected. Default value NULL ref_start_date lower bound -treatment period Required; date date-time object column expected. Refer derive_vars_dt() impute derive date date character vector date object. Default value NULL ref_end_window window add upper bound ref_end_date measured days (e.g. 7 7 days added upper bound) Default value 0 ignore_time_for_ref_end_date argument set TRUE, time part ignored checking event occurred ref_end_window days reference end date. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value TRUE filter_pre_timepoint expression filter observations -treatment date = ref_start_date. example, observations VSTPT = PRE considered -treatment date = ref_start_date, filter_pre_timepoint used denote -treatment flag set null. Optional; default NULL. Default value NULL span_period logical scalar. TRUE, events started prior ref_start_dateand ongoing end ref_start_date flagged "Y". Optional; default FALSE. title: Derive On-Treatment Flag Variable ‚Äî derive_var_ontrtfl
text: input dataset additional column named ONTRTFL value "Y" NA

title: Derive On-Treatment Flag Variable ‚Äî derive_var_ontrtfl
text: -Treatment calculated determining whether assessment date start/stop dates fall 2 dates. following logic used assign -treatment = "Y": start_date missing ref_start_dateis non-missing timepoint filter provided (filter_pre_timepoint) start_date ref_start_date non-missing start_date = ref_start_date timepoint provided (filter_pre_timepoint) start_date ref_start_date non-missing start_date = ref_start_date filter provided filter_pre_timepoint true. ref_end_date provided ref_start_date < start_date ref_end_date provided ref_start_date < start_date <= ref_end_date + ref_end_window. end_date provided end_date < ref_start_date ONTRTFL set NULL.applicable cases start_date missing ONTRTFL assigned "Y" . span_period TRUE, allows user assign ONTRTFL "Y" cases record started prior ref_start_date ongoing ended ref_start_date. date imputations needed done prior calling function.

code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADT,              ~TRTSDT,           ~TRTEDT,   "P01",    ymd("2020-02-24"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"),   "P02",    ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"),   "P03",    ymd("2019-12-31"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01") ) derive_var_ontrtfl(   advs,   start_date = ADT,   ref_start_date = TRTSDT,   ref_end_date = TRTEDT ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ADT        TRTSDT     TRTEDT     ONTRTFL #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr>   #> 1 P01     2020-02-24 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 Y       #> 2 P02     2020-01-01 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 Y       #> 3 P03     2019-12-31 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 NA       advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADT,              ~TRTSDT,           ~TRTEDT,   "P01",    ymd("2020-07-01"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"),   "P02",    ymd("2020-04-30"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"),   "P03",    ymd("2020-03-15"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01") ) derive_var_ontrtfl(   advs,   start_date = ADT,   ref_start_date = TRTSDT,   ref_end_date = TRTEDT,   ref_end_window = 60 ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ADT        TRTSDT     TRTEDT     ONTRTFL #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr>   #> 1 P01     2020-07-01 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 NA      #> 2 P02     2020-04-30 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 Y       #> 3 P03     2020-03-15 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 Y        advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADTM,                      ~TRTSDTM,                   ~TRTEDTM,   "P01",    ymd_hm("2020-01-02T12:00"), ymd_hm("2020-01-01T12:00"), ymd_hm("2020-03-01T12:00"),   "P02",    ymd("2020-01-01"),          ymd_hm("2020-01-01T12:00"), ymd_hm("2020-03-01T12:00"),   "P03",    ymd("2019-12-31"),          ymd_hm("2020-01-01T12:00"), ymd_hm("2020-03-01T12:00"), ) %>%   mutate(TPT = c(NA, "PRE", NA)) derive_var_ontrtfl(   advs,   start_date = ADTM,   ref_start_date = TRTSDTM,   ref_end_date = TRTEDTM,   filter_pre_timepoint = TPT == "PRE" ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 6 #>   USUBJID ADTM                TRTSDTM             TRTEDTM             TPT   #>   <chr>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <dttm>              <chr> #> 1 P01     2020-01-02 12:00:00 2020-01-01 12:00:00 2020-03-01 12:00:00 NA    #> 2 P02     2020-01-01 00:00:00 2020-01-01 12:00:00 2020-03-01 12:00:00 PRE   #> 3 P03     2019-12-31 00:00:00 2020-01-01 12:00:00 2020-03-01 12:00:00 NA    #> # ‚Ñπ 1 more variable: ONTRTFL <chr>  advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,            ~TRTSDT,           ~TRTEDT,           ~AENDT,   "P01",    ymd("2020-03-15"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"), ymd("2020-12-01"),   "P02",    ymd("2019-04-30"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"), ymd("2020-03-15"),   "P03",    ymd("2019-04-30"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"), NA, ) derive_var_ontrtfl(   advs,   start_date = ASTDT,   end_date = AENDT,   ref_start_date = TRTSDT,   ref_end_date = TRTEDT,   ref_end_window = 60,   span_period = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 6 #>   USUBJID ASTDT      TRTSDT     TRTEDT     AENDT      ONTRTFL #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr>   #> 1 P01     2020-03-15 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 2020-12-01 Y       #> 2 P02     2019-04-30 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 2020-03-15 Y       #> 3 P03     2019-04-30 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 NA         Y        advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,            ~AP01SDT,          ~AP01EDT,          ~AENDT,   "P01",    ymd("2020-03-15"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"), ymd("2020-12-01"),   "P02",    ymd("2019-04-30"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"), ymd("2020-03-15"),   "P03",    ymd("2019-04-30"), ymd("2020-01-01"), ymd("2020-03-01"), NA, ) derive_var_ontrtfl(   advs,   new_var = ONTR01FL,   start_date = ASTDT,   end_date = AENDT,   ref_start_date = AP01SDT,   ref_end_date = AP01EDT,   span_period = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 6 #>   USUBJID ASTDT      AP01SDT    AP01EDT    AENDT      ONTR01FL #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr>    #> 1 P01     2020-03-15 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 2020-12-01 NA       #> 2 P02     2019-04-30 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 2020-03-15 Y        #> 3 P03     2019-04-30 2020-01-01 2020-03-01 NA         Y

code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  # Flag all AEs after the first COVID AE adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDY, ~ACOVFL, ~AESEQ,   "1",           2, NA,           1,   "1",           5, "Y",          2,   "1",           5, NA,           3,   "1",          17, NA,           4,   "1",          27, "Y",          5,   "1",          32, NA,           6,   "2",           8, NA,           1,   "2",          11, NA,           2, )  derive_var_relative_flag(   adae,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   order = exprs(ASTDY, AESEQ),   new_var = PSTCOVFL,   condition = ACOVFL == "Y",   mode = "first",   selection = "after",   inclusive = FALSE,   flag_no_ref_groups = FALSE ) #> # A tibble: 8 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ASTDY ACOVFL AESEQ PSTCOVFL #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> <chr>    #> 1 1           2 NA         1 NA       #> 2 1           5 Y          2 NA       #> 3 1           5 NA         3 Y        #> 4 1          17 NA         4 Y        #> 5 1          27 Y          5 Y        #> 6 1          32 NA         6 Y        #> 7 2           8 NA         1 NA       #> 8 2          11 NA         2 NA        response <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AVISITN, ~AVALC,   "1",      0,        "PR",   "1",      1,        "CR",   "1",      2,        "CR",   "1",      3,        "SD",   "1",      4,        "NE",   "2",      0,        "SD",   "2",      1,        "PD",   "2",      2,        "PD",   "3",      0,        "SD",   "4",      0,        "SD",   "4",      1,        "PR",   "4",      2,        "PD",   "4",      3,        "SD",   "4",      4,        "PR" )  # Flag observations up to first PD for each patient response %>%   derive_var_relative_flag(     by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),     order = exprs(AVISITN),     new_var = ANL02FL,     condition = AVALC == "PD",     mode = "first",     selection = "before",     inclusive = TRUE   ) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID AVISITN AVALC ANL02FL #>    <chr>     <dbl> <chr> <chr>   #>  1 1             0 PR    Y       #>  2 1             1 CR    Y       #>  3 1             2 CR    Y       #>  4 1             3 SD    Y       #>  5 1             4 NE    Y       #>  6 2             0 SD    Y       #>  7 2             1 PD    Y       #>  8 2             2 PD    NA      #>  9 3             0 SD    Y       #> 10 4             0 SD    Y       #> 11 4             1 PR    Y       #> 12 4             2 PD    Y       #> 13 4             3 SD    NA      #> 14 4             4 PR    NA       # Flag observations up to first PD excluding baseline (AVISITN = 0) for each patient response %>%   restrict_derivation(     derivation = derive_var_relative_flag,     args = params(       by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),       order = exprs(AVISITN),       new_var = ANL02FL,       condition = AVALC == "PD",       mode = "first",       selection = "before",       inclusive = TRUE     ),     filter = AVISITN > 0   ) %>%   arrange(USUBJID, AVISITN) #> # A tibble: 14 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID AVISITN AVALC ANL02FL #>    <chr>     <dbl> <chr> <chr>   #>  1 1             0 PR    NA      #>  2 1             1 CR    Y       #>  3 1             2 CR    Y       #>  4 1             3 SD    Y       #>  5 1             4 NE    Y       #>  6 2             0 SD    NA      #>  7 2             1 PD    Y       #>  8 2             2 PD    NA      #>  9 3             0 SD    NA      #> 10 4             0 SD    NA      #> 11 4             1 PR    Y       #> 12 4             2 PD    Y       #> 13 4             3 SD    NA      #> 14 4             4 PR    NA

title: Derive Shift ‚Äî derive_var_shift
code: library(tibble)  data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~AVAL, ~ABLFL, ~BNRIND,  ~ANRIND,   "P01",    "ALB",       33, "Y",    "LOW",    "LOW",   "P01",    "ALB",       38, NA,     "LOW",    "NORMAL",   "P01",    "ALB",       NA, NA,     "LOW",    NA,   "P02",    "ALB",       37, "Y",    "NORMAL", "NORMAL",   "P02",    "ALB",       49, NA,     "NORMAL", "HIGH",   "P02",    "SODIUM",   147, "Y",    "HIGH",   "HIGH" )  data %>%   convert_blanks_to_na() %>%   derive_var_shift(     new_var = SHIFT1,     from_var = BNRIND,     to_var = ANRIND   ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL ABLFL BNRIND ANRIND SHIFT1           #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>            #> 1 P01     ALB        33 Y     LOW    LOW    LOW to LOW       #> 2 P01     ALB        38 NA    LOW    NORMAL LOW to NORMAL    #> 3 P01     ALB        NA NA    LOW    NA     LOW to NULL      #> 4 P02     ALB        37 Y     NORMAL NORMAL NORMAL to NORMAL #> 5 P02     ALB        49 NA    NORMAL HIGH   NORMAL to HIGH   #> 6 P02     SODIUM    147 Y     HIGH   HIGH   HIGH to HIGH      # or only populate post-baseline records data %>%   convert_blanks_to_na() %>%   restrict_derivation(     derivation = derive_var_shift,     args = params(       new_var = SHIFT1,       from_var = BNRIND,       to_var = ANRIND     ),     filter = is.na(ABLFL)   ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID PARAMCD  AVAL ABLFL BNRIND ANRIND SHIFT1         #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>          #> 1 P01     ALB        38 NA    LOW    NORMAL LOW to NORMAL  #> 2 P01     ALB        NA NA    LOW    NA     LOW to NULL    #> 3 P02     ALB        49 NA    NORMAL HIGH   NORMAL to HIGH #> 4 P01     ALB        33 Y     LOW    LOW    NA             #> 5 P02     ALB        37 Y     NORMAL NORMAL NA             #> 6 P02     SODIUM    147 Y     HIGH   HIGH   NA

code: derive_var_trtemfl(   dataset,   new_var = TRTEMFL,   start_date = ASTDTM,   end_date = AENDTM,   trt_start_date = TRTSDTM,   trt_end_date = NULL,   end_window = NULL,   ignore_time_for_trt_end = TRUE,   initial_intensity = NULL,   intensity = NULL,   group_var = NULL,   subject_keys = get_admiral_option("subject_keys") )

title: Derive Treatment-emergent Flag ‚Äî derive_var_trtemfl
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified start_date, end_date, trt_start_date, trt_end_date, initial_intensity, intensity expected. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none new_var New variable Permitted values unquoted symbol, e.g., AVAL Default value TRTEMFL start_date Event start date Permitted values date datetime variable Default value ASTDTM end_date Event end date Permitted values date datetime variable Default value AENDTM trt_start_date Treatment start date Permitted values date datetime variable Default value TRTSDTM trt_end_date Treatment end date Permitted values date datetime variable Default value NULL end_window argument specified ('days'), events starting specified number days end treatment, flagged. Permitted values positive integer, e.g. 2 5 Default value NULL ignore_time_for_trt_end argument set TRUE, time part ignored checking event occurred end_window days end treatment. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value TRUE initial_intensity Initial severity/intensity toxicity initial_intensity ignored group_var specified. argument specified group_var NULL, events start treatment start end treatment start (ongoing) worsened (.e., intensity greater initial intensity), flagged. values specified variable must comparable usual comparison operators. .e., intensity greater initial intensity initial_intensity < intensity must evaluate TRUE. Permitted values unquoted symbol, e.g., AVAL Default value NULL intensity Severity/intensity toxicity argument specified, events start treatment start end treatment start (ongoing) worsened (.e., intensity greater initial intensity), flagged. values specified variable must comparable usual comparison operators. .e., intensity greater initial intensity initial_intensity < intensity must evaluate TRUE. Permitted values unquoted symbol, e.g., AVAL Default value NULL group_var Grouping variable argument specified, assumes AEs recorded one episode AE multiple lines using grouping variable. Events starting treatment treatment worsening afterward flagged. AE record group flagged, subsequent records treatment window flagged regardless severity. Permitted values unquoted symbol, e.g., AVAL Default value NULL subject_keys Variables uniquely identify subject. argument used group_var specified. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value get_admiral_option("subject_keys")

text: input dataset variable specified new_var added

title: Derive Treatment-emergent Flag ‚Äî derive_var_trtemfl
text: derivation new variable following cases considered order. first case applies, defines value variable. treated: trt_start_date NA, set NA_character_. event treatment: end_date trt_start_date (end_date NA), set NA_character_. event date: start_date NA, set "Y" cases usually considered conservative assume event treatment-emergent. event started treatment: end_window specified: start_date trt_start_date, set "Y", end_window specified: start_date trt_start_date start_date trt_end_date + end_window days, set "Y", event started treatment (possibly) worsened treatment: initial_intensity, intensity specified group_var specified: initial_intensity < intensity start_date trt_start_date end_date trt_start_date end_date NA, set "Y"; group_var specified: intensity treatment start < intensity start_date trt_start_date end_date trt_start_date end_date NA, set "Y"; Otherwise set NA_character_. behavior derive_var_trtemfl() aligned proposed treatment-emergent AE assignment following PHUSE White Paper. See final example examples section .

title: Derive Treatment-emergent Flag ‚Äî derive_var_trtemfl
text: Derive TRTEMFL without considering treatment end worsening basic example, using AE start/end dates comparing treatment start date. AE started treatment flag treatment-emergent (e.g. records 5-7). missing AE start date flag treatment-emergent worst case (e.g. records 8, 11 13), unless know AE end date treatment can rule treatment-emergent (e.g. record 12). treated subject get AEs flagged treatment-emergent (e.g. records 14-16).

what: Considering treatment end date (trt_end_date and end_window)
title: Derive Treatment-emergent Flag ‚Äî derive_var_trtemfl
text: Derive TRTEMFL taking treatment end window account addition treatment-emergent checks explained example, now supply treatment end date, trt_end_date = TRTEDT end window, end_window = 10. , AE started treatment end date + 10 days considered treatment-emergent. Otherwise, starting treatment end window longer flagged treatment-emergent (e.g. record 7).

title: Derive Treatment-emergent Flag ‚Äî derive_var_trtemfl
text: Derive new variable named TRTEM2FL taking worsening treatment start account also now start look changes intensity following treatment start using initial_intensity intensity arguments. impacts AEs starting treatment, ending treatment (missing AE end date). can additionally consider treatment-emergence AE ongoing start treatment may worsened result treatment,  .e. extreme intensity greater initial intensity (e.g. records 3 9).

what: Worsening when the same AE is collected over multiple records (intensity and group_var)
title: Derive Treatment-emergent Flag ‚Äî derive_var_trtemfl
text: Derive TRTEMFL taking worsening treatment account within grouping variable Firstly, understand records correspond AE, need supply grouping variable (group_var). example works similar way one, initial intensity use intensity AE time treatment start. ongoing AE increases intensity treatment start (.e. worsens), point records considered treatment-emergent, unless treatment end window (e.g. records 4, 6 7).
code: adae2 <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,            ~AENDT,            ~AETOXGR, ~AEGRPID,   # ongoing AE where intensity drops after treatment start   "1",      ymd("2021-12-31"), ymd("2022-01-01"), "3",      "1",   "1",      ymd("2022-01-02"), ymd("2022-01-11"), "2",      "1",   # ongoing AE where intensity increases after treatment start   "1",      ymd("2021-12-31"), ymd("2022-01-01"), "1",      "2",   "1",      ymd("2022-01-02"), ymd("2022-01-11"), "2",      "2",   # ongoing AE where intensity increases after treatment start and then drops   "1",      ymd("2021-12-31"), ymd("2022-01-01"), "1",      "3",   "1",      ymd("2022-01-02"), ymd("2022-01-11"), "2",      "3",   "1",      ymd("2022-01-12"), ymd("2022-01-15"), "1",      "3" ) %>%   mutate(     STUDYID = "AB42",     TRTSDT = if_else(USUBJID == "1", ymd("2022-01-01"), NA),     TRTEDT = if_else(USUBJID == "1", ymd("2022-04-30"), NA)   )  derive_var_trtemfl(   adae2,   start_date = ASTDT,   end_date = AENDT,   trt_start_date = TRTSDT,   trt_end_date = TRTEDT,   end_window = 10,   intensity = AETOXGR,   group_var = AEGRPID ) %>% select(USUBJID, TRTSDT, ASTDT, AENDT, AETOXGR, AEGRPID, TRTEMFL) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID TRTSDT     ASTDT      AENDT      AETOXGR AEGRPID TRTEMFL #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr> #> 1 1       2022-01-01 2021-12-31 2022-01-01 3       1       <NA> #> 2 1       2022-01-01 2022-01-02 2022-01-11 2       1       <NA> #> 3 1       2022-01-01 2021-12-31 2022-01-01 1       2       <NA> #> 4 1       2022-01-01 2022-01-02 2022-01-11 2       2       Y #> 5 1       2022-01-01 2021-12-31 2022-01-01 1       3       <NA> #> 6 1       2022-01-01 2022-01-02 2022-01-11 2       3       Y #> 7 1       2022-01-01 2022-01-12 2022-01-15 1       3       Y

title: Derive Analysis Age ‚Äî derive_vars_aage
text: duration derived time start end date specified output unit. end date start date, duration negative. start end date variable must present specified input dataset. lubridate package calculates two types spans two dates: duration interval. calculations largely , unit time period month year result can slightly different. difference arises ambiguity length "1 month" "1 year". Months may 31, 30, 28, 29 days, years 365 days 366 leap years. Durations intervals help solve ambiguity measures. interval 2000-02-01 2000-03-01 1 (.e. one month). duration two dates 0.95, accounts fact year 2000 leap year, February 29 days, average month length 30.4375, .e. 29 / 30.4375 = 0.95. additional details, review lubridate time span reference page.

code: derive_vars_cat(dataset, definition, by_vars = NULL)

title: Derive Categorization Variables Like AVALCATy and AVALCAyN ‚Äî derive_vars_cat
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars definition arguments expected dataset. Default value none definition List expressions created exprs(). Must rectangular format specified using syntax creating tibble using tribble() function. definition object converted tibble using tribble() inside function. Must contain: column condition converted logical expression used dataset input. least one additional column new column name category value(s) used logical expression. column specified by_vars (by_vars specified) e.g. by_vars specified:   e.g. by_vars specified exprs(VSTEST):   Default value none by_vars list expressions one element. NULL default. Allows specifying groups, e.g. exprs(PARAMCD). Variable must present dataset definition. conditions definition applied records match by_vars. categorization variables set NA records matching groups definition. Default value NULL
code: exprs(~condition,   ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,       AVAL >= 140, ">=140 cm",         1,       AVAL < 140,   "<140 cm",         2) exprs(~VSTEST,   ~condition,  ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,       "Height", AVAL >= 140, ">=140 cm",         1,       "Height",  AVAL < 140,  "<140 cm",         2)

title: Derive Categorization Variables Like AVALCATy and AVALCAyN ‚Äî derive_vars_cat
text: input dataset new variables defined definition added

title: Derive Categorization Variables Like AVALCATy and AVALCAyN ‚Äî derive_vars_cat
text: conditions overlapping, row order definitions must carefully considered. first match determine category. .e. AVAL = 155 definition :   AVALCAT1 "<=170 cm", first match AVAL. specify:   AVAL <= 160 lead AVALCAT1 == "<=160 cm", AVAL -160 170 lead AVALCAT1 == "<=170 cm", AVAL <= 170 lead AVALCAT1 == ">170 cm". However, suggest explicit defining condition, avoid overlap. case, middle condition : AVAL <= 170 & AVAL > 160
code: definition <- exprs(   ~VSTEST,   ~condition,  ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,   "Height",  AVAL > 170,  ">170 cm",         1,   "Height", AVAL <= 170, "<=170 cm",         2,   "Height", AVAL <= 160, "<=160 cm",         3 ) definition <- exprs(   ~VSTEST,   ~condition,  ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,   "Height", AVAL <= 160, "<=160 cm",         3,   "Height", AVAL <= 170, "<=170 cm",         2,   "Height",  AVAL > 170,  ">170 cm",         1 )

title: Derive Categorization Variables Like AVALCATy and AVALCAyN ‚Äî derive_vars_cat
code: library(dplyr) library(tibble)  advs <- tibble::tribble(   ~USUBJID,       ~VSTEST,  ~AVAL,   "01-701-1015", "Height", 147.32,   "01-701-1015", "Weight",  53.98,   "01-701-1023", "Height", 162.56,   "01-701-1023", "Weight",     NA,   "01-701-1028", "Height",     NA,   "01-701-1028", "Weight",     NA,   "01-701-1033", "Height", 175.26,   "01-701-1033", "Weight",  88.45 )  definition <- exprs(   ~condition,                        ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,  ~NEWCOL,   VSTEST == "Height" & AVAL > 160,   ">160 cm",         1, "extra1",   VSTEST == "Height" & AVAL <= 160, "<=160 cm",         2, "extra2" ) derive_vars_cat(   dataset = advs,   definition = definition ) #> # A tibble: 8 √ó 6 #>   USUBJID     VSTEST  AVAL AVALCAT1 AVALCA1N NEWCOL #>   <chr>       <chr>  <dbl> <chr>       <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 01-701-1015 Height 147.  <=160 cm        2 extra2 #> 2 01-701-1015 Weight  54.0 NA             NA NA     #> 3 01-701-1023 Height 163.  >160 cm         1 extra1 #> 4 01-701-1023 Weight  NA   NA             NA NA     #> 5 01-701-1028 Height  NA   NA             NA NA     #> 6 01-701-1028 Weight  NA   NA             NA NA     #> 7 01-701-1033 Height 175.  >160 cm         1 extra1 #> 8 01-701-1033 Weight  88.4 NA             NA NA      # Using by_vars: definition2 <- exprs(   ~VSTEST,   ~condition,  ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,   "Height",  AVAL > 160,  ">160 cm",         1,   "Height", AVAL <= 160, "<=160 cm",         2,   "Weight",   AVAL > 70,   ">70 kg",         1,   "Weight",  AVAL <= 70,  "<=70 kg",         2 )  derive_vars_cat(   dataset = advs,   definition = definition2,   by_vars = exprs(VSTEST) ) #> # A tibble: 8 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID     VSTEST  AVAL AVALCAT1 AVALCA1N #>   <chr>       <chr>  <dbl> <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 01-701-1015 Height 147.  <=160 cm        2 #> 2 01-701-1015 Weight  54.0 <=70 kg         2 #> 3 01-701-1023 Height 163.  >160 cm         1 #> 4 01-701-1023 Weight  NA   NA             NA #> 5 01-701-1028 Height  NA   NA             NA #> 6 01-701-1028 Weight  NA   NA             NA #> 7 01-701-1033 Height 175.  >160 cm         1 #> 8 01-701-1033 Weight  88.4 >70 kg          1  # With three conditions: definition3 <- exprs(   ~VSTEST,                ~condition,  ~AVALCAT1, ~AVALCA1N,   "Height",               AVAL > 170,  ">170 cm",         1,   "Height", AVAL <= 170 & AVAL > 160, "<=170 cm",         2,   "Height",              AVAL <= 160, "<=160 cm",         3 )  derive_vars_cat(   dataset = advs,   definition = definition3,   by_vars = exprs(VSTEST) ) #> # A tibble: 8 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID     VSTEST  AVAL AVALCAT1 AVALCA1N #>   <chr>       <chr>  <dbl> <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 01-701-1015 Height 147.  <=160 cm        3 #> 2 01-701-1015 Weight  54.0 NA             NA #> 3 01-701-1023 Height 163.  <=170 cm        2 #> 4 01-701-1023 Weight  NA   NA             NA #> 5 01-701-1028 Height  NA   NA             NA #> 6 01-701-1028 Weight  NA   NA             NA #> 7 01-701-1033 Height 175.  >170 cm         1 #> 8 01-701-1033 Weight  88.4 NA             NA  # Let's derive both the MCRITyML and the MCRITyMN variables adlb <- tibble::tribble(   ~USUBJID,     ~PARAM, ~AVAL, ~AVALU,  ~ANRHI,   "01-701-1015", "ALT",   150,  "U/L",      40,   "01-701-1023", "ALT",    70,  "U/L",      40,   "01-701-1036", "ALT",   130,  "U/L",      40,   "01-701-1048", "ALT",    30,  "U/L",      40,   "01-701-1015", "AST",    50,  "U/L",      35 )  definition_mcrit <- exprs(   ~PARAM,                      ~condition,    ~MCRIT1ML, ~MCRIT1MN,   "ALT",                    AVAL <= ANRHI,    "<=ANRHI",         1,   "ALT", ANRHI < AVAL & AVAL <= 3 * ANRHI, ">1-3*ANRHI",         2,   "ALT",                 3 * ANRHI < AVAL,   ">3*ANRHI",         3 )  adlb %>%   derive_vars_cat(     definition = definition_mcrit,     by_vars = exprs(PARAM)   ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 7 #>   USUBJID     PARAM  AVAL AVALU ANRHI MCRIT1ML   MCRIT1MN #>   <chr>       <chr> <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <chr>         <dbl> #> 1 01-701-1015 ALT     150 U/L      40 >3*ANRHI          3 #> 2 01-701-1023 ALT      70 U/L      40 >1-3*ANRHI        2 #> 3 01-701-1036 ALT     130 U/L      40 >3*ANRHI          3 #> 4 01-701-1048 ALT      30 U/L      40 <=ANRHI           1 #> 5 01-701-1015 AST      50 U/L      35 NA               NA

what: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
title: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
text: Adds Variable(s) computed analysis value one parameters. expected value new variable defined expression using analysis values parameters, addition/sum, subtraction/difference, multiplication/product, division/ratio, exponentiation/logarithm, formula.  example Body Mass Index Baseline (BMIBL) ADSL can derived HEIGHT WEIGHT parameters ADVS.

title: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
code: derive_vars_computed(   dataset,   dataset_add,   by_vars,   parameters,   new_vars,   filter_add = NULL,   constant_by_vars = NULL,   constant_parameters = NULL )

title: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
text: dataset variables specified by_vars parameter expected. Default value none dataset_add Additional dataset variables specified by_vars parameter expected. variable specified by_vars PARAMCD must unique key additional dataset restricting filter condition (filter_add parameter) parameters specified parameters. Default value none by_vars Grouping variables Grouping variables uniquely identifying set records new_vars calculated. Permitted values list variables created exprs() Default value none parameters Required parameter codes expected parameter codes (PARAMCD) required derive new variable specified parameter constant_parameters parameter. observations considered parameter code, e.g., SDTM dataset used, temporary parameter codes can derived specifying list expressions. name element defines temporary parameter code expression defines condition selecting records. example, parameters = exprs(HGHT = VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT") selects observations VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT" input data (dataset dataset_add), sets PARAMCD = "HGHT" observations, adds observations consider. Unnamed elements list expressions considered parameter codes. example, parameters = exprs(WEIGHT, HGHT = VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT") uses parameter code "WEIGHT" creates temporary parameter code "HGHT". Permitted values character vector PARAMCD values list expressions Default value none new_vars Name newly created variables specified variables set specified values. values variables parameters specified parameters can accessed using <variable name>.<parameter code>. example   defines value new variable. Variable names expression must contain one dot. Permitted values List variable-value pairs Default value none filter_add Filter condition additional dataset specified condition applied additional dataset deriving new variable, .e., observations fulfilling condition taken account. Permitted values condition Default value NULL constant_by_vars variables constant parameters constant parameters (parameters measured ) merged parameters using specified variables. (Refer Example) Permitted values list variables Default value NULL constant_parameters Required constant parameter codes expected parameter codes (PARAMCD) required derive new variable measured specified . example BMI derived height measured weight measured visit. Height specified constant_parameters parameter. (Refer Example) observations considered parameter code, e.g., SDTM dataset used, temporary parameter codes can derived specifying list expressions. name element defines temporary parameter code expression defines condition selecting records. example constant_parameters = exprs(HGHT = VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT") selects observations VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT" input data (dataset dataset_add), sets PARAMCD = "HGHT" observations, adds observations consider. Unnamed elements list expressions considered parameter codes. example, constant_parameters = exprs(WEIGHT, HGHT = VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT") uses parameter code "WEIGHT" creates temporary parameter code "HGHT". Permitted values character vector PARAMCD values list expressions Default value NULL
code: exprs(   BMIBL = (AVAL.WEIGHT / (AVAL.HEIGHT/100)^2) )

title: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
text: input dataset new variables added.

title: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
