title: Adds Variable(s) Computed from the Analysis Value of one or more Parameters ‚Äî derive_vars_computed
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr)  # Example 1: Derive BMIBL adsl <- tribble(   ~STUDYID,   ~USUBJID, ~AGE,   ~AGEU,   "PILOT01", "01-1302",   61,   "YEARS",   "PILOT01", "17-1344",   64,   "YEARS" )  advs <- tribble(   ~STUDYID,  ~USUBJID,  ~PARAMCD, ~PARAM,        ~VISIT,      ~AVAL, ~AVALU, ~ABLFL,   "PILOT01", "01-1302", "HEIGHT", "Height (cm)", "SCREENING", 177.8, "cm",   "Y",   "PILOT01", "01-1302", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "SCREENING", 81.19, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "01-1302", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "BASELINE",   82.1, "kg",   "Y",   "PILOT01", "01-1302", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "WEEK 2",    81.19, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "01-1302", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "WEEK 4",    82.56, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "01-1302", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "WEEK 6",    80.74, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "17-1344", "HEIGHT", "Height (cm)", "SCREENING", 163.5, "cm",   "Y",   "PILOT01", "17-1344", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "SCREENING", 58.06, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "17-1344", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "BASELINE",  58.06, "kg",   "Y",   "PILOT01", "17-1344", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "WEEK 2",    58.97, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "17-1344", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "WEEK 4",    57.97, "kg",   NA,   "PILOT01", "17-1344", "WEIGHT", "Weight (kg)", "WEEK 6",    58.97, "kg",   NA )  derive_vars_computed(   dataset = adsl,   dataset_add = advs,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   parameters = c("WEIGHT", "HEIGHT"),   new_vars = exprs(BMIBL = compute_bmi(height = AVAL.HEIGHT, weight = AVAL.WEIGHT)),   filter_add = ABLFL == "Y" ) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 5 #>   STUDYID USUBJID   AGE AGEU  BMIBL #>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 PILOT01 01-1302    61 YEARS  26.0 #> 2 PILOT01 17-1344    64 YEARS  21.7

what: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: function derives ADaM compliant criterion flags, e.g., facilitate subgroup analyses. criterion flag derived function, derivation ADaM compliant. helps ensure : condition criterion depends variables row, CRITyFL populated valid values, .e, either "Y" NA "Y", "N", NA, CRITy variable populated correctly, .e., set constant value within parameter CRITyFL populated "Y", "N", NA set constant value within parameter criterion condition fulfilled NA otherwise CRITyFL populated "Y",  NA

title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
code: derive_vars_crit_flag(   dataset,   crit_nr = 1,   condition,   description,   values_yn = FALSE,   create_numeric_flag = FALSE )

title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: dataset Input dataset Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none crit_nr criterion number, .e., y CRITy Permitted values positive integer, e.g. 2 5 Default value 1 condition Condition flagging records See description values_yn argument details CRITyFL variable populated. Permitted values unquoted condition, e.g., AVISIT == "BASELINE" Default value none description description criterion CRITy variable set specified value. expression can specified set value depending parameter. Please note value must constant within parameter. Permitted values unquoted expression evaluates character (dataset) Default value none values_yn "Y" "N" used CRITyFL? set TRUE, CRITyFL variable set "Y" condition (condition) evaluates TRUE, set "N" condition evaluate FALSE, NA evaluates NA. Otherwise, CRITyFL variable set "Y" condition (condition) evaluates TRUE, NA otherwise. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE create_numeric_flag Create numeric flag? set TRUE, CRITyFN variable created. set 1 CRITyFL == "Y", set 0 CRITyFL == "N", NA otherwise. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE

title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: input dataset variables CRITy, CRITyFL, optionally CRITyFN added.

title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: following examples use BDS dataset basis.
code: library(tibble, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  adbds <- tribble(   ~PARAMCD, ~AVAL,   "AST",    42,   "AST",    52,   "AST",    NA_real_,   "ALT",    33,   "ALT",    51 )

what: Creating a simple criterion flag with values "Y" and NA (condition, description)
title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: following call simple application derive_vars_crit_flag() derive criterion flag/variable pair BDS dataset. new variables named CRIT1/CRIT1FL argument crit_nr passed. Since argument values_yn also passed thus set default FALSE, CRIT1FL set Y condition evaluates TRUE. example, first third records, condition respectively FALSE NA, set CRIT1FL = NA_character_. fourth record also exhibits behavior. Also, per CDISC standards, case CRIT1 populated records condition evaluates TRUE.   description argument also accepts expressions depend variables input dataset. can useful dynamically populate CRITx, instance case improve CRIT1 text flag/variable pair actually used multiple parameters.
code: derive_vars_crit_flag(   adbds,   condition = AVAL > 50,   description = "Absolute value > 50" ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 4 #>   PARAMCD  AVAL CRIT1FL CRIT1 #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr> #> 1 AST        42 <NA>    <NA> #> 2 AST        52 Y       Absolute value > 50 #> 3 AST        NA <NA>    <NA> #> 4 ALT        33 <NA>    <NA> #> 5 ALT        51 Y       Absolute value > 50 derive_vars_crit_flag(   adbds,   condition = AVAL > 50,   description = paste(PARAMCD, "> 50"), ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 4 #>   PARAMCD  AVAL CRIT1FL CRIT1 #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr> #> 1 AST        42 <NA>    <NA> #> 2 AST        52 Y       AST > 50 #> 3 AST        NA <NA>    <NA> #> 4 ALT        33 <NA>    <NA> #> 5 ALT        51 Y       ALT > 50

what: Creating a criterion flag with values "Y", "N" and NA (values_yn)
title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: next call builds previous example using value_yn = TRUE distinguish cases condition FALSE evaluable . compared previous example, first record condition evaluates FALSE set CRIT1FL = "N", whereas third record, condition evaluates NA AVAL missing set CRIT1FL NA. Note also using values "Y", "N" NA flag, per CDISC standards CRIT1 now populated records rather just "Y" records.   user wishes set criterion flag "N" whenever condition fulfilled, condition can updated using if_else call, third argument determines behavior condition evaluable.
code: derive_vars_crit_flag(   adbds,   condition = AVAL > 50,   description = paste(PARAMCD, "> 50"),   values_yn = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 4 #>   PARAMCD  AVAL CRIT1FL CRIT1 #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr> #> 1 AST        42 N       AST > 50 #> 2 AST        52 Y       AST > 50 #> 3 AST        NA <NA>    AST > 50 #> 4 ALT        33 N       ALT > 50 #> 5 ALT        51 Y       ALT > 50 derive_vars_crit_flag(   adbds,   condition = if_else(AVAL > 50, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE),   description = paste(PARAMCD, "> 50"),   values_yn = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 4 #>   PARAMCD  AVAL CRIT1FL CRIT1 #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr> #> 1 AST        42 N       AST > 50 #> 2 AST        52 Y       AST > 50 #> 3 AST        NA N       AST > 50 #> 4 ALT        33 N       ALT > 50 #> 5 ALT        51 Y       ALT > 50

what: Specifying the criterion variable/flag number and creating a numeric flag (crit_nr, create_numeric_flag).
title: Derive Criterion Flag Variables CRITy, CRITyFL, and CRITyFN ‚Äî derive_vars_crit_flag
text: user can manually specify criterion variable/flag number use name CRITy/CRITyFL passing crit_nr argument. may necessary , instance, criterion flags already exist input dataset. user can also choose create additional, equivalent numeric flag CRITyFN setting create_numeric_flag TRUE.
code: derive_vars_crit_flag(   adbds,   condition = AVAL > 50,   description = paste(PARAMCD, "> 50"),   values_yn = TRUE,   crit_nr = 2,   create_numeric_flag = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 5 #>   PARAMCD  AVAL CRIT2FL CRIT2    CRIT2FN #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>      <int> #> 1 AST        42 N       AST > 50       0 #> 2 AST        52 Y       AST > 50       1 #> 3 AST        NA <NA>    AST > 50      NA #> 4 ALT        33 N       ALT > 50       0 #> 5 ALT        51 Y       ALT > 50       1

what: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: Derive date (*DT) character date (--DTC). date can imputed (see date_imputation argument) date imputation flag (*DTF) can added.

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
code: derive_vars_dt(   dataset,   new_vars_prefix,   dtc,   highest_imputation = "n",   date_imputation = "first",   flag_imputation = "auto",   min_dates = NULL,   max_dates = NULL,   preserve = FALSE )

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified dtc argument expected dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none new_vars_prefix Prefix used output variable(s). character scalar expected. date variable (*DT) appended specified prefix date imputation flag (*DTF), .e., new_vars_prefix = "AST" variables ASTDT ASTDTF created. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value none dtc --DTC date impute character date expected format like yyyy-mm-dd yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss. Trailing components can omitted - valid "missing" value component. Permitted values character date variable Default value none highest_imputation Highest imputation level highest_imputation argument controls components --DTC value imputed missing. components specified level imputed. component higher level highest imputation level missing, NA_character_ returned. example, highest_imputation = "D" "2020" results NA_character_ month missing. "n" (none, lowest level) specified imputation performed, .e., component missing, NA_character_ returned. "Y" (year, highest level) specified, date_imputation must "first" "last" min_dates max_dates must specified respectively. Otherwise, error thrown. Permitted values "Y" (year, highest level), "M" (month), "D" (day), "n" (none, lowest level) Default value "n" date_imputation value impute day/month datepart missing. character value expected.  highest_imputation "M", month day can specified "mm-dd": e.g. "06-15" 15th June  highest_imputation "M"  "D", following keywords available: "first", "mid", "last" impute first/mid/last day/month. "mid" specified, missing components imputed middle possible range: month day missing, imputed "06-30" (middle year). day missing, imputed "15" (middle month). year can specified; imputing year "first" "last" together min_dates max_dates argument can used (see examples). Permitted values "first", "mid", "last", user-defined Default value "first" flag_imputation Whether date imputation flag must also derived. "auto" specified highest_imputation argument "n", date imputation flag derived. "date" specified, date imputation flag derived. "none" specified, date imputation flag derived. Please note CDISC requirements dictate need date imputation flag imputation performed, flag_imputation = "none" used imputed variable part final ADaM dataset. Permitted values "auto", "date" "none" Default value "auto" min_dates Minimum dates list dates expected. ensured imputed date specified dates, e.g., imputed adverse event start date first treatment date. dates range possible dates dtc value considered. possible dates defined missing parts dtc date (see example ). ensures non-missing parts dtc date changed. date date-time object expected. example   returns "2020-11-11T11:11:11" possible dates "2020-11" range "2020-11-01T00:00:00" "2020-11-30T23:59:59". Therefore "2020-12-06T12:12:12" ignored. Returning "2020-12-06T12:12:12" changed month although missing (dtc date). Permitted values list dates, e.g. list(ymd_hms("2021-07-01T04:03:01"), ymd_hms("2022-05-12T13:57:23")) Default value NULL max_dates Maximum dates list dates expected. ensured imputed date specified dates, e.g., imputed date data cut date. dates range possible dates considered. date date-time object expected. Permitted values list dates, e.g. list(ymd_hms("2021-07-01T04:03:01"), ymd_hms("2022-05-12T13:57:23")) Default value NULL preserve Preserve day month missing day present example "2019---07" return "2019-06-07 preserve = TRUE (date_imputation = "MID"). Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE
code: impute_dtc_dtm(   "2020-11",   min_dates = list(    ymd_hms("2020-12-06T12:12:12"),    ymd_hms("2020-11-11T11:11:11")   ),   highest_imputation = "M" )

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: input dataset date *DT (date imputation flag *DTF requested) added.

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: {admiral} allow users pick single part date/time impute, enable impute highest level, .e. choose say impute months, days. presence *DTF variable checked already exists input dataset, warning issued *DTF overwritten.

what: Derive a date variable without imputation
title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: example, derive ASTDT MHSTDTC imputation done partial dates.

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: Imputation requested highest_imputation argument. highest_imputation = "M" month imputation used, .e. highest imputation done partial date month. default, missing date components imputed first day/month/year. date imputation flag variable, ASTDTF, automatically created. flag variable indicates imputation done date.

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: example, derive ADT impute partial dates last day/month, .e. date_imputation = "last".

what: Impute to the middle (date_imputation = "mid") and suppress imputation flag (flag_imputation = "none")
title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: example, derive TRTSDT date imputation flag (*DTF) suppressed. Since date_imputation = "mid", partial date imputation set June 30th missing month 15th missing day . flag_imputation = "none" call ensures date imputation flag created. practice, per CDISC requirements option can selected imputed variable part final ADaM dataset.

title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: example, derive ASTDT specific date imputation, .e. date_imputation = "04-06". Note day portion, "-06", used imputation record "2019-02".

what: Applying a lower boundary to date imputation with (min_dates)
title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: example, derive ASTDT AESTDTC partial dates need imputation. Using min_dates = exprs(TRTSDTM), telling function apply treatment start date (TRTSDTM) lower boundary imputation via min_dates argument. means: partial dates potentially include TRTSDTM (case 1 & 2), imputed date adjusted TRTSDTM partial dates entirely TRTSDTM (case 3 & 4), standard imputation rules apply without adjustment partial dates entirely TRTSDTM (case 5), standard imputation rules apply

what: Applying an upper boundary to date imputation with (max_dates)
title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: example, derive ASTDT AESTDTC partial dates need imputation. Using max_dates = exprs(TRTEDTM), telling function apply treatment end date (TRTEDTM) upper boundary imputation via max_dates argument. means: partial dates potentially include TRTEDTM (case 1 & 2), imputed date adjusted TRTEDTM partial dates entirely TRTEDTM (case 3 & 4), standard imputation rules apply without adjustment partial dates entirely TRTEDTM (case 5), standard imputation rules apply

what: Preserve lower components if higher ones were imputed (preserve)
title: Derive/Impute a Date from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dt
text: preserve argument can used "preserve" information partial dates. example, "2019---07", displayed "2019-06-07" rather "2019-06-30" preserve = TRUE date_imputation = "mid" .
code: derive_vars_dt(   mhdt,   new_vars_prefix = "AST",   dtc = MHSTDTC,   highest_imputation = "M",   date_imputation = "mid",   preserve = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 3 #>   MHSTDTC               ASTDT      ASTDTF #>   <chr>                 <date>     <chr> #> 1 "2019-07-18T15:25:40" 2019-07-18 <NA> #> 2 "2019-07-18T15:25"    2019-07-18 <NA> #> 3 "2019-07-18"          2019-07-18 <NA> #> 4 "2019-02"             2019-02-15 D #> 5 "2019"                2019-06-30 M #> 6 "2019---07"           2019-06-07 M #> 7 ""                    NA         <NA>

text: example usages function can found vignette("imputation").

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
code: derive_vars_dtm(   dataset,   new_vars_prefix,   dtc,   highest_imputation = "h",   date_imputation = "first",   time_imputation = "first",   flag_imputation = "auto",   min_dates = NULL,   max_dates = NULL,   preserve = FALSE,   ignore_seconds_flag = TRUE )

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified dtc argument expected dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none new_vars_prefix Prefix used output variable(s). character scalar expected. date variable (*DT) appended specified prefix, date imputation flag (*DTF), time imputation flag (*TMF), .e., new_vars_prefix = "AST" variables ASTDT, ASTDTF, ASTTMF created. Permitted values character scalar, .e., character vector length one Default value none dtc --DTC date impute character date expected format like yyyy-mm-dd yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss. Trailing components can omitted - valid "missing" value component. Permitted values character date variable Default value none highest_imputation Highest imputation level highest_imputation argument controls components --DTC value imputed missing. components specified level imputed. component higher level highest imputation level missing, NA_character_ returned. example, highest_imputation = "D" "2020" results NA_character_ month missing. "n" specified, imputation performed, .e., component missing, NA_character_ returned. "Y" specified, date_imputation "first" "last" min_dates max_dates specified respectively. Otherwise, NA_character_ returned year component missing. Permitted values "Y" (year, highest level), "M" (month), "D" (day), "h" (hour), "m" (minute), "s" (second), "n" (none, lowest level) Default value "h" date_imputation value impute day/month datepart missing. character value expected.  highest_imputation "M", month day can specified "mm-dd": e.g. "06-15" 15th June  highest_imputation "M"  "D", following keywords available: "first", "mid", "last" impute first/mid/last day/month. "mid" specified, missing components imputed middle possible range: month day missing, imputed "06-30" (middle year). day missing, imputed "15" (middle month). year can specified; imputing year "first" "last" together min_dates max_dates argument can used (see examples). Permitted values "first", "mid", "last", user-defined Default value "first" time_imputation value impute time timepart missing. character value expected, either format hour, min sec specified "hh:mm:ss": e.g. "00:00:00" start day, keyword: "first","last" impute start/end day. argument ignored highest_imputation = "n". Permitted values "first", "last", user-defined Default value "first" flag_imputation Whether date/time imputation flag(s) must also derived. "" "date" specified, date imputation flag derived. "auto" specified highest_imputation argument greater "h", date imputation flag derived. "" "time" specified, time imputation flag derived. "auto" specified highest_imputation argument "n", time imputation flag derived. "none" specified, date time imputation flag derived. Please note CDISC requirements dictate need date/time imputation flag imputation performed, flag_imputation = "none" used imputed variable part final ADaM dataset. Permitted values "auto", "date","time", "" "none" Default value "auto" min_dates Minimum dates list dates expected. ensured imputed date specified dates, e.g., imputed adverse event start date first treatment date. dates range possible dates dtc value considered. possible dates defined missing parts dtc date (see example ). ensures non-missing parts dtc date changed. date date-time object expected. example   returns "2020-11-11T11:11:11" possible dates "2020-11" range "2020-11-01T00:00:00" "2020-11-30T23:59:59". Therefore "2020-12-06T12:12:12" ignored. Returning "2020-12-06T12:12:12" changed month although missing (dtc date). date variables (datetime) list time imputed "00:00:00". Specifying date variables makes sense date imputed. time imputed, date variables affect result. Permitted values list dates, e.g. list(ymd_hms("2021-07-01T04:03:01"), ymd_hms("2022-05-12T13:57:23")) Default value NULL max_dates Maximum dates list dates expected. ensured imputed date specified dates, e.g., imputed date data cut date. dates range possible dates considered. date date-time object expected. date variables (datetime) list time imputed "23:59:59". Specifying date variables makes sense date imputed. time imputed, date variables affect result. Permitted values list dates, e.g. list(ymd_hms("2021-07-01T04:03:01"), ymd_hms("2022-05-12T13:57:23")) Default value NULL preserve Preserve lower level date/time part higher order part missing, e.g. preserve day month missing preserve minute hour missing. example "2019---07" return "2019-06-07 preserve = TRUE (date_imputation = "mid"). Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE ignore_seconds_flag ADaM IG states given SDTM (--DTC) variable, hours minutes ever collected, seconds imputed (*DTM) 00, necessary set (*TMF) "S". default assumed seconds collected *TMF set "S". user can set FALSE seconds collected. default value ignore_seconds_flag set TRUE admiral 1.4.0 later. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value TRUE
code: impute_dtc_dtm(   "2020-11",   min_dates = list(    ymd_hm("2020-12-06T12:12"),    ymd_hm("2020-11-11T11:11")   ),   highest_imputation = "M" )

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: input dataset datetime *DTM (date/time imputation flag *DTF, *TMF) added.

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: {admiral} allow users pick single part date/time impute, enable impute highest level, .e. choose say impute months, days. presence *DTF variable checked variable derived already exists input dataset. However, *TMF already exists input dataset, warning issued *TMF overwritten.

what: Derive a datetime variable imputing time
title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: example, derive ASTDTM MHSTDTC. Note default function imputes missing time components 00 impute missing date components automatically produces time imputation flag (ASTTMF).
code: library(tibble) library(lubridate)  mhdt <- tribble(   ~MHSTDTC,   "2019-07-18T15:25",   "2019-07-18",   "2019-02",   "2019",   "2019---07",   "" )  derive_vars_dtm(   mhdt,   new_vars_prefix = "AST",   dtc = MHSTDTC ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 3 #>   MHSTDTC            ASTDTM              ASTTMF #>   <chr>              <dttm>              <chr> #> 1 "2019-07-18T15:25" 2019-07-18 15:25:00 <NA> #> 2 "2019-07-18"       2019-07-18 00:00:00 H #> 3 "2019-02"          NA                  <NA> #> 4 "2019"             NA                  <NA> #> 5 "2019---07"        NA                  <NA> #> 6 ""                 NA                  <NA>

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: example, set date_imputation = "last" get last month/day partial dates. also set time_imputation = "last". function use part 23:59:59 time imputation. Note highest_imputation must least "D" perform date imputation. use highest_imputation = "M" request imputation month day (time). Also note two flag variables created. default ASTTMF set NA seconds imputed. Set ignore_seconds_flag = FALSE "S" flag ASTTMF.
code: derive_vars_dtm(  mhdt,  new_vars_prefix = "AST",  dtc = MHSTDTC,  date_imputation = "last",  time_imputation = "last",  highest_imputation = "M" ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 4 #>   MHSTDTC            ASTDTM              ASTDTF ASTTMF #>   <chr>              <dttm>              <chr>  <chr> #> 1 "2019-07-18T15:25" 2019-07-18 15:25:59 <NA>   <NA> #> 2 "2019-07-18"       2019-07-18 23:59:59 <NA>   H #> 3 "2019-02"          2019-02-28 23:59:59 D      H #> 4 "2019"             2019-12-31 23:59:59 M      H #> 5 "2019---07"        2019-12-31 23:59:59 M      H #> 6 ""                 NA                  <NA>   <NA>

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: example, derive ASTDTM suppress ASTTMF. Note function appends missing "hh:mm:ss" ASTDTM. flag_imputation = "none" call ensures date/time imputation flag created. practice, per CDISC requirements option can selected imputed variable part final ADaM dataset.
code: derive_vars_dtm(   mhdt,   new_vars_prefix = "AST",   dtc = MHSTDTC,   flag_imputation = "none" ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 2 #>   MHSTDTC            ASTDTM #>   <chr>              <dttm> #> 1 "2019-07-18T15:25" 2019-07-18 15:25:00 #> 2 "2019-07-18"       2019-07-18 00:00:00 #> 3 "2019-02"          NA #> 4 "2019"             NA #> 5 "2019---07"        NA #> 6 ""                 NA

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: example, derive AENDTM AE end date imputed last date. ensure imputed date death data cut date can set max_dates = exprs(DTHDT, DCUTDT). Note two flag variables: ASTDTF ASTTMF created. Setting highest_imputation = "Y" allow missing AEENDTC record imputed max_dates = exprs(DTHDT, DCUTDT).

title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: example, set ignore_seconds_flag = FALSE include S seconds ASTTMF variable. default value ignore_seconds_flag TRUE "S" normally displayed. ADaM IG states given SDTM (--DTC) variable, hours minutes ever collected, seconds imputed (*DTM) 00, necessary set (*TMF) "S".

what: Preserve lower components if higher ones were imputed (preserve)
title: Derive/Impute a Datetime from a Character Date ‚Äî derive_vars_dtm
text: example, impute dates middle month/day date_imputation = "mid" impute time last (23:59:59) time_imputation = "last". use preserve argument "preserve" partial dates.  example, "2019---18T15:-:05", displayed "2019-06-18 15:59:05" setting preserve = TRUE.

Derive Duration ‚Äî derive_vars_duration
text: Derives duration two dates, specified variables present input dataset e.g., duration adverse events, relative day, age, ...

title: Derive Duration ‚Äî derive_vars_duration
code: derive_vars_duration(   dataset,   new_var,   new_var_unit = NULL,   start_date,   end_date,   in_unit = "days",   out_unit = "DAYS",   floor_in = TRUE,   add_one = TRUE,   trunc_out = FALSE,   type = "duration" )

title: Derive Duration ‚Äî derive_vars_duration
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified start_date end_date arguments expected dataset. Default value none new_var Name variable create Default value none new_var_unit Name unit variable parameter specified, variable unit created. Default value NULL start_date start date date date-time object expected. Refer derive_vars_dt() impute derive date date character vector date object. Refer convert_dtc_to_dt() obtain vector imputed dates. Default value none end_date end date date date-time object expected. Refer derive_vars_dt() impute derive date date character vector date object. Refer convert_dtc_to_dt() obtain vector imputed dates. Default value none in_unit Input unit See floor_in add_one parameter details. Permitted Values (case-insensitive): years: "year", "years", "yr", "yrs", "y" months: "month", "months", "mo", "mos" days: "day", "days", "d" hours: "hour", "hours", "hr", "hrs", "h" minutes: "minute", "minutes", "min", "mins" seconds: "second", "seconds", "sec", "secs", "s" Default value "days" out_unit Output unit duration derived specified unit Permitted Values (case-insensitive): years: "year", "years", "yr", "yrs", "y" months: "month", "months", "mo", "mos" weeks: "week", "weeks", "wk", "wks", "w" days: "day", "days", "d" hours: "hour", "hours", "hr", "hrs", "h" minutes: "minute", "minutes", "min", "mins" seconds: "second", "seconds", "sec", "secs", "s" Default value "days" floor_in Round input dates? input dates round respect input unit, e.g., input unit 'days', time input dates ignored. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value TRUE add_one Add one input unit? duration non-negative, one input unit added. .e., duration can zero. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value TRUE trunc_out Return integer part fractional part duration (output unit) removed, .e., integer part returned. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE type lubridate duration type. See details. Permitted values "duration", "interval" Default value "duration"

title: Derive Duration ‚Äî derive_vars_duration
text: input dataset duration unit variable added

title: Derive Duration ‚Äî derive_vars_duration
text: duration derived time start end date specified output unit. end date start date, duration negative. start end date variable must present specified input dataset. lubridate package calculates two types spans two dates: duration interval. calculations largely , unit time period month year result can slightly different. difference arises ambiguity length "1 month" "1 year". Months may 31, 30, 28, 29 days, years 365 days 366 leap years. Durations intervals help solve ambiguity measures. interval 2000-02-01 2000-03-01 1 (.e. one month). duration two dates 0.95, accounts fact year 2000 leap year, February 29 days, average month length 30.4375, .e. 29 / 30.4375 = 0.95. additional details, review lubridate time span reference page.

title: Derive Duration ‚Äî derive_vars_duration
code: library(lubridate) library(tibble)  # Derive age in years data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~BRTHDT, ~RANDDT,   "P01", ymd("1984-09-06"), ymd("2020-02-24"),   "P02", ymd("1985-01-01"), NA,   "P03", NA, ymd("2021-03-10"),   "P04", NA, NA )  derive_vars_duration(data,   new_var = AAGE,   new_var_unit = AAGEU,   start_date = BRTHDT,   end_date = RANDDT,   out_unit = "years",   add_one = FALSE,   trunc_out = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID BRTHDT     RANDDT      AAGE AAGEU #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #> 1 P01     1984-09-06 2020-02-24    35 years #> 2 P02     1985-01-01 NA            NA NA    #> 3 P03     NA         2021-03-10    NA NA    #> 4 P04     NA         NA            NA NA     # Derive adverse event duration in days data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT, ~AENDT,   "P01", ymd("2021-03-05"), ymd("2021-03-02"),   "P02", ymd("2019-09-18"), ymd("2019-09-18"),   "P03", ymd("1985-01-01"), NA,   "P04", NA, NA )  derive_vars_duration(data,   new_var = ADURN,   new_var_unit = ADURU,   start_date = ASTDT,   end_date = AENDT,   out_unit = "days" ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ASTDT      AENDT      ADURN ADURU #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <dbl> <chr> #> 1 P01     2021-03-05 2021-03-02    -3 days  #> 2 P02     2019-09-18 2019-09-18     1 days  #> 3 P03     1985-01-01 NA            NA NA    #> 4 P04     NA         NA            NA NA     # Derive adverse event duration in minutes data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADTM, ~TRTSDTM,   "P01", ymd_hms("2019-08-09T04:30:56"), ymd_hms("2019-08-09T05:00:00"),   "P02", ymd_hms("2019-11-11T10:30:00"), ymd_hms("2019-11-11T11:30:00"),   "P03", ymd_hms("2019-11-11T00:00:00"), ymd_hms("2019-11-11T04:00:00"),   "P04", NA, ymd_hms("2019-11-11T12:34:56"), )  derive_vars_duration(data,   new_var = ADURN,   new_var_unit = ADURU,   start_date = ADTM,   end_date = TRTSDTM,   in_unit = "minutes",   out_unit = "minutes",   add_one = FALSE ) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ADTM                TRTSDTM             ADURN ADURU   #>   <chr>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <dbl> <chr>   #> 1 P01     2019-08-09 04:30:56 2019-08-09 05:00:00    30 minutes #> 2 P02     2019-11-11 10:30:00 2019-11-11 11:30:00    60 minutes #> 3 P03     2019-11-11 00:00:00 2019-11-11 04:00:00   240 minutes #> 4 P04     NA                  2019-11-11 12:34:56    NA NA       # Derive adverse event start time since last dose in hours data <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDTM, ~LDOSEDTM,   "P01", ymd_hms("2019-08-09T04:30:56"), ymd_hms("2019-08-08T10:05:00"),   "P02", ymd_hms("2019-11-11T23:59:59"), ymd_hms("2019-10-11T11:37:00"),   "P03", ymd_hms("2019-11-11T00:00:00"), ymd_hms("2019-11-10T23:59:59"),   "P04", ymd_hms("2019-11-11T12:34:56"), NA,   "P05", NA, ymd_hms("2019-09-28T12:34:56") ) derive_vars_duration(   data,   new_var = LDRELTM,   new_var_unit = LDRELTMU,   start_date = LDOSEDTM,   end_date = ASTDTM,   in_unit = "hours",   out_unit = "hours",   add_one = FALSE ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ASTDTM              LDOSEDTM            LDRELTM LDRELTMU #>   <chr>   <dttm>              <dttm>                <dbl> <chr>    #> 1 P01     2019-08-09 04:30:56 2019-08-08 10:05:00      18 hours    #> 2 P02     2019-11-11 23:59:59 2019-10-11 11:37:00     756 hours    #> 3 P03     2019-11-11 00:00:00 2019-11-10 23:59:59       1 hours    #> 4 P04     2019-11-11 12:34:56 NA                       NA NA       #> 5 P05     NA                  2019-09-28 12:34:56      NA NA

Default value none source_vars list datetime date variables created using exprs() dates extracted. can either list date(time) variables named *DY variables corresponding *DT(M) variables e.g. exprs(TRTSDTM, ASTDTM, AENDT) exprs(TRTSDT, ASTDTM, AENDT, DEATHDY = DTHDT). source variable end *DT(M), name resulting *DY variable must provided. title: Derive Relative Day Variables ‚Äî derive_vars_dy
code: library(tibble) library(lubridate) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  datain <- tribble(   ~TRTSDTM, ~ASTDTM, ~AENDT,   "2014-01-17T23:59:59", "2014-01-18T13:09:O9", "2014-01-20" ) %>%   mutate(     TRTSDTM = as_datetime(TRTSDTM),     ASTDTM = as_datetime(ASTDTM),     AENDT = ymd(AENDT)   )  derive_vars_dy(   datain,   reference_date = TRTSDTM,   source_vars = exprs(TRTSDTM, ASTDTM, AENDT) ) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>   TRTSDTM             ASTDTM              AENDT      TRTSDY ASTDY AENDY #>   <dttm>              <dttm>              <date>      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 2014-01-17 23:59:59 2014-01-18 13:09:09 2014-01-20      1     2     4  # specifying name of new variables datain <- tribble(   ~TRTSDT, ~DTHDT,   "2014-01-17", "2014-02-01" ) %>%   mutate(     TRTSDT = ymd(TRTSDT),     DTHDT = ymd(DTHDT)   )  derive_vars_dy(   datain,   reference_date = TRTSDT,   source_vars = exprs(TRTSDT, DEATHDY = DTHDT) ) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 4 #>   TRTSDT     DTHDT      TRTSDY DEATHDY #>   <date>     <date>      <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 2014-01-17 2014-02-01      1      16

text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars order arguments expected dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none by_vars Grouping variables Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value NULL events Conditions new values defining events list event() event_joined() objects expected. observations listed events considered deriving extreme event. multiple records meet filter condition, take first record sorted order. data grouped by_vars, .e., summary functions like () () can used condition. event_joined() events observations selected calling filter_joined(). condition field passed filter_join argument. Default value none tmp_event_nr_var Temporary event number variable specified variable added source datasets set number event selecting records event. can used order determine record used records one event selected. variable included output dataset. Default value NULL order Sort order particular event events one observation, within event group, records ordered specified order. handling NAs sorting variables see "Sort Order" section vignette("generic"). Permitted values list expressions created exprs(), e.g., exprs(ADT, desc(AVAL)) Default value none mode Selection mode (first last) particular event events one observation, "first"/"last" used select first/last record type event sorting order. Permitted values "first", "last" Default value none source_datasets Source datasets named list datasets expected. dataset_name field event() event_joined() refers dataset provided list. Default value NULL check_type Check uniqueness? "warning" "error" specified, specified message issued observations input dataset unique respect variables order. Permitted values "none", "message", "warning", "error" Default value "warning" new_vars Variables add specified variables events added output dataset. Variables can renamed naming element, .e., new_vars = exprs(<new name> = <old name>). Default value none

title: Add the Worst or Best Observation for Each By Group as New Variables ‚Äî derive_vars_extreme_event
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr) library(lubridate)  adsl <- tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~TRTEDT, ~DTHDT,   "PILOT01", "01-1130", ymd("2014-08-16"), ymd("2014-09-13"),   "PILOT01", "01-1133", ymd("2013-04-28"), ymd(""),   "PILOT01", "01-1211", ymd("2013-01-12"), ymd(""),   "PILOT01", "09-1081", ymd("2014-04-27"), ymd(""),   "PILOT01", "09-1088", ymd("2014-10-09"), ymd("2014-11-01"), )  lb <- tribble(   ~STUDYID,  ~DOMAIN,  ~USUBJID, ~LBSEQ,             ~LBDTC,   "PILOT01",    "LB", "01-1130",    219, "2014-06-07T13:20",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "01-1130",    322, "2014-08-16T13:10",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "01-1133",    268, "2013-04-18T15:30",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "01-1133",    304, "2013-05-01T10:13",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "01-1211",      8, "2012-10-30T14:26",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "01-1211",    162, "2013-01-08T12:13",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "09-1081",     47, "2014-02-01T10:55",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "09-1081",    219, "2014-05-10T11:15",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "09-1088",    283, "2014-09-27T12:13",   "PILOT01",    "LB", "09-1088",    322, "2014-10-09T13:25" ) %>%   mutate(     ADT = convert_dtc_to_dt(LBDTC)   )  derive_vars_extreme_event(   adsl,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   events = list(     event(       dataset_name = "adsl",       condition = !is.na(DTHDT),       set_values_to = exprs(LSTALVDT = DTHDT, DTHFL = "Y")     ),     event(       dataset_name = "lb",       condition = !is.na(ADT),       order = exprs(ADT),       mode = "last",       set_values_to = exprs(LSTALVDT = ADT, DTHFL = "N")     ),     event(       dataset_name = "adsl",       condition = !is.na(TRTEDT),       order = exprs(TRTEDT),       mode = "last",       set_values_to = exprs(LSTALVDT = TRTEDT, DTHFL = "N")     )   ),   source_datasets = list(adsl = adsl, lb = lb),   tmp_event_nr_var = event_nr,   order = exprs(LSTALVDT, event_nr),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(LSTALVDT, DTHFL) ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 6 #>   STUDYID USUBJID TRTEDT     DTHDT      LSTALVDT   DTHFL #>   <chr>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr> #> 1 PILOT01 01-1130 2014-08-16 2014-09-13 2014-09-13 Y     #> 2 PILOT01 01-1133 2013-04-28 NA         2013-05-01 N     #> 3 PILOT01 01-1211 2013-01-12 NA         2013-01-12 N     #> 4 PILOT01 09-1081 2014-04-27 NA         2014-05-10 N     #> 5 PILOT01 09-1088 2014-10-09 2014-11-01 2014-11-01 Y      # Derive DTHCAUS from AE and DS domain data adsl <- tribble(   ~STUDYID,  ~USUBJID,   "STUDY01", "PAT01",   "STUDY01", "PAT02",   "STUDY01", "PAT03" ) ae <- tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~AESEQ, ~AEDECOD, ~AEOUT, ~AEDTHDTC,   "STUDY01", "PAT01", 12, "SUDDEN DEATH", "FATAL", "2021-04-04",   "STUDY01", "PAT01", 13, "CARDIAC ARREST", "FATAL", "2021-04-03", )  ds <- tribble(   ~STUDYID, ~USUBJID, ~DSSEQ, ~DSDECOD, ~DSTERM, ~DSSTDTC,   "STUDY01", "PAT02", 1, "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED", "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED", "2021-04-03",   "STUDY01", "PAT02", 2, "RANDOMIZATION", "RANDOMIZATION", "2021-04-11",   "STUDY01", "PAT02", 3, "DEATH", "DEATH DUE TO PROGRESSION OF DISEASE", "2022-02-01",   "STUDY01", "PAT03", 1, "DEATH", "POST STUDY REPORTING OF DEATH", "2022-03-03" )  derive_vars_extreme_event(   adsl,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   events = list(     event(       dataset_name = "ae",       condition = AEOUT == "FATAL",       set_values_to = exprs(DTHCAUS = AEDECOD, DTHDT = convert_dtc_to_dt(AEDTHDTC)),       order = exprs(DTHDT)     ),     event(       dataset_name = "ds",       condition = DSDECOD == "DEATH" & grepl("DEATH DUE TO", DSTERM),       set_values_to = exprs(DTHCAUS = DSTERM, DTHDT = convert_dtc_to_dt(DSSTDTC)),       order = exprs(DTHDT)     )   ),   source_datasets = list(ae = ae, ds = ds),   tmp_event_nr_var = event_nr,   order = exprs(DTHDT, event_nr),   mode = "first",   new_vars = exprs(DTHCAUS, DTHDT) ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   STUDYID USUBJID DTHCAUS                             DTHDT      #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>                               <date>     #> 1 STUDY01 PAT01   CARDIAC ARREST                      2021-04-03 #> 2 STUDY01 PAT02   DEATH DUE TO PROGRESSION OF DISEASE 2022-02-01 #> 3 STUDY01 PAT03   NA                                  NA

title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: question using derive_vars_merged() powerful derive_vars_joined() comes need select observations merged. observations dataset_add merge can selected condition (filter_add) using variables dataset_add, always use derive_vars_merged() requires less resources (time memory). common example randomization date ADSL, simply merging date DS according certain DSDECOD condition DSDECOD == "RANDOMIZATION". However, selection observations dataset_add can depend variables datasets, use derive_vars_joined(). example assigning period variables ADSL ADAE, now need check adverse event start date period start end dates decide period value join.

what: Basic join based on a generic time window (filter_join)
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Derive visit based study day falls according scheduled set time windows. filter_join argument can check conditions using variables dataset dataset_add, study day compared start end time window. grouping variables assigned using by_vars argument, full join performed keeping variables dataset_add.
code: library(tibble) library(lubridate) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(tidyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  adbds <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADY, ~AVAL,   "1",       -33,    11,   "1",        -7,    10,   "1",         1,    12,   "1",         8,    12,   "1",        15,     9,   "1",        20,    14,   "1",        24,    12,   "2",        -1,    13,   "2",        13,     8 ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  windows <- tribble(   ~AVISIT,    ~AWLO, ~AWHI,   "BASELINE",   -30,     1,   "WEEK 1",       2,     7,   "WEEK 2",       8,    15,   "WEEK 3",      16,    22,   "WEEK 4",      23,    30 )  derive_vars_joined(   adbds,   dataset_add = windows,   join_type = "all",   filter_join = AWLO <= ADY & ADY <= AWHI ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AWLO, AWHI, AVISIT) #> # A tibble: 9 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID   ADY  AWLO  AWHI AVISIT #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> #> 1 1         -33    NA    NA <NA> #> 2 1          -7   -30     1 BASELINE #> 3 1           1   -30     1 BASELINE #> 4 1           8     8    15 WEEK 2 #> 5 1          15     8    15 WEEK 2 #> 6 1          20    16    22 WEEK 3 #> 7 1          24    23    30 WEEK 4 #> 8 2          -1   -30     1 BASELINE #> 9 2          13     8    15 WEEK 2

what: Join only the lowest/highest value occurring within a condition (filter_join, order and mode)
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Derive nadir value observation (.e. lowest value occurring ) subject. Note dataset dataset_add , joining dataset . enables us compare records within dataset . Now use by_vars want perform join subject. find lowest value use order mode arguments. subsequently need check ADY check assessments occurring . included by_vars order, ensure also gets joined adding join_vars. filter_join note ADY.join < ADY used variable exists datasets, version dataset_add .join added. According AVAL sort order used duplicates (e.g. see subject "1" records day 1 8), given need join AVAL actually matter us exact record taken. , example, silence uniqueness check using check_type = "none".
code: derive_vars_joined(   adbds,   dataset_add = adbds,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(AVAL),   new_vars = exprs(NADIR = AVAL),   join_vars = exprs(ADY),   join_type = "all",   filter_join = ADY.join < ADY,   mode = "first",   check_type = "none" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, NADIR) #> # A tibble: 9 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   ADY  AVAL NADIR #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 1         -33    11    NA #> 2 1          -7    10    11 #> 3 1           1    12    10 #> 4 1           8    12    10 #> 5 1          15     9    10 #> 6 1          20    14     9 #> 7 1          24    12     9 #> 8 2          -1    13    NA #> 9 2          13     8    13

what: Filtering which records are joined from the additional dataset (filter_add)
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Imagine wanted achieve , now want derive allowing post-baseline values possible nadir. filter_add argument can used need restrict source data dataset_add.
code: derive_vars_joined(   adbds,   dataset_add = adbds,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(AVAL),   new_vars = exprs(NADIR = AVAL),   join_vars = exprs(ADY),   join_type = "all",   filter_add = ADY > 0,   filter_join = ADY.join < ADY,   mode = "first",   check_type = "none" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, NADIR) #> # A tibble: 9 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   ADY  AVAL NADIR #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 1         -33    11    NA #> 2 1          -7    10    NA #> 3 1           1    12    NA #> 4 1           8    12    12 #> 5 1          15     9    12 #> 6 1          20    14     9 #> 7 1          24    12     9 #> 8 2          -1    13    NA #> 9 2          13     8    NA

what: Combining all of the above examples
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Using arguments demonstrated , complex example add ADAE highest hemoglobin value occurring within two weeks adverse event. Also join day occurred, taking earliest occurrence one assessment value. Note used mode = "last" get highest lab value, wanted earliest occurrence one means need add desc(ADY) order. .e. last day descending order first.
code: adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDY,   "1",           3,   "1",          22,   "2",           2 ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  adlb <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~PARAMCD, ~ADY, ~AVAL,   "1",      "HGB",       1,   8.5,   "1",      "HGB",       3,   7.9,   "1",      "HGB",       5,   8.9,   "1",      "HGB",       8,   8.0,   "1",      "HGB",       9,   8.0,   "1",      "HGB",      16,   7.4,   "1",      "ALB",       1,    42, ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  derive_vars_joined(   adae,   dataset_add = adlb,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(AVAL, desc(ADY)),   new_vars = exprs(HGB_MAX = AVAL, HGB_DY = ADY),   join_type = "all",   filter_add = PARAMCD == "HGB",   filter_join = ASTDY - 14 <= ADY & ADY <= ASTDY,   mode = "last" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ASTDY, HGB_MAX, HGB_DY) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID ASTDY HGB_MAX HGB_DY #>   <chr>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 1           3     8.5      1 #> 2 1          22     8        8 #> 3 2           2    NA       NA

what: Compute values in new_vars and order
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Add ADAE number days since last dose treatment, plus 1 day. dose occurs day AE include last dose. new_vars argument, functions can utilized modify joined values using variables dataset dataset_add. example, case want calculate number days AE last dose using compute_duration(). function includes plus 1 day default. Also note example EXSDT created via order argument used new_vars, filter_add filter_join. reason use join_type = "" instead "" want include dose occurring day AE, hence filter_join = EXSDT <= ASTDT. Whereas using join_type = "" resulted condition EXSDT < ASTDT. See next example instead join_type = "".
code: adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,   "1",      "2020-02-02",   "1",      "2020-02-04",   "2",      "2021-01-08" ) %>%   mutate(     ASTDT = ymd(ASTDT),     STUDYID = "AB42"   )  ex <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~EXSDTC,   "1",      "2020-01-10",   "1",      "2020-01",   "1",      "2020-01-20",   "1",      "2020-02-03",   "2",      "2021-01-05" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  derive_vars_joined(   adae,   dataset_add = ex,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(EXSDT = convert_dtc_to_dt(EXSDTC)),   join_type = "all",   new_vars = exprs(LDRELD = compute_duration(     start_date = EXSDT, end_date = ASTDT   )),   filter_add = !is.na(EXSDT),   filter_join = EXSDT <= ASTDT,   mode = "last" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ASTDT, LDRELD) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 3 #>   USUBJID ASTDT      LDRELD #>   <chr>   <date>      <dbl> #> 1 1       2020-02-02     14 #> 2 1       2020-02-04      2 #> 3 2       2021-01-08      4

what: Join records occurring before a condition (join_type = "before")
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: arbitrary dataset subjects values "0", "-", "+" "++", value "0" derive last occurring "++" day occurs "0". AVAL.join == "++" filter_join, along order mode taking last day, identifies target records join dataset_add observation dataset. join_type = "" now used instead join_type = "". want join records occurring current observation dataset. Including AVAL == "0" filter_join ensures populate new variable records AVAL == "0" dataset.
code: myd <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADY, ~AVAL,   "1",         1, "++",   "1",         2, "-",   "1",         3, "0",   "1",         4, "+",   "1",         5, "++",   "1",         6, "-",   "2",         1, "-",   "2",         2, "++",   "2",         3, "+",   "2",         4, "0",   "2",         5, "-",   "2",         6, "++",   "2",         7, "0" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  derive_vars_joined(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(ADY),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(PREVPLDY = ADY),   join_vars = exprs(AVAL),   join_type = "before",   filter_join = AVAL == "0" & AVAL.join == "++" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, PREVPLDY) #> # A tibble: 13 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID   ADY AVAL  PREVPLDY #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    <dbl> #>  1 1           1 ++          NA #>  2 1           2 -           NA #>  3 1           3 0            1 #>  4 1           4 +           NA #>  5 1           5 ++          NA #>  6 1           6 -           NA #>  7 2           1 -           NA #>  8 2           2 ++          NA #>  9 2           3 +           NA #> 10 2           4 0            2 #> 11 2           5 -           NA #> 12 2           6 ++          NA #> 13 2           7 0            6

what: Join records occurring before a condition and checking all values in between (first_cond_lower, join_type and filter_join)
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: example , now additionally check "++" "0" results must either "+" "++". Firstly, first_cond_lower = AVAL.join == "++" used observation dataset joined records dataset_add restricted include last occurring "++" . necessary use summary function filter_join subset joined observations explained . filter_join condition used now includes (AVAL.join %% c("+", "++")) restrict joined records dataset_add values either "+" "++". order mode arguments ensure day "++" value joined. example, subject "2" selects day 2 record instead day 3, using "first".
code: derive_vars_joined(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(ADY),   mode = "first",   new_vars = exprs(PREVPLDY = ADY),   join_vars = exprs(AVAL),   join_type = "before",   first_cond_lower = AVAL.join == "++",   filter_join = AVAL == "0" & all(AVAL.join %in% c("+", "++")) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, PREVPLDY) #> # A tibble: 13 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID   ADY AVAL  PREVPLDY #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    <dbl> #>  1 1           1 ++          NA #>  2 1           2 -           NA #>  3 1           3 0           NA #>  4 1           4 +           NA #>  5 1           5 ++          NA #>  6 1           6 -           NA #>  7 2           1 -           NA #>  8 2           2 ++          NA #>  9 2           3 +           NA #> 10 2           4 0            2 #> 11 2           5 -           NA #> 12 2           6 ++          NA #> 13 2           7 0            6

what: Join records occurring after a condition checking all values in between (first_cond_upper, join_type and filter_join)
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Similar , now derive first "++" day "0" results either "+" "++". Note main difference use join_type = "", mode = "last" first_cond_upper argument, instead first_cond_lower.
code: derive_vars_joined(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(ADY),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(NEXTPLDY = ADY),   join_vars = exprs(AVAL),   join_type = "after",   first_cond_upper = AVAL.join == "++",   filter_join = AVAL == "0" & all(AVAL.join %in% c("+", "++")) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, NEXTPLDY) #> # A tibble: 13 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID   ADY AVAL  NEXTPLDY #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    <dbl> #>  1 1           1 ++          NA #>  2 1           2 -           NA #>  3 1           3 0            5 #>  4 1           4 +           NA #>  5 1           5 ++          NA #>  6 1           6 -           NA #>  7 2           1 -           NA #>  8 2           2 ++          NA #>  9 2           3 +           NA #> 10 2           4 0           NA #> 11 2           5 -           NA #> 12 2           6 ++          NA #> 13 2           7 0           NA

what: Join a value from the next occurring record (join_type = "after")
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Add value next occurring record new variable. join_type = "" essentially acts lag join variables next occurring record, mode = "first" selects first .
code: derive_vars_joined(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(ADY),   mode = "first",   new_vars = exprs(NEXTVAL = AVAL),   join_vars = exprs(AVAL),   join_type = "after" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, NEXTVAL) #> # A tibble: 13 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID   ADY AVAL  NEXTVAL #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 1           1 ++    - #>  2 1           2 -     0 #>  3 1           3 0     + #>  4 1           4 +     ++ #>  5 1           5 ++    - #>  6 1           6 -     <NA> #>  7 2           1 -     ++ #>  8 2           2 ++    + #>  9 2           3 +     0 #> 10 2           4 0     - #> 11 2           5 -     ++ #> 12 2           6 ++    0 #> 13 2           7 0     <NA>

what: Join records after a condition occurring in consecutive visits (tmp_obs_nr_var, join_type and filter_join)
title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Find last occurring value next 3 unique visit days. tmp_obs_nr_var argument can useful shown help pick records happening respect order, can see filter_join.
code: derive_vars_joined(   myd,   dataset_add = myd,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(ADY),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(NEXTVAL = AVAL),   tmp_obs_nr_var = tmp_obs_nr,   join_vars = exprs(AVAL),   join_type = "after",   filter_join = tmp_obs_nr + 3 >= tmp_obs_nr.join ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ADY, AVAL, NEXTVAL) #> # A tibble: 13 √ó 4 #>    USUBJID   ADY AVAL  NEXTVAL #>    <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 1           1 ++    + #>  2 1           2 -     ++ #>  3 1           3 0     - #>  4 1           4 +     - #>  5 1           5 ++    - #>  6 1           6 -     <NA> #>  7 2           1 -     0 #>  8 2           2 ++    - #>  9 2           3 +     ++ #> 10 2           4 0     0 #> 11 2           5 -     0 #> 12 2           6 ++    0 #> 13 2           7 0     <NA>

title: Add Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined
text: Create period reference dataset ADSL join ADAE identify within period AE occurred.
code: adsl <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~AP01SDT,     ~AP01EDT,     ~AP02SDT,     ~AP02EDT,   "1",      "2021-01-04", "2021-02-06", "2021-02-07", "2021-03-07",   "2",      "2021-02-02", "2021-03-02", "2021-03-03", "2021-04-01" ) %>%   mutate(across(ends_with("DT"), ymd)) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  period_ref <- create_period_dataset(   adsl,   new_vars = exprs(APERSDT = APxxSDT, APEREDT = APxxEDT) )  period_ref #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 5 #>   STUDYID USUBJID APERIOD APERSDT    APEREDT #>   <chr>   <chr>     <int> <date>     <date> #> 1 AB42    1             1 2021-01-04 2021-02-06 #> 2 AB42    1             2 2021-02-07 2021-03-07 #> 3 AB42    2             1 2021-02-02 2021-03-02 #> 4 AB42    2             2 2021-03-03 2021-04-01  adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ASTDT,   "1",      "2021-01-01",   "1",      "2021-01-05",   "1",      "2021-02-05",   "1",      "2021-03-05",   "1",      "2021-04-05",   "2",      "2021-02-15", ) %>%   mutate(     ASTDT = ymd(ASTDT),     STUDYID = "AB42"   )  derive_vars_joined(   adae,   dataset_add = period_ref,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   join_vars = exprs(APERSDT, APEREDT),   join_type = "all",   filter_join = APERSDT <= ASTDT & ASTDT <= APEREDT ) %>%   select(USUBJID, ASTDT, APERSDT, APEREDT, APERIOD) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID ASTDT      APERSDT    APEREDT    APERIOD #>   <chr>   <date>     <date>     <date>       <int> #> 1 1       2021-01-01 NA         NA              NA #> 2 1       2021-01-05 2021-01-04 2021-02-06       1 #> 3 1       2021-02-05 2021-01-04 2021-02-06       1 #> 4 1       2021-03-05 2021-02-07 2021-03-07       2 #> 5 1       2021-04-05 NA         NA              NA #> 6 2       2021-02-15 2021-02-02 2021-03-02       1

text: examples focus functionality specific function. examples functionality common "joined" functions like filter_join, filter_add, join_vars, ... please see examples derive_vars_joined().

title: Summarize Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined_summary
text: Deriving cumulative actual dose day adverse event ADAE dataset. USUBJID specified by_vars join ADAE ADEX dataset subject. filter_join specified restrict ADEX dataset days adverse event. ADY.join refers study day ADEX. new variable CUMDOSA defined new_vars argument. set sum AVAL. ADY ADEX used filter_join (new_vars), needs specified join_vars. join_type set "" consider records joined dataset. join_type = "" used doses day adverse event excluded.
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  adex <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADY, ~AVAL,   "1",         1,    10,   "1",         8,    20,   "1",        15,    10,   "2",         8,     5 )  adae <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~ADY, ~AEDECOD,   "1",         2, "Fatigue",   "1",         9, "Influenza",   "1",        15, "Theft",   "1",        15, "Fatigue",   "2",         4, "Parasomnia",   "3",         2, "Truancy" )  derive_vars_joined_summary(   dataset = adae,   dataset_add = adex,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   filter_join = ADY.join <= ADY,   join_type = "all",   join_vars = exprs(ADY),   new_vars = exprs(CUMDOSA = sum(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE)) ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   ADY AEDECOD    CUMDOSA #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> #> 1 1           2 Fatigue         10 #> 2 1           9 Influenza       30 #> 3 1          15 Theft           40 #> 4 1          15 Fatigue         40 #> 5 2           4 Parasomnia      NA #> 6 3           2 Truancy         NA

code: derive_vars_joined_summary(   dataset = adae,   dataset_add = adex,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   filter_join = ADY.join <= ADY,   join_type = "all",   join_vars = exprs(ADY),   new_vars = exprs(CUMDOSE = sum(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE)),   missing_values = exprs(CUMDOSE = 0) ) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   ADY AEDECOD    CUMDOSE #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> #> 1 1           2 Fatigue         10 #> 2 1           9 Influenza       30 #> 3 1          15 Theft           40 #> 4 1          15 Fatigue         40 #> 5 2           4 Parasomnia       0 #> 6 3           2 Truancy          0

title: Summarize Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined_summary
text: join_type argument can used select records additional dataset. example, join_type = "" specified, records current observation selected. join_type = "" specified, records current observation selected. illustrate , variable (SELECTED_DAYS) derived contains selected days.
code: mydata <- tribble(   ~DAY,   1,   2,   3,   4,   5 )  derive_vars_joined_summary(   mydata,   dataset_add = mydata,   order = exprs(DAY),   join_type = "before",   new_vars = exprs(SELECTED_DAYS = paste(DAY, collapse = ", ")) ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 #>     DAY SELECTED_DAYS #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 <NA> #> 2     2 1 #> 3     3 1, 2 #> 4     4 1, 2, 3 #> 5     5 1, 2, 3, 4  derive_vars_joined_summary(   mydata,   dataset_add = mydata,   order = exprs(DAY),   join_type = "after",   new_vars = exprs(SELECTED_DAYS = paste(DAY, collapse = ", ")) ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 #>     DAY SELECTED_DAYS #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 2, 3, 4, 5 #> 2     2 3, 4, 5 #> 3     3 4, 5 #> 4     4 5 #> 5     5 <NA>

title: Summarize Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined_summary
text: first_cond_lower first_cond_upper arguments can used restrict joined dataset certain range records. example, first_cond_lower specified, joined dataset restricted last observation current record condition fulfilled. Please note: condition fulfilled records, records selected. restriction implied join_type applied first. variable contained dataset dataset_add like DAY example , DAY refers value dataset DAY.join value dataset_add. illustrate , variable (SELECTED_DAYS) derived contains selected days.
code: derive_vars_joined_summary(   mydata,   dataset_add = mydata,   order = exprs(DAY),   join_type = "before",   first_cond_lower = DAY.join == 2,   new_vars = exprs(SELECTED_DAYS = paste(sort(DAY), collapse = ", ")) ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 #>     DAY SELECTED_DAYS #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 <NA> #> 2     2 <NA> #> 3     3 2 #> 4     4 2, 3 #> 5     5 2, 3, 4  derive_vars_joined_summary(   mydata,   dataset_add = mydata,   order = exprs(DAY),   join_type = "after",   first_cond_upper = DAY.join == 4,   new_vars = exprs(SELECTED_DAYS = paste(DAY, collapse = ", ")) ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 #>     DAY SELECTED_DAYS #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 2, 3, 4 #> 2     2 3, 4 #> 3     3 4 #> 4     4 <NA> #> 5     5 <NA>  derive_vars_joined_summary(   mydata,   dataset_add = mydata,   order = exprs(DAY),   join_type = "all",   first_cond_lower = DAY.join == 2,   first_cond_upper = DAY.join == 4,   new_vars = exprs(SELECTED_DAYS = paste(sort(DAY), collapse = ", ")) ) #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 #>     DAY SELECTED_DAYS #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 2, 3, 4 #> 2     2 2, 3, 4 #> 3     3 2, 3, 4 #> 4     4 2, 3, 4 #> 5     5 2, 3, 4

what: Derive weekly score if enough assessments are available
title: Summarize Variables from an Additional Dataset Based on Conditions from Both Datasets ‚Äî derive_vars_joined_summary
text: planned visit average score within week visit derived least three assessments available. Please note condition number assessments specified new_vars filter_join. number assessments within week visit counted number assessments available subject.
code: planned_visits <- tribble(   ~AVISIT,  ~ADY,   "WEEK 1",    8,   "WEEK 4",   29,   "WEEK 8",   57   ) %>%   mutate(USUBJID = "1", .before = AVISIT)  adqs <- tribble(   ~ADY, ~AVAL,      1,    10,      2,    12,      4,     9,      5,     9,      7,    10,     25,    11,     27,    10,     29,    10,     41,     8,     42,     9,     44,     5 ) %>% mutate(USUBJID = "1")  derive_vars_joined_summary(   planned_visits,   dataset_add = adqs,   by_vars = exprs(USUBJID),   filter_join = ADY - 7 <= ADY.join & ADY.join < ADY,   join_type = "all",   join_vars = exprs(ADY),   new_vars = exprs(AVAL = if_else(n() >= 3, mean(AVAL, na.rm = TRUE), NA)) ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID AVISIT   ADY  AVAL #>   <chr>   <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 1       WEEK 1     8    10 #> 2 1       WEEK 4    29    NA #> 3 1       WEEK 8    57    NA

title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: question using derive_vars_merged() powerful derive_vars_joined() comes need select observations merged. observations dataset_add merge can selected condition (filter_add) using variables dataset_add, always use derive_vars_merged() requires less resources (time memory). common example randomization date ADSL, simply merging date DS according certain DSDECOD condition DSDECOD == "RANDOMIZATION". However, selection observations dataset_add can depend variables datasets, use derive_vars_joined(). example assigning period variables ADSL ADAE, now need check adverse event start date period start end dates decide period value join.

what: Basic merge of a full dataset
title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: Merge demographic variables onto vital signs dataset. variable DOMAIN exists datasets note use select(dm, -DOMAIN) dataset_add argument. Without error issued notify user.
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) vs <- tribble(   ~DOMAIN,  ~USUBJID, ~VSTESTCD, ~VISIT,      ~VSSTRESN, ~VSDTC,   "VS",     "01",     "HEIGHT",  "SCREENING",     178.0, "2013-08-20",   "VS",     "01",     "WEIGHT",  "SCREENING",      81.9, "2013-08-20",   "VS",     "01",     "WEIGHT",  "BASELINE",       82.1, "2013-08-29",   "VS",     "01",     "WEIGHT",  "WEEK 2",         81.9, "2013-09-15",   "VS",     "01",     "WEIGHT",  "WEEK 4",         82.6, "2013-09-24",   "VS",     "02",     "WEIGHT",  "BASELINE",       58.6, "2014-01-11" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  dm <- tribble(   ~DOMAIN, ~USUBJID, ~AGE, ~AGEU,   "DM",    "01",       61, "YEARS",   "DM",    "02",       64, "YEARS",   "DM",    "03",       85, "YEARS" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  derive_vars_merged(   vs,   dataset_add = select(dm, -DOMAIN),   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID) ) %>%   select(USUBJID, VSTESTCD, VISIT, VSSTRESN, AGE, AGEU) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 6 #>   USUBJID VSTESTCD VISIT     VSSTRESN   AGE AGEU #>   <chr>   <chr>    <chr>        <dbl> <dbl> <chr> #> 1 01      HEIGHT   SCREENING    178      61 YEARS #> 2 01      WEIGHT   SCREENING     81.9    61 YEARS #> 3 01      WEIGHT   BASELINE      82.1    61 YEARS #> 4 01      WEIGHT   WEEK 2        81.9    61 YEARS #> 5 01      WEIGHT   WEEK 4        82.6    61 YEARS #> 6 02      WEIGHT   BASELINE      58.6    64 YEARS

what: Merge only the first/last value (order and mode)
title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: Merge last occurring weight subject demographics dataset. enable sorting visit date convert_dtc_to_dtm() used convert datetime, within order argument. mode argument set "last" ensure last sorted value taken. cautious NA values possible order variables - see Sort Order. filter_add argument used restrict vital signs records weight assessments.
code: derive_vars_merged(   dm,   dataset_add = vs,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(LSTWT = VSSTRESN),   filter_add = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, AGE, AGEU, LSTWT) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   AGE AGEU  LSTWT #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 01         61 YEARS  82.6 #> 2 02         64 YEARS  58.6 #> 3 03         85 YEARS  NA

title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: source records checked regarding duplicates respect variables order specified. default, warning issued duplicates found. Note results new vital signs dataset containing duplicate last weight assessment date.   investigating issue, dataset duplicate source records can obtained calling get_duplicates_dataset():   Common options solve issue: Specifying additional variables order - common approach, adding something like sequence variable. Restricting source records specifying/updating filter_add argument. Setting check_type = "none" ignore duplicates, case last occurring record chosen according sort order input dataset_add. often advisable, unless order impact result, temporary sort order can prone variation across ADaM script.
code: vs_dup <- tribble(   ~DOMAIN,  ~USUBJID, ~VSTESTCD, ~VISIT,      ~VSSTRESN, ~VSDTC,   "VS",     "01",     "WEIGHT",  "WEEK 2",        81.1, "2013-09-24",   "VS",     "01",     "WEIGHT",  "WEEK 4",        82.6, "2013-09-24" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  derive_vars_merged(   dm,   dataset_add = vs_dup,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(LSTWT = VSSTRESN),   filter_add = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, AGE, AGEU, LSTWT) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   AGE AGEU  LSTWT #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 01         61 YEARS  82.6 #> 2 02         64 YEARS  NA #> 3 03         85 YEARS  NA #> Warning: Dataset contains duplicate records with respect to `STUDYID`, `USUBJID`, and #> `convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)` #> i Run `admiral::get_duplicates_dataset()` to access the duplicate records get_duplicates_dataset() #> Duplicate records with respect to `STUDYID`, `USUBJID`, and #> `convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)`. #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 9 #>   STUDYID USUBJID convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDT‚Ä¶¬π DOMAIN VSTESTCD VISIT VSSTRESN VSDTC #> * <chr>   <chr>   <dttm>                    <chr>  <chr>    <chr>    <dbl> <chr> #> 1 AB42    01      2013-09-24 00:00:00       VS     WEIGHT   WEEK‚Ä¶     81.1 2013‚Ä¶ #> 2 AB42    01      2013-09-24 00:00:00       VS     WEIGHT   WEEK‚Ä¶     82.6 2013‚Ä¶ #> # i abbreviated name: ¬π`convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)` #> # i 1 more variable: LSTWT <dbl>

what: Modify values dependent on the merge (new_vars and missing_values)
title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: last occurring weight subject, add categorization visit occurred demographics dataset. new_vars argument, functions can utilized modify merged values. example, case want categorize visit "BASELINE" "POST-BASELINE" using if_else(). missing_values argument assigns specific value subjects matching observations - see subject "03" example.
code: derive_vars_merged(   dm,   dataset_add = vs,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(     LSTWTCAT = if_else(VISIT == "BASELINE", "BASELINE", "POST-BASELINE")   ),   filter_add = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",   missing_values = exprs(LSTWTCAT = "MISSING") ) %>%   select(USUBJID, AGE, AGEU, LSTWTCAT) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID   AGE AGEU  LSTWTCAT #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr> #> 1 01         61 YEARS POST-BASELINE #> 2 02         64 YEARS BASELINE #> 3 03         85 YEARS MISSING

what: Check existence of records to merge (exist_flag, true_value and false_value)
title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: Similar example, now prefer separate flag variable show whether selected record merged. name new variable set exist_flag argument. values new variable assigned via true_value false_value arguments.
code: derive_vars_merged(   dm,   dataset_add = vs,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   order = exprs(convert_dtc_to_dtm(VSDTC)),   mode = "last",   new_vars = exprs(     LSTWTCAT = if_else(VISIT == "BASELINE", "BASELINE", "POST-BASELINE")   ),   filter_add = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",   exist_flag = WTCHECK,   true_value = "Y",   false_value = "MISSING" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, AGE, AGEU, LSTWTCAT, WTCHECK) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID   AGE AGEU  LSTWTCAT      WTCHECK #>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>         <chr> #> 1 01         61 YEARS POST-BASELINE Y #> 2 02         64 YEARS BASELINE      Y #> 3 03         85 YEARS <NA>          MISSING

what: Creating more than one variable from the merge (new_vars)
title: Add New Variable(s) to the Input Dataset Based on Variables from Another Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged
text: Derive treatment start datetime associated imputation flags. example first impute exposure datetime associated flag variables separate first step used order argument. new_vars arguments, can see datetime date time imputation flags merged one call.
code: ex <- tribble(   ~DOMAIN, ~USUBJID, ~EXSTDTC,   "EX",    "01",     "2013-08-29",   "EX",    "01",     "2013-09-16",   "EX",    "02",     "2014-01-11",   "EX",    "02",     "2014-01-25" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "AB42")  ex_ext <- derive_vars_dtm(   ex,   dtc = EXSTDTC,   new_vars_prefix = "EXST",   highest_imputation = "M" )  derive_vars_merged(   dm,   dataset_add = ex_ext,   by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),   new_vars = exprs(TRTSDTM = EXSTDTM, TRTSDTF = EXSTDTF, TRTSTMF = EXSTTMF),   order = exprs(EXSTDTM),   mode = "first" ) %>%   select(USUBJID, TRTSDTM, TRTSDTF, TRTSTMF) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 #>   USUBJID TRTSDTM             TRTSDTF TRTSTMF #>   <chr>   <dttm>              <chr>   <chr> #> 1 01      2013-08-29 00:00:00 <NA>    H #> 2 02      2014-01-11 00:00:00 <NA>    H #> 3 03      NA                  <NA>    <NA>

what: Merge Lookup Table with Source Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged_lookup
title: Merge Lookup Table with Source Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged_lookup
text: Merge user-defined lookup table input dataset. Optionally print list records input dataset corresponding mapping lookup table.

title: Merge Lookup Table with Source Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged_lookup
code: derive_vars_merged_lookup(   dataset,   dataset_add,   by_vars,   order = NULL,   new_vars = NULL,   mode = NULL,   filter_add = NULL,   check_type = "warning",   duplicate_msg = NULL,   print_not_mapped = TRUE )

title: Merge Lookup Table with Source Dataset ‚Äî derive_vars_merged_lookup
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars argument expected dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none dataset_add Lookup table variables specified by_vars argument expected. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none by_vars Grouping variables input dataset selected observations additional dataset merged specified variables. Variables can renamed naming element, .e. by_vars = exprs(<name input dataset> = <name additional dataset>), similar dplyr joins. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value none order Sort order argument set non-null value, group first last observation additional dataset selected respect specified order. Variables defined new_vars argument can used sort order. handling NAs sorting variables see "Sort Order" section vignette("generic"). Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value NULL new_vars Variables add specified variables additional dataset added output dataset. Variables can renamed naming element, .e., new_vars = exprs(<new name> = <old name>). example new_vars = exprs(var1, var2) adds variables var1 var2 dataset_add input dataset. new_vars = exprs(var1, new_var2 = old_var2) takes var1 old_var2 dataset_add adds input dataset renaming old_var2 new_var2. Values added variables can modified specifying expression. example, new_vars = LASTRSP = exprs(str_to_upper(AVALC)) adds variable LASTRSP dataset sets upper case value AVALC. argument specified set NULL, variables additional dataset (dataset_add) added. case variable exists datasets, error issued ensure user either adds by_vars, removes renames. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value NULL mode Selection mode Determines first last observation selected. order argument specified, mode must non-null. order argument specified, mode argument ignored. Permitted values "first", "last" Default value NULL filter_add Filter additional dataset (dataset_add) observations fulfilling specified condition taken account merging. argument specified, observations considered. Variables defined new_vars argument can used filter condition. Permitted values unquoted condition, e.g., AVISIT == "BASELINE" Default value NULL check_type Check uniqueness? "warning", "message", "error" specified, specified message issued observations (restricted) additional dataset unique respect variables order. order argument specified, check_type argument ignored: observations (restricted) additional dataset unique respect variables, error issued. Permitted values "none", "message", "warning", "error" Default value "warning" duplicate_msg Message unique check uniqueness check fails, specified message displayed. Permitted values console message printed, e.g. "Attention" longer messages use paste("Line 1", "Line 2") Default value   print_not_mapped Print list unique by_vars values corresponding records lookup table? Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value TRUE
code: paste(   "Dataset {.arg dataset_add} contains duplicate records with respect to",   "{.var {vars2chr(by_vars)}}." )

title: Merge Summary Variables ‚Äî derive_vars_merged_summary
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified by_vars argument expected dataset. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none dataset_add Additional dataset variables specified by_vars variables used left hand sides new_vars arguments expected. Permitted values dataset, .e., data.frame tibble Default value none by_vars Grouping variables expressions left hand sides new_vars evaluated specified variables. resulting values merged input dataset (dataset) specified variables. Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value none new_vars New variables add specified variables added input dataset. named list expressions expected: LHS refer variable. RHS refers values set variable. can string, symbol, numeric value, expression NA. summary functions used, values summarized variables specified by_vars. example:   Permitted values list variables created exprs(), e.g., exprs(USUBJID, VISIT) Default value NULL filter_add Filter additional dataset (dataset_add) observations fulfilling specified condition taken account summarizing. argument specified, observations considered. Permitted values unquoted condition, e.g., AVISIT == "BASELINE" Default value NULL missing_values Values non-matching observations observations input dataset (dataset) matching observation additional dataset (dataset_add) values specified variables set specified value. variables specified new_vars can specified missing_values. Permitted values list named expressions created formula using exprs(), e.g., exprs(AVALC = VSSTRESC, AVAL = yn_to_numeric(AVALC)) Default value NULL
