title: Set the Value of admiral Options ‚Äî set_admiral_options
text: subject_keys Variables uniquely identify subject, defaults exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID). option used default value subject_keys argument admiral functions. Default value none signif_digits Holds number significant digits comparing numeric variables, defaults 15. option used default value  signif_dig argument admiral functions derive_var_atoxgr_dir() derive_var_anrind(). Default value none save_memory set TRUE, alternative algorithm used functions derive_vars_joined(), derive_var_joined_exist_flag(), derive_extreme_event(), filter_joined() requires less memory run-time. Default value none

title: Set the Value of admiral Options ‚Äî set_admiral_options
text: return value, called side effects.

title: Set the Value of admiral Options ‚Äî set_admiral_options
text: Modify admiral option, e.g subject_keys, automatically affects downstream function inputs get_admiral_option() called derive_param_exist_flag().

title: Set the Value of admiral Options ‚Äî set_admiral_options
code: library(lubridate) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(tibble) set_admiral_options(subject_keys = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID2))  # Derive a new parameter for measurable disease at baseline adsl <- tribble(   ~USUBJID2,   "1",   "2",   "3" ) %>%   mutate(STUDYID = "XX1234")  tu <- tribble(   ~USUBJID2,      ~VISIT,    ~TUSTRESC,   "1",       "SCREENING",     "TARGET",   "1",          "WEEK 1",     "TARGET",   "1",          "WEEK 5",     "TARGET",   "1",          "WEEK 9", "NON-TARGET",   "2",       "SCREENING", "NON-TARGET",   "2",       "SCREENING", "NON-TARGET" ) %>%   mutate(     STUDYID = "XX1234",     TUTESTCD = "TUMIDENT"   )  derive_param_exist_flag(   dataset_ref = adsl,   dataset_add = tu,   filter_add = TUTESTCD == "TUMIDENT" & VISIT == "SCREENING",   condition = TUSTRESC == "TARGET",   false_value = "N",   missing_value = "N",   set_values_to = exprs(     PARAMCD = "MDIS",     PARAM = "Measurable Disease at Baseline"   ) ) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 5 #>   STUDYID USUBJID2 AVALC PARAMCD PARAM                          #>   <chr>   <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>                          #> 1 XX1234  1        Y     MDIS    Measurable Disease at Baseline #> 2 XX1234  2        N     MDIS    Measurable Disease at Baseline #> 3 XX1234  3        N     MDIS    Measurable Disease at Baseline  set_admiral_options(signif_digits = 14)  # Derive ANRIND for ADVS advs <- tribble(   ~PARAMCD, ~AVAL, ~ANRLO, ~ANRHI,   "DIABP",     59,     60,     80,   "SYSBP",    120,     90,    130,   "RESP",      21,      8,     20, )  derive_var_anrind(advs) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 5 #>   PARAMCD  AVAL ANRLO ANRHI ANRIND #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 DIABP      59    60    80 LOW    #> 2 SYSBP     120    90   130 NORMAL #> 3 RESP       21     8    20 HIGH

Default value none ... derivation_slice() object expected slice defines subset input dataset parameters derivation. derivation called subset parameters specified args parameter args field derivation_slice() object. parameter specified , value derivation_slice() overwrites one args. text: slice derivation called subset defined filter field derivation_slice() object parameters specified args parameter args field derivation_slice() object. parameter specified , value derivation_slice() overwrites one args. Observations match one slice considered first matching slice. derivation called slices observations. Observations match slices included output dataset derivation called . also possible pass functions outside {admiral} package slice_derivation(), e.g. extension package function, dplyr::mutate(). requirement function passed derivation must take dataset first argument return dataset.

title: Execute a Derivation with Different Arguments for Subsets of the Input Dataset ‚Äî slice_derivation
code: library(tibble) library(stringr) advs <- tribble(   ~USUBJID, ~VSDTC,       ~VSTPT,   "1",      "2020-04-16", NA_character_,   "1",      "2020-04-16", "BEFORE TREATMENT" )  # For the second slice filter is set to TRUE. Thus derive_vars_dtm is called # with time_imputation = "last" for all observations which do not match for the # first slice. slice_derivation(   advs,   derivation = derive_vars_dtm,   args = params(     dtc = VSDTC,     new_vars_prefix = "A"   ),   derivation_slice(     filter = str_detect(VSTPT, "PRE|BEFORE"),     args = params(time_imputation = "first")   ),   derivation_slice(     filter = TRUE,     args = params(time_imputation = "last")   ) ) #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 5 #>   USUBJID VSDTC      VSTPT            ADTM                ATMF  #>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>            <dttm>              <chr> #> 1 1       2020-04-16 BEFORE TREATMENT 2020-04-16 00:00:00 H     #> 2 1       2020-04-16 NA               2020-04-16 23:59:59 H

title: Transform Range ‚Äî transform_range
text: source vector values transformed numeric vector expected. Default value none source_range permitted source range numeric vector containing two elements expected, representing lower upper bounds permitted source range. Default value none target_range target range numeric vector containing two elements expected, representing lower upper bounds target range. Default value none flip_direction Flip direction range? transformed values reversed within target range, e.g. within range 0 100, 25 reversed 75. Permitted values TRUE, FALSE Default value FALSE outside_range Handling values outside source range Values outside source range (source_range) transformed NA. "warning" "error" specified, warning error issued source includes values outside source range. Permitted values "NA", "warning", "error" Default value "NA"

title: Transform Range ‚Äî transform_range
text: Returns values source linearly transformed source range (source_range) target range (target_range). Values outside source range set NA.

title: Transform Range ‚Äî transform_range
code: transform_range(   source = c(1, 4, 3, 6, 5),   source_range = c(1, 5),   target_range = c(0, 100) ) #> [1]   0  75  50  NA 100  transform_range(   source = c(1, 4, 3, 6, 5),   source_range = c(1, 5),   target_range = c(0, 100),   flip_direction = TRUE ) #> [1] 100  25  50  NA   0

title: Create a tte_source Object ‚Äî tte_source
text: tte_source object used define events possible censorings.

title: Create a tte_source Object ‚Äî tte_source
code: tte_source(   dataset_name,   filter = NULL,   date,   censor = 0,   set_values_to = NULL,   order = order )

title: Create a tte_source Object ‚Äî tte_source
text: dataset_name name source dataset name refers dataset provided source_datasets parameter derive_param_tte(). Default value none filter unquoted condition selecting observations dataset events possible censoring time points. Default value NULL date variable expression providing date event censoring. date, datetime can specified. unquoted symbol expression expected. Refer derive_vars_dt() convert_dtc_to_dt() impute derive date date character vector date object. Default value none censor Censoring value CDISC strongly recommends using 0 events positive integers censoring. Default value 0 set_values_to named list returned exprs() defining variables set event censoring, e.g. exprs(EVENTDESC = "DEATH", SRCDOM = "ADSL", SRCVAR = "DTHDT"). values must symbol, character string, numeric value, expression, NA. Default value NULL order Sort order optional named list returned exprs() defining additional variables source dataset sorted date. Permitted values list variables created exprs() e.g. exprs(ASEQ). Default value order

title: Create a tte_source Object ‚Äî tte_source
text: object class tte_source

what: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
title: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
text: Open ADaM Template Script

title: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
code: use_ad_template(   adam_name = "adsl",   save_path = paste0("./", adam_name, ".R"),   package = "admiral",   overwrite = FALSE,   open = interactive() )

title: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
text: adam_name ADaM dataset name. can use available dataset names "ADAE", "ADCM", "ADEG", "ADEX", "ADLB", "ADLBHY", "ADMH", "ADPC", "ADPP", "ADPPK", "ADSL", "ADVS". dataset name case-insensitive. default dataset name "ADSL". Default value "adsl" save_path Path save script. Default value paste0("./", adam_name, ".R") package R package look templates. default "admiral". Default value "admiral" overwrite Whether overwrite existing file named save_path. Default value FALSE open Whether open script right away. Default value interactive()

title: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
text: return values, called side effects

title: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
text: Running without arguments use_ad_template() auto-generates adsl.R current path. Use list_all_templates() discover templates available.

title: Open an ADaM Template Script ‚Äî use_ad_template
code: if (interactive()) {   use_ad_template("adsl") }
